GhihvIUs9yglsyO9aaIKEw.text: If you are hungry after a long night in Vegas this is the place to go and get a slice. Good new York style pizza big slice lots of cheese and really good sauce, if you are around  the aria make sure to stop by and get a slice...or three!!

yF73J6B-QkwjfcNHSilO9g.text: Came here around 3:30 pm on 5/7 and the place was pretty empty so I sat at the bar. Asked a couple of food questions w/ the Asian bartender and the girl bartender and they both gave me short unwelcoming answers.   I had already ordered a coke but decided to leave since I felt like they were both too busy even though I was the only one at the bar. I told the girl bartender I was leaving and if I owe her anything for the coke and she told me $4.82.   Really!? I didn't even take a sip out of it. It's not about the money! My intentions were to leave a $2 tip fully expecting her to say "you don't owe anything."   I know everyone has bad days and I normally don't write bad reviews but this was ridiculous. I gave her $5 and walked away.  Horrible service! Go see Tony at Lemongrass instead! I'm a local and you definitely won't catch me here again.

RUv6FdotAUV2fAuw05Yjhg.text: Good pizza , crispy crust !   My husband and I shared a  pizza and a appetizer of warm marinated olives and all was good!  Waitress and hostess were also very accommodating!

L9V-at9vKEmKt5zzwCRUdA.text: Perfect spot to grab a slice if you are staying at Aria or happen to be in the hotel. This review is for take away only.   I was in my room, starving and wanted something quick and easy. I headed down to grab a slice and was pleasantly surprised at the selection. I went with pepperoni, pinapple and jalapeno. It was very good. I love a good slice of pizza.  The blonde girl working the counter was quick, efficient and friendly. Might have to go back to try another pie while I'm here.   Oh and as for the price .... this is vegas, everything is expensive.

VoDL33vv2EY8SQ7jCL4YfA.text: I stayed at the Aria and had the pizza twice, I had the Gotham, it had pepperoni, sausage and some other types of meat, very delicious. Its a brick oven style pizza. nice, chewy crust, sauce had awesome flavor.

va3ApgFRzHr9YVESwxh_1A.text: Totally decent NY style pizza. I think Secret Pizza at Cosmo has a better white pie, but the service and kicking beats are definitely better here.

Gw3RjL3pQNAyF8-0lMhujg.text: made reservations to dine here on new years eve so that we wouldnt get stuck in the cold on the strip for hours.  surprisingly, getting into the hotel was no issue at all. we were seated immediately and the place wasn't super crowded.  because we had a group of 8, we sat at one of the long tall tables which gives you a good overall view of the entire restaurant.  i have to admit, we were a lil bit intoxicated so we MIGHT have been slightly obnoxious, but our server was very patient with us.  i ordered the warm root vegetable salad with dressing on the side. BF had the farmstead pizza while everyone else at our table order other pizzas to share. i did have a couple pieces of my bf's pizza only because i LOVE eggs and just seeing the yummy yolks running down the sides of the slices made my mouth water.   the food was good, not completely in awe of it, especially with the price. our bill just for my bf and i came up to abut $60 (including tip) and one alcoholic beverage. everyone says "its vegas, everything is expensive" but honestly.....for pizza and salad? but at least we had a good time and good experience. would i go back again? probably not.

_-kWv0XwUcsMSCvLTfT4wg.text: Hands down the best pizza in Vegas, if not anywhere.  I can't rave enough about this place.  Rarely is there a restaurant that is a "must visit" on trips, and this is it. Whether slices to go or sit down, Five50 is where it's at.   Go for the Gotham - you won't regret it.

52cZE0Y0C9pUegaknQhE3g.text: $10.81 for ONE greasy greasy slice of cheese and a sprite...you be the judge...is it worth it for what one slice costs when you can get a whole pie for that price and its quality is pretty similar to delivery.

dFAgx6KGk4qLPzMhIp2JoA.text: You know what, after further review I do have to update my other review. I've eaten here 4 or 5 times now, and I have to say that the pizza here is actually awesome.  The gotham and the spicy one (I cant remember its name) are very delicious. They obviously use high quality ingredients, and have consistently made a delicious pizza every single time. The crust though...I never knew that crust on a pizza would make me say "wow, this crust is so good" at least 3 times per pizza. It's perfectly cooked/burnt to perfection sourdough.  The drinks are good, and the service is also very good. One thing to consider before you sit down though is that they only serve certain things at the bar, and certain things at the table. So that can be a little confusing, and really the only thing I can say is maybe not great. Other than that minor detail its all good.  The pizza is really that good.

xaA5SdFqN2L83TApMpPGFQ.text: Began with the cesar salad which was good. Great presentation, dressing wasn't overpowering. Then came the pizza, margarita, if a place can't get a regular cheese pizza right then why order anything else. Well they couldn't get it right. Still very doughy under the cheese (raw dough). Cheese at best was just standard, nothing special. If you're in the mood for Pizza, I've had great pizza at the Sugar Factory and the Cosmo. Skip this place. Expensive. Then we had the chocolate brownie mouse thingy,  it was good but they tried to get too fancy with the mason jar so it tips over, it's not a bad dessert but it's interesting flavors with the whipped cream and basil. First and only time I'll go here. I couldn't bring myself to giving this place 3 stars.

HaZ5mN6o-jGT3PHmP1PmzQ.text: Very good pizza. Shady cashier. Gave me a slice with a completely burnt crust. I asked her if there was anyway I could wait for a fresh pizza to be made. She said it would take long as they would have to run out of all the remaining slices. I was like whatever took my slice went to wash my hands and 30 seconds later came back to see a brand new pizza replacing the initial one with burnt slices. When I asked her if I could swap slices, she started giving me attitude, and coming up with all kinds of excuses.  Not the business

KsZJPNvB9hQxzMH8S5wALQ.text: This was my second time visiting Five50 today for lunch, and it validated why I decided to come back.   The pre-built pizza selections are yummy. Gotham. Get the Gotham if you want to know what delicious, meaty pizza is. You can also build your own if none of the options tickle your fancy.  The draft beer selection is plentiful, and they have a full bar too.  The waitress was a treat, as was the rest of the staff, from the hostess all the way to the manager on duty. I enjoyed my visit and will be returning.

ykVIrxXG6QVElmkGuneUMQ.text: Unless you have 25-30 minutes to wait for a pizza, don't eat here.   Wine & beer selection is decent, but the pizza is not worth the wait.   Grab a to-go slice if you need something quick.

-vWZm8rYJHa-QkkQXL0Zsg.text: This is for the pizza to go portion of the restaurant.  The pizzas are supposed to be a quick gourmet pizza, so don't expect to find your typical toppings aside from just pepperoni. There were maybe 4-5 options. The pizzas themselves were just meh. The crust was not that thin and crunchy. For a better late night pizza, secret pizza at the Cosmo is a much better option. Also, the line moves sooo slow.

KEr83BhJfNsMe40MQ1X2qQ.text: The hostess dropped the menus off at the table and walked away before I could even ask for a high chair for my one year old.  After ordering an appetizer and receiving it we had to wait 20 minutes to order our main course. The waiter would check in every 20 min or longer.  The food was good hence the 2 star rating. Maybe the service was poor due to us bringing a child with us?

ssNEvvNp6LOn_n9lqu7GVw.text: Items Selected:  Pepperoni Arancini- Rice Balls, Red Sauce and Roasted Garlic Aioli  Pigs and Truffles- Pork Shoulder Cannelloni, Bordeaux Spinach, Bechamel and Summer Truffles  North Beach- Clams, Smoked Mozzarella, Sweet Onions, Oregano  Blanca- Mozzarella, Ricotta, Bel Paese, White Chedder, Olive Oil, Garlic, Basil   Truffle- Truffle Salami, Bechamel, Parmesan, Thyme, Shaved Truffles  Margherita- Tomato, Buffalo Mozzarella and Basil  Warm Apple Pie - White Cheddar, Oatmeal Streusel, Smoke Salted Mascarpone Ice Cream  Crispy Sourdough Fritters - Winter Spiced Cranberry Sauce, Orange Glaze  A fan of Shawn McClain dating to his Chicago days and a truly impressive experience at Sage it was with high hopes that our party of four paid a visit to upscale pizza parlor Five50 after the disaster that was Yellowtail and while I personally enjoyed the experience more than my companions it would be exceedingly difficult for me to recommend a $30/pp pizzeria with awkward service as a place to visit in a city where far better pie can be found off-strip at a fraction of the price.  Featuring a slice counter plus a handful of primi, pasta, salads, and desserts alongside 16" pizzas cooked in a 550 degree oven the "style" of McClain's signature pies falls somewhere between traditional New York slices and a Roman lightly-leavened 'crunchy' crust but with ingredient quality meeting the standards set by Sage the results were largely impressive save for the excessive use of oil and salt marring the Truffle and an unannounced red sauce lending a peculiar barbecue note to the North Beach.  Faring better, a simple Margherita assuredly displayed the restaurant's sourcing with tangy tomatoes and fresh basil while the Blanca shined largely to a thick dollop of house-made ricotta on each slice.  Moving past pizza, a sampling of the cannelloni proved to be my favorite savory of the day, albeit slightly overpriced at $18 for two pasta tubes stuffed with tender pork and topped with creamy Bechamel plus meager truffle shavings while a trio of arancini presented a unique riff on a classic by substituting house cured pepperoni for traditional sausage and pairing it with thick, aromatic aioli.  Never happy to leave a restaurant without dessert, a final pairing arrived at the table in the form of a small apple pie with accoutrements both sweet and savory alongside fried brioche cubes paired with sour cranberry sauce; both sweets trumping any of the savories and a saving grace at the end of a meal that fell short of high expectations.

Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle and Blanca
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. North Beach and Margherita

DxA5sJoO_QkGXlfficKmOA.text: Okay so really the pizza here isn't bad..but it is expensive.  So why not pay a few dollars more and get the truffle since all the pizzas are around the same price.  So I did like that there was a good truffle flavor (I think they toss some truffle oil to enhance the flavor), however there is wayyy too much cheese.  I felt so gross eating, and definitely exceeded by fat content for the week.  If you do decide to try this, I recommend just getting a slice, rather than an entire pizza like we did.

-0Dxra4Yt2UOkSyhRGioOQ.text: Have been to Vegas a couple of times in the past year, and each time my girlfriend and I enjoyed checking out the City Center area and all it has to offer. We bought tickets to see the Cirque Du Soleil Zarkana show at Aria. After the show we stumbled upon Five50 nestled away in a back corner on the lobby level of the hotel. The restaurant received some good reviews on Yelp, so we decided to check it out. Now Five50 is our go-to pizza spot!  It is labeled as a "casual pizza experience," but the ambience of the hotel and restaurant add to its charm. As you walk into the restaurant, there is a long counter that acts as an extension of the kitchen. Here you can place to go orders for pizza and other items. There are also tables just outside the restaurant where you can stand and eat your pizza for a quicker dining experience. The restaurant has definite character and personality. A long curved wall of wooden blocks stacked on top of each other separate the diners from the rest of the hotel/casino. Behind the restaurant is the sports book room where sports junkies can get their fix and gamble on events. There is a circular bar located in the center of the restaurant, along with tv's for your viewing pleasure. The service was a little hit and miss, but overall decent.   The menu offers eclectic pizza choices such as the truffle pizza (I would recommend this!), soups/salads, and pastas. The pizza is prepared fresh and cooked perfectly. Five50 offers a unique casual pizza experience with good food, and all the benefits of a Vegas establishment.

XSY2H2MSTl2oahP7QSaFwQ.text: Many of the small plates seem like they can be shared. Some are filling enough to be lunch on their own. The meatballs are beef/veal mix and are savory in a slightly sweet sauce. Best meatballs I've had in a while. Definitely recommend if you're in Aria.

Ib58RMYZBUGrauJL_RV6Qg.text: Nothing great, but when you're tired from walking all over Vegas and want something savory and cargo loaded it'll do the trick! Anthony R. and I shared a slice of the Forger & Gotham. The Forager with whipped ricotta was creamy & packed with salty goodness(mushrooms are a pizza favorite for me). I enjoyed it more than the Gotham...it wasn't quite the meat lovers best:) All in all...nice quick grub in Aria.

A9jeiRiq8RwKqqZGJAz7Zw.text: My good friends family brought me and my husband here once. Very nice area, expensive pizza but never hurt to try! Blanca is not bad. Good place for family or group of friends.

sVvAE9uhTx6y9ENFDkqVxQ.text: The truffle pizza is the best pizza I've ever had in my entire life. Get it. You will be blown away.

qsHyx0jzFpka0AmWGJZcJg.text: Nothing makes me happier thatn pizza and a nice bottle of Italian wine. Five50 Pizza  has both. Really happy to have a casual dining pizza option in the Aria. General Manager Micah came over to our table to ensure everthing was going well. Super hospitable! We definitely will be back next time in Vegas!

B_6LjsmUz393rFrPE7CMrA.text: We had the north beach style pizza and it was really good. Pina colada shake was good too but not the orange shake. Service is ok, not too friendly servers or receptionist.   Food are on the pricey side. Our pizza took so long so the manager brought it to our table and served our first slice. Because of that, instead of 2, I'm giving this place 3 stars.

0bGKNsAHSMiS2D_qCOC4kw.text: Honestly, i am surprised by some of the reviews...   Great food. Great service. Jason was our server and made our experience very fun! Great price point for the strip as well.   We will be back!

g6rWkMeGBfNQCcs2n6oieg.text: My boyfriend and I spent  Super Bowl Sunday here. What amazing service and food! I highly recommend taking a stop by if you are at Aria. We loved the pizza so much we saved a few slices for our flight home.

ArsGQIQ04OWwSPB3RS_dMQ.text: If you are looking for the best pizza on the Vegas strip, look no further than the Five50 Pizza Bar in Aria. It's located near the sports book not far from the poker room. The place is named for the temperature the chef believes is perfect for pizza. These are big New York-style slices of pizza with ample toppings, plenty of cheese and a zesty sauce in just the right amount. If you're looking for a quick lunch, you can order by the slice right at the counter and have your food in just minutes. Like I said, it's the best pizza I've had in Vegas and I doubt you'll be disappointed.

MFhh38aYF6cBRDrsu4dtiQ.text: Craving pizza in Vegas is a tough position to be in because there seem to be a bunch of low end, quick options but not quality picks. We were really satisfied by the unique combinations available here and the high quality of the ingredients that they used on the pizzas. The server was very attentive and friendly and there was actually a small selection of craft beer of tap (a rarity in Vegas, where cheap beer and yards of icy drinks are the norm). Sadly, we discovered this at ghe

r-1cofrGflkM0yNSIgT0IA.text: Dinner 7/14 Ordered the shaved pork belly  for starters. Highly recommended. Then went with the Gotham Pizza. Pick off the sausage first then devoured the pizza. Solid meal. Like anything in Vegas it's overpriced but you can't go wrong. Good selection of draft beers as well. I'd go with the Ballast Point, Calico Amber. The service was stellar as well.

Yw2Fy8Q8p2KNLdVC2pG5cQ.text: Soooooo good but server was eh.  Something we ordered came with marinated olives and I didn't know, so when I ordered olives,  she should have said something.   BTW, they come warm.  I'm not used to that.  I prefer cold.

Zc4AzhXDEEphfF5qnSOlrQ.text: Good food and service! :) will recommend and come back when I visit. If u haven't been here, should try it out. Music and ambiance is laid back and casual. Good for a quick bite or hanging out with friends and fam.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom pizza. Basil, meatball, eggplant, onions. Delish!

LtacvUBRPZ1eDFItsgoW5g.text: Very good pizza.  It's very pricy, but hey, you're at the Aria.  If you're expecting cheap pizza, order Domino's.  All the ingredients worked together perfectly.  My wife and I ordered the Forager to take back to our room at the Vdara.  The pizza took about half an hour to cook.  If you want just a slice, they sell massive slices for $5.50.  That's probably what we will do next time.  Ordering a whole pizza is just too much for two people.  We were both starving and still had about a quarter of the pie left when we were stuffed.  Expect to pay 25-35 dollars for a to-go pizza.  Again, it's great pizza, but don't expect it to be cheap.

fU1hrIKdWrq_yliuzLp0ww.text: The pizza here was good, but not worth the money. For the price I really expected something different. The pizza was very basic nothing really speacial. It was good but too simple for the price.

NqXqPrQZuN99_YVsp-UPJQ.text: Was a bit skeptical of this place at first but it is really fantastic. Well flavored pizza cooked well not soggy or easily falling apart. Love their cocktail list and their garlic cheese bread. Good and quick service only thing would be is that it is slightly overpriced.

3q6wPo32d0yeg422taZQNg.text: Best pizza I've ever had. We were seated right away too which was nice. The only thing I didn't like was the garlic bread. The toppings had to be peeled off for it to even be decent. I didn't have mushrooms on my pizza, but my boyfriend did and he said it ruined his. My side was plain cheese. Mmmmmm

9dNGURnPuyLmsiUKYanb0g.text: Had half pepperoni and half forager with egg added.ordered it well done and were very happy when it came out extra crispy. The f orager was absolutely delicious with the added egg and would definitely order it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half pepperoni double extra cheese and half forager with egg

316BSP6ryxZU79EZjVnTBw.text: Yeesh, my second visit to this place bared little resemblance to the first. Most polarizing was the service. Our server was nice enough, but she was completely clueless (forgetting multiple things) and ever so slow (with a section that was not full). Additionally, the quality of the pizza was not up to the same high standards of the first visit. I will probably give this joint another chance, but will be much more reluctant now.

O2w06amrnHJfiotkq3llkg.text: So I don't eat cheese nor pork. I asked if they can make me a pesto pizza with tofu cheese and they had no pesto nor tofu cheese. Non of their sausages are made of chicken.  Can a lactose intolerant and allergic to pork person be considered next time. :/ service was ok, on of the girls didn't know that cheese came cow.

ghyQYIcK3s9Y8uhemj9eiA.text: I like! Keep in mind this is based on eating a slice at 2am while half crocked, but what a slice it was - perfectly charred crust, gooey quality mozzarella, right amount of sauce and hot out of their brick oven!

811nrwFQj2jTF_HuSbOaUQ.text: Great pizza! No ice for my bourbon and it's 25 a pour Waiter never came back after food was served!

PPBUsCt7ljKj-KfnbMpMNA.text: This is the best pizza on the strip. We missed it the first time in Vegas because it is tucked away inside the casino. We made it a goal to find it the 2nd time around. The price was reasonable and we were able to split a pizza for under $15 per person.

XnCDM5TGobGwIkYJkL_CEw.text: The perfect meal after a long night on the strip. Definitely gave me life after all the drinking  The garlic bread- literally heaven on a plate. I could have eaten that all day!

ioyAHoHTR2DNB4O6UXg2bQ.text: Awesome pies... take out counter... by the slice...  Didn't eat in the dining room, but the slices from the take-out counter were phenomenal.    Dat forager doe

ron3BsssF9o4-8Wwc0YtxA.text: Pizza by the slice is Vegas, this place is hard to beat. I love Aria and having this great quick place to grab a bite makes it my go to place on the strip.

S6iir4vp4GOPDgvyTJY7CA.text: Stopped by here because the original restaurant we wanted to eat were over booked and seeing that we needed some food before hitting the club we ran across Five50. We also noticed that we didn't have time to dine in and opted to order slices togo while watching the raiders game.   The slices of these pizza, a nice greasy thin large slices was full of flavor and the prices were pretty good for what you get. they have a little round tables if you want to eat your slices right there and the crushed peppers and cheese is right next to the register.  Avoid getting beer and water like everywhere in vegas regular water is $5.00 and corona is $8 yikes, but not the fault of the business itself.

ugOxl_yNcJr-gVLNdQnCAg.text: By-the-slice pizza places are a dime a dozen on the Strip: they're great for solo travelers and budget-minded folk alike, clocking in anywhere from $6-12/person for a meal and offering plenty of variety. Unfortunately, quality is usually on par with your local mall food court.   Five50 is different. Not only is it easy to find within the casino (straight through the lobby on the left from the parking garage), but it's priced cheap ($5.50 a slice including specialty styles) but doesn't taste like it. On any given day, there are four featured pies available by the slice: the Gotham (meat heavy), Forager (cheese and mushrooms), a cheese-only version, and a featured daily special.   if by the slice isn't for you, they also offer an extended menu of whole pies, along with salads, sandwiches, shakes, and small plates. But their pizza is obviously the highlight.

anBmyBH0e7rdfnjj5qtbqw.text: We ate at Five 50 Pizza when we stayed at the Aria and have visited every time I've gone back to Vegas. Try the Godfather if you like peperoni and sausage. I'm from New York and consider myself a pizza snob. I think this is the best pizza I've ever eaten!!!!

pjrnonRtKW8pwBZrP1lgRQ.text: Really yummy pizza! The service was really friendly too. They helped my cousin and I find good clubs to go to and even gave us a site to sign ourselves up for free guest lists.

KL6HSMaXEnHW7DIUq4LmIQ.text: I always go here for a white pizza slice and a beer. I prefer to sit at the bar as it is more lively and I get my beer prompte.  The pizzas here are outstanding, especially the white sauce ones.   Only thing, beers are $9 which is a bit much, even for a Norwegian used to such prices.

hCAcwzRzAkWi0ZJFkzYn-w.text: Food is amazing! I would recommend the garlic knots for sure! Tried the s'mores shake and it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uEvkJ7Mx-skWP_M0QB7I6Q.text: Great food!  The hot wings were among the best we have ever eaten.  They are fried and then baked to get a beautiful candy-like crust.  The meat lover pizza was amazing and the service from Gil was the best our whole trip.  Don't miss out on this place while in town.  We will be back whether or not we stay at the Aria again or not...

N6jndTdyF8NXQZeIOjuu6w.text: Pizza is ok. But that chicken wings are on fire.  Imo best wings in vegas.  How much do u have to write so that this thing im writing becomes a freakin revoew rather than a comment.

qU-H-UKbi_Xm6c-iEc5x8w.text: The pizza here is superb. Big portions and a perfect amount of cheese. I ordered the chicken wings as an appetizer and they were spicy and crispy and delicious. I also got the avocado toast which was not very good. I also ordered a pepperoni pizza which was top notch. Great vibes and great food.

SWKwOQB9mpRH1N4Ip9jVWQ.text: This is a pricey pizza joint & the service we had wasn't great which is why it's not getting 5 Stars. But the food was fantastic! They do wood fire pizza right! We got the margarita pizza and it's perfect for 2 people!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fPn_wVeVfoUh6TTC_-xdiQ.text: Gave it a try again, this time my wife and I really enjoyed it, seems the sauce is no longer spicy.  Great for a quick bite if you are staying at Aria.

vjiGJFAX1hzJI-KU_osoKw.text: Not Great and Too Expensive.  Arrived in town Starving!  Heard the pizza here was good but wanted to sit down to a meal, the dark haired little twit at the hostess stand said we could only get a slice at the ToGo stand or at the bar.  I told her we wanted a meal and could we have a booth, "No", she said, we are really busy so we only have booths for parties of 4.  What the Hell?  We should have asked for the manager at this point, don't these people realize WE are paying their salaries?  I ordered a pasta bowl, iced tea and a beer...which came to $37, Really? for a bowl of pasta?  We tried a slice on the way out which was very good but this place has WAY too many rules.  Get some better people to host and wait on folks!

il5rC8CEAnqvrBTlPCilaQ.text: We sat at the bar la st night for a slice and a beer. The servers here are always friendly and willing to provide an opinion on what is good that day. The pizza never disappoints even the plain pepperoni pizza is so much better than what we get at home. We also tried a boozy shake, the s'mores, and that was a perfect end to the evening. I liked sitting at the bar as we got to watch all the drinks being made and that bartender was amazing. She was everywhere doing so many things but still completely friendly and not rushed while talking to you. Amazing place with great service!

qKfMNtvFuoilVHACi3KSag.text: After a late night in Vegas, this place was heaven sent! With no where being open that late and a bunch of people lining up to eat here, it seemed like a great choice. The pizza reminded me of a lot of the pizzas I've had in New York. I ordered the Forager pizza: white sauce, spinach, mushrooms and whipped ricotta. With a finishing touch of red pepper flakes, it was amazing! One slice was definitely enough for me, but it was so good I could've ate a second slice! If I'm ever craving a great pizza in Vegas, I know where to go now!

Rcq_AIRtOGGj3h2JlzvWKw.text: Five50 pizza was a convenient place to go.  So I made three dinner visits. Twice I had a dish that was half order spaghetti and half order meatball; which I learned about from one of the nice waitresses behind the bar.  Strangely, the menu only has spaghetti or meatballs but not both.  The sauce was perfectly spiced and meatballs delicious.  Here's where the points get docked: I also ordered slices of pizza. And on two visits, the pepperonis were hard like poker chips.  I would assume that the slices had been prescribed strong light therapy under a heat lamp and then was reheated for my order.  And in contrast to the pokeronis, the dough was soggy towards the wedge.  This was supposed to be a pizza restaurant, not 7-11.

Q0NGjd7mwOJ12WYDofQKOg.text: Outstanding dining option for a great slice of pizza (quick snack) or whole pie (lunch) at the Aria. The location is clean, bright and the food quality is amazing. When looking at the Aria- this is a great place to go. The pizza is top quality (not the frozen tasting option in the horrible Aria buffet). The value is competitive and the service of a quick ready to eat meal is great. Thanks Five50 Pizza Bar for being a fantastic option at the Aria.

uKM9PQjwjsmUJxTowFwSUA.text: Overpriced. Did I just pay $30 for a soggy, excessively-oily pizza? Ugh. Also, service was as slow as a snail. Not worth the visit, trust me.

SAM5VfRcKSlzV2Mw5BhsLQ.text: Our waiter was great I believe his name was Wissan. He made some great recommendations and told us we can do half and half on the pizza. It is a little expensive but great pizza and service.

nOnxGCVQ_rFxFxWEmkG-OQ.text: In town for a conference and wanted a casual lunch. It had TVs that were playing the NCAA basketball tournament which was an added bonus. Good shakes and really good pizza. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here if staying further from the hotel but it's perfect when you are staying at Aria.

v9mMQPtRm3Wf7aZR7URXaA.text: OK You will pay about $30 for a pizza. Kind of crazy, but you are in a casino-hotel. It is very good. We split one with half classic cheese and tomato and half with truffles. This is a good pie. I enjoyed it, and I am a pizza snob. The small plates for starters are good. They are just REALLY small for the three people. Good place. Nice service. No complaints!

pA74dDtYMBNyf2zkoopPxg.text: This is for the take out pizza bar area.  I visit once or twice every trip and I have to say (even compared to NYC pizza) it's very good. I enjoy the plain cheese pizza and the Forager (white sauce, mushrooms, ricotta and spinach). Just be prepared-in the take out area it can get busy and rushed. I often take my slices into the sports book right next door and enjoy.   There are no prices posted at the take out area, but it's easy to remember: Each slice cost FIVE50.

fQ479x1J7c5HkZn5-pBK2Q.text: I got the Gotham pizza to go. It costs $32 (comped).  When I picked up a slice, the ingredients started dripping off the pizza because the crust is paper thin.  So thin that my pizza was pointing downwards as I tried to eat it.  I had to use a fork to pick up my food.  Overall the pizza is very greasy and not as tasty as Papa John's for triple the price.  Next time, I will just use my comps on that new burger joint next to the poker room.

UWwVSnfkh7v3rAIDQHc73w.text: Went here for lunch today and had the margarita pizza. It was good. Alittle small. I gave them 3 stars because we had a employee that needed to charge his phone so he plugged in next to us. Really not cool.

TlwvrP77wZDArTMO11Cd1w.text: A good choice for lunch or dinner in the casino area of the Aria - the $18 prix fixe lunch is, for casino dining, a good deal, with a choice of soup or salad and an individual pie, and it's plenty of food for one person.  The pizza is not quite New York style - it's a little thicker, but it's got the right char and bubbles.  The puffy, chewy garlic knots are a good starter, too.  Service was very good as well.  If you're looking for real New York pizza and cheap slices, take the walk to Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan, but Five50 is a good choice if you want a little more than just pizza.

CO3B2NiPcoDOaSq44IJTxQ.text: Exactly the kind of pizza we were after.  Think they call it East Coast style.  Finding a sit down pizza restaurant was harder than expected in Vegas so we had to pay a small premium. The beer selection is also good so can't really think of any reason to not give it 5 stars.  We had the Margherita and a the Gotham.

Sii9y9VAaq2CW7p8x8Cd0A.text: I had free $200 food and beverage credits linked to my room, and we had to use them at Aria, so we decided on Five50.  We had a party of ten, and were told to wait fifteen minutes.  When she finally announced that the table was ready, we were led to a round table in a secluded area, and were seated.  The reason why we waited fifteen minutes is beyond my knowledge, for the restaurant probably had less than ten diners excluding us.    Upon much contemplation, we agreed upon ordered four pizzas, and two pasta dishes to share.  The pizzas were the margherita, gotham, truffle, and north beach.  The pastas included the ricotta cavatelli, and a secret dish, not on the menu, which featured freshly arrived clams, and linguine.  The pizzas and pastas came out fairly quickly.  The pizzas were all very tasty, my favorite being the truffle and margherita.  One does not get to eat real truffles every day, so they were a welcome treat.  The margherita had a sweet and savory sauce, and the cheese was equally appealing to the palate.  However, the pastas, lacked anything they would deem them of a worthy restaurant quality dish.  The cavatelli was overpowered with a sour and salty lime taste that went into every spoonful.  On the other hand, the secret pasta lacked any flavor at all.  It was bland, and very oily.    -1 star for the disappointing pastas.   +4 stars for the excellent service and great tasting pizzas.

wQQ2x9wyzMwJxhFvA1t5Tg.text: Love the quick pick-up slice station. It's great for picking up a delicious slice on your way back up to your room.  Nice to have choices on a single slice other than pepperoni or cheese. The Forager and Blanca were some of the best slices I ever had.  Terrific crust and tasty toppings!

3E25Tcmnt0QtlFlVQWBYpw.text: The Gotham pizza is the best! Their sauce is mildly sweet and I couldn't get enough. The whole slice just kept me wanting more! I know this is a heated debate... but pineapple does belong on pizza and I was disappointed to learn they didn't offer this as s topping choice.

U9LkHMcfp6CT4x2HZsaYXg.text: Spot has a cool vibe. I'd like to come back and just have some beers and watch a game. I enjoyed the pizza and chicken salad. Would write a better review and take more pics, but we were too busy enjoying the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n5O23gYCSlQSr8OReOI0xw.text: 3 stars because I'm split..the pizza is pretty good, very tasty and good texture with generous toppings.. The bad? The slice Cost $5 and is paper thin. Even worse? A can of sprite is $4.50! Are you really serious? Pizza is good and worth the 5 spot, just don't order a can of soda. Out of control

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 meat pizza

7lBY_WZuNYXN-5prLyGgpg.text: Met a girlfriend for dinner. It is located in the Aria, right next to the sportbook. I rarely go into CC due to it being so difficult getting in to, but meeting my friend was totally worth it. I came in on a Friday, during a very stormy monsoon out on the Strip, As soon as I showed up Valet had to be closed due to the lightning and heavy rain. then I went into the self parking. The walk is a little long getting in there, but the food made-up for the long walk.  Now to the food, I was impressed with this upscale pizza place! It had a fun vibe, and the decor was very nice. I tried the polenta with egg! YUMZ!  For a salad we shared a beet, peach, frisee and hazelnut composition. Beets and peaches! Can't go wrong!  My favorite was a bread with cheese and garlic sauce! I ate like 3 pieces! Carb overload right?   The pizza was amazing, I believe it was the Gotham. Pepporoni and sausage. I absolutely loved the crust. It was chewy and crunchy at the same time, and you can just tell there's something different in the water they use. It couldn't have been Vegas water. We don't have crust that good with the water from the faucets in town. Idk what the secret is, but I loved it.  For dessert we shared an ice cream sandwich and chocolate custard w lavender. The custard was yumz! Got thicker the further down you went:)  Not too impressed w the sandwich.   The place is friendly and casual, still with a nice ambience. It was child friendly as well.  It was nice to see Chef Shawn putting his finishing touches on the pizzas and other dishes.

favSJJJQ3TxzlZt7xt6riw.text: Came here after finishing the Patriots/Colts game...the place was crowded for the mlk weekend so the wait was about 20 mins...service was super slow the entire night!!! the server was night but he could not attend to us often enough...our drinks were always empty the food came out slow, it was hard to flag him down, it wasnt a good night...we asked for the channel to be changed to a UFC fight since the football game was over and it took over 30 mins to get it to change even with other tables requesting the same channel.   onto the food - Not that Great !!!  prices were average for being inside a nice casino..but i thought the 24 hour Aria cafe had better food than here. The pizza is much better than Pieology but far from Grimaldis.   The spaghetti was pretty good but we wanted to add meatballs and its 6.00 to add each meatball so the dish came out over 20+.

oMQOUxCDTHw1jk_guORnGA.text: My review is based on my experience with the management, not the food. The food is just ok, nothing to write home about. Secret pizza at Cosmo is better.  The manager on duty failed to do his duties when I requested him to call security to come assist me when I was being harassed by a drunk belligerent man while in line. I felt unsafe and wanted security to come but the manager NEVER CALLED them. He in fact lied to me saying that they were too busy to assist me. I spoke to security later on that night and they told me they never received a call.   SHAME ON YOU manager on duty Sunday 1:30AM for lying about calling security.

l6WVv_4O0KswqOuWW79uhg.text: This was a 10! A+ for everything, food, service, price. I've read and ate most rated pizza in Vegas and this 5/50 was amazing. I told John our server he was great and so was the pizza! Brick oven pizza, thin and crisp, enough said. We lived in Northern Italy 6 years and 5/50 is as close as you get. We had a slice at hidden pizza last night which was good but not like 5/50. A 10 folks, A++. Enjoy and thank you John!

ZCDwpLIuPjQlTqQ8mx2ovQ.text: Over saturated pizza had to be consumed with a knife and fork. Limp and overloaded... Absolutely impossible to handle, a sure sign the crust and proportion of toppings was all wrong. At $10 a slice it needs to be perfect. Just like the over-engineered Aria hotel where it is located, everything is massive overkill. Sometimes less is more.

41vt3VIwxHoXJPcDztUg5w.text: One of the best pizza places We have been to Five50 multiple times since coming to Las Vegas and we have never been disappointed. Their selection is perfect, had multiple pizzas from the menu and have loved every single one.   The only thing I wish was available is that they could deliver to guest staying at the hotel.

r0IxLM73AoF-6B0ChbpjXA.text: I wasn't impressed. I ordered a wedge salad which came with a pesto dressing. Green on green isn't good for the presentation plus it just wasn't a good combination. The garlic knots were decent and the pizza wasn't anything that blew my socks off. With the Las Vegas prices I ended up spending $40 to $50.

K3VEBGEs3DppzQurcrgOXg.text: We ordered the pepperoni pizza. The crust was nice and crispy. The service from Marisela was excellent. We've experienced some sub-par service in Vegas, but not here!  Good beer selection, too. There were a few local selections. I had the golden knight.

PEmMFoKlDbPAeUsiUZVu2w.text: Great late night slice of pizza and a beer.  Don't do the meatball sandwich.  Service was good and very convenient for our party.  Thanks

xXA6PG6w_NpBRK3LciM5Ow.text: Great late night snack or hangover cure! It was extremely convenient when we needed food asap. I tried three different pieces of pizza and they were all very tasty. I agree with everyone else, the pizza is a bit pricey but you'll enjoy every bite.

eqc2eEdjNWdZNtSWWIkpLw.text: It's the perfect snack during the night if you get hungry. Good pizza. Portion is huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ptZQ23W81wjGQy56IBYTCg.text: Had slices at the bar.  Place was nice, service was fast and friendly.  Their Gotham pizza was the best pizza I've ever had.  Perfectly crunchy, filled with delicious grease, dripping with cheese, served just hot enough to smell and taste delicious, not far too hot like most places, or cold like delivery or takeout.  Guys, please open a place here in San Diego.  There are lots of unoccupied bars and restaurants in Gaslamp.

4lE6hM0PQmRiAfzp1EHVzQ.text: No gluten free pizza options and they don't start serving anything but pizza until 1130. They refused to make a salad for the two gluten free people in our group of 14......just horrible customer service for people who cannot eat gluten. Asked if we could bring a salad over so we could eat with our friends and they refused. Just not the service you expect in  Vegas or the best first impression of aria.   You need to cater to your patrons and be flexible. I mean, how hard is it to make a salad?!?!

C5P_1WcmauHYpBnj7shfGQ.text: Get the Gotham if you like meat on your pizza.  It's really good. The service was very good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you want good pizza go to Five50!

pmjXlY_0LHBwlXi9wuVQRQ.text: No complaints, good northeast wood fired flare on the pizza. All small bites are sure to please as well.

6NUj3W4Feg_ofvV7YPYU7A.text: This is a sitdown pizza restaurant located inside Aria. I gave this place four stars because it has what you need from a good pizza place. If you're looking for just slices they have some to go however they do not offer slices of pizza when you sit down in the restaurant.   The pizzas are hefty and good sized, enough for 2 people (maybe even more depending how much you eat). We ordered the Catania which is a pizza with white sauce, Italian sausage and tomato. I personally really liked this pizza. It came out nice and hot with a slightly charred thin crust and an abundance of cheese. The white sauce made the top of the pizza have a creamier texture, so you get the crispy texture from the crust along with the softness of the cream all in the same bite. The markings of a good pizza.   We are also ordered the chicken wings for an appetizer. The wings were dressed with flavor. Had a little kick to it but it was sort of a sweet and spicy type of dressing. Came out with a little bit of ranch for dipping. I could have done without the wings. Anyway, overall four stars all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings

6FnipD83BvthlWqODx8ofw.text: The most delightful New York style pizza in Las Vegas. Highly recommended pizza from someone that could live off of pizza 3 meals a day / 365 days a year. Great for a late night dinner after a show, a quick snack, or to just hang out with friends in a trendy place. They have a full bar and menu selection to please even the pickiest of eaters.   For the fellas that line pizza as much as I do, I'd suggest ordering an extra appetizer or two - this way you have leftovers to put in your fridge (most rooms in the Aria or Vdara have a fridge in the room) / snack for later on.   This pizza joint is located with in the Aria resort, just off of the casino floor. There is a very warm feeling (ambiance) when you walk in.  You have two ways of ordering. Either through their To Go window or via a Sit Down dining experience. I've done both.   Servers are fun and really seem to enjoy being there. No pressure to order anything fancy, the way you sometimes feel at Vegas restaurants.   This pizza is simply amazing.   A number of the other reviews are critical of this place because of the price. If you are used to paying $10 for a Dominos pizza, then you will be surprised. But if you enjoy treating yourself / your family to something special, this is the place for you.

LKlI0pXqKEtxgaBlz1cHlg.text: There's a dine in and a to-go option. I got a slice to go.   There were only 4 options, at 6.50 each. The pizza was good overall..lots of flavor, but the service was weird. A line formed behind me as the cashier took a phone order, which took awhile, due to the customer, but we waited a few minutes before a manager came out to assist, but by then the call was done. Surely this probably doesn't happen often, but still.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iGGrVXxsv0YoJZ-WGMRYnA.text: Came on a whim and wouldn't want to come back to Vegas without returning. Chicken Noodle Soup (the soup of the day) was one of the best I've had, and was super flavorful. Pizza was hot, fresh, and delicious. Our waitress was an absolute sweetheart and recommended the AMAZING milkshake, made with ice cream they make there! Overall, we had an absolutely phenomenal experience and can't wait to come back!

BTixpYOZ4oChx-gbX5vfDA.text: Nice ambiance and excellent service.   We got a chopped salad and cheese pizza for dinner.   The chopped salad was a little on the small side but delicious. We substituted avocado for salami and they were very happy to make the change for us.   The pizza is delicious.  Heavy sauce and dare I say it too much good quality cheese.  I could have done with maybe 30% less cheese. The crust was where the pizza failed. The center part was soggy. The outer half was crispy and delicious.   With so many great pizza options in town I'm not sure I'd come back.  Life is too short for a soggy crust.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very cheesy cheese pizza

NFvkljVNASl_CQ0tCxU6Xw.text: Gave it a try late at night. I got two slices to go and was surprised that it was considerably better than I remembered. Side note no this was not a drunken food stop just needed a late night bite.

riK-WZLj57i82c8QgB-4VQ.text: Really good food, service was okay! Had the Caesar salad and half margarita/half pepperoni pie. Pizzas are thin crust, 6 slices and worth the price!

u7Yw6ZhBEM0ZgFqYP41KvA.text: Dominique the bartender & I go way back to when Julian Serrano opened so I am bias on her.. but really she is fantastic.  Now, I always get the 3 meat & cheese board w/ a glass of wine.  Previous times when they first opened & I was in a rush for food before heading to the sportsbook, I grabbed a slice of pizza (forget the long lines), meatballs (had raisins or something in em.. yuck), the duck confit crostini (yum, no longer on the menu, lol) honestly I could not be happy here.    One day, I noticed a chalkboard, 'HUMBOLT Fog goat cheese' that spoke my language, I asked the bartender what I could get w/ that & he said I could pick 3 or 6 different meats & cheeses, like a charcuterie board.  Great!    Now, I'm totally happy w/ Five50.  If it wasn't for this, I'd give only 3 stars.  The wonderfully seasoned chewy bread, pitted olives, pear or apple, mustard, love the spicy Chorizo, usually have Dominique pick another meat side to try w/ the goat cheese.  Paired w/ the wine it is fantastic, quick & I'm on my way in about 5.50 lol.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the boards I like love!  Mmm!

P22eUN0fX7g80Btd2fw4fA.text: Yelp 100: 4/100  My most recent Vegas trip ended on a great food note and this place is it! It's located at Aria next to the sports bar and is open pretty late. I stayed at Vdara again and walked over here before Jewel ( another story for another time) and decided to eat!  Be warned. The pizza is somewhat expensive but it's Vegas. If cheap is an issue, and I love cheap food, go to Norms. Ordered the basic Margherita and calamari. The calamari had a good flavor and was fresh but the breading was a bit soggy. I prefer for it to be more crispy but it was good.   The pizza is the real stunner. 26$ for Margherita seems expensive to most but it is easily one of the best pizzas I've had in life. Usual Margherita with thin crust, buffalo mozzarella and basil. The cheese is amazing quality and there's overall shredded mozzarella on the pizza so it's not just sauce with tiny pillows of mozzarella. They also add the basil post bake so it doesn't get crispy and tasteless. Not much to disliked here! Service wasn't bad but the place was busy at 8pm on a Friday night. They can charge to your room at Aria or Vdara. Great pizza on the strip and an easy walk from where I was staying. Tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita pizza

ATl5nLS2lXcdlzh1hwv62Q.text: We love this place - good wine and good pizza, great atmosphere and chill.  We have been here a few times and will definitely keep coming back!

wQWeqqlFcterN1t58HwHbw.text: It was a truly amazing experience!!! Amanda our server was incredible! The food was superb, I'd definitely recommend it to any foodie or pizza lover!!! Can't wait for the next time we visit!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forager pizza

v-SOiSUx_JmJzDbYISZz8w.text: The pizza was delicious and service was excellent.  The crust was nice and thin, cooked perfectly. Good selection of beer.  Nice sized bar and even has a spot you could get slices to go.

SxSlWxCTcGE45DRhNgefWA.text: I ate here last time in Vegas and my bf ate her during this current stay. Amazing!  I got the Gathom. Toppings are really fresh, the dough is really good quality and you get a real decent sized slice. It's got a unique taste and kind of has a gourmet taste bc of the toppings the have on them and the over all quality. A slice is $5 and totally worth.  Reasons for the 4 star rating: Problem is though that if you grab a slice there's really no where to sit. Unless u order a whole a box at the bar.   The canned soda is way over priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish! All slices $5
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza place at Aria

GszULDlu9dAZvd62zaoMnA.text: The pizza here is more than solid, both by the slice and whole pie. When staying at Aria or Mandarin Oriental and in need of a quick bite, it's my go-to - nice beer list as well. Only 4 stars because it's overpriced, and the service can be hit or miss.

9XL4qUgsxrwXDtD0d3MRzA.text: The absolute best pizza spot on the stripe.  My husband and I ate here three times during our weekend trip.  I would highly recommend a create your own pizza with fresh spinach, sausage, and jalapenos with a glass of red wine.  If you don't have time to sit down, grab a slice to go.  They will throw a slice right into their oven and heat it up fresh for you.

yT5Ss8p2yKzu6ghQVN_O6A.text: Tasty but so damn expensive.  We stayed at the Vdara and because there's not much food option at Vdara, decided to order pizzas for carry-out.  Went for the Gotham, which is sorta like a meat-lovers with a spicy kick, and the North Beach, which is a pizza with clams, smoked mozzarella, sweet onions, and oregano.    Gotham's tasty, just as expected, especially if you're a fan of pepperoni and/or salami.  The North Beach was sort of a gamble since we wanted to try something different and man, we lost.  We expected a pizza with clams sprinkled onto the pizza, but what you get is actually one clam in the shell per slice.  Yup, 8 slices, 8 clams.  After you eat the one clam, it's just a cheese pizza essentially.  The smoked mozz and sweet onions was very tasty though.  We also ordered an order of wings after the girl on the phone said it was very delicious, and she was right, it was very tasty!  Not really a buffalo sauce, but it does have a slight kick and sweetness to it.  We were quite glad we were convinced to order it haha.  Now, for the price, each pizza is close to $30 (why we also thought there would be more clams), and for some reason the wings aren't on the online menu when we ordered so we didn't know, but our bill was $90+ with two cokes after taxes.  We knew Vegas was expensive but man, $90+ for pizza and wings was sorta crazy.    They sell by the slice as well, but I think I'd rather walk a little more to Cosmo and eat Secret Pizza next time.

lVl0p2IvKdm2Lvh0jzUItw.text: Just finished a slice of pepperoni. The crust was notable as it had that slightly charred, yet chewy quality that I always look for. Everything was on point. Would def go again!

foUoZXFHseuJXUP6_5dtng.text: Favorite 'Fancy' pizza place in Las Vegas. The Truffle is a must. It's expensive, but worth every penny. I get a 1/2 Truffle & 1/2 Gotham. I order the whole pie because unfortunately they don't sell the truffle by the slice. Started a new tradition last year of pizza instead of turkey for thanksgiving. This was one of the few pizza places actually open, unlike chains like Pizza Hut. Great for date night if you have a special lady to impress who likes pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 truffle 1/2 Gotham pizza

8IW8qv3zgBnzKwQK0_kiNQ.text: The difference between a 2 star review and a 4 star review was our server Zorica. The hostess was very friendly when she sat us, then when our server finally came over, she asked us what we wanted like we were bothering her. We were going to have some drinks and maybe an appetizer, but instead opted to just order water and the Gotham pizza. After about 10 minutes she brought the water over and just set it on the table (comes in a flip top bottle) and we had to poor it ourselves. I observed all the other servers pouring the water for their tables. Eventually our pizza came out which was delicious. The guy who brought it was very friendly and asked if we needed anything else. Our server didn't didn't check on us until we were basically done eating. The pizza was delicious and the staff was awesome except for our server. Hopefully Zorica can take the time to learn from her coworkers good examples and become a better server.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DG2ffoaXSF7IcB9b8l31Sg.text: The pizza is actually delicious. However, be prepared to pay about $30 per pie. The pies are large and the taste is good. If you are craving something that Is not on The menu, ask them they are willing to work with you. The service was horribleeeeeee but it was 1AM so who cares.

5mEBq9oX-rmfJs-YLwgOzA.text: So far, this is the best slice of convenience pizza I've had in Vegas. Walk up, pick out a slice (I went with white pizza, one of my favorites), pay, pick it up, and eat at the bar next door. They've got a decent selection of beers on tap, with a few craft varieties offered I'd never seen before.   The slices are a good size and thin, just like NY pizza. Well, as close as you can get to it, anyway.

AqTjgJQ-H89Xw4PP7Oj_6w.text: Fantastic, perfectly cooked pizza.  The pizza creations are creative and the ingredients high quality, fresh, and flavorful.  Table service was attentive, friendly and prompt.  My next trip to Vegas I am making sure I stop by again.  They also have counter pick up service with pizza by the slice.  They have a good variety of their top pizza creations by the slice which is great.  Convenient location in the Aria casino.

K6Cw2fhA2ELt-xtDEt4gKw.text: Pizza is really yummy! The pizza are really big. It was myself and my boyfriend and we each took a slice home. You can also do half and half different pizza (which is what we did) he got the really spicy pizza, and I got plain cheese.  Overall good service, and great pizza, recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple crumble float.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half and half pizza!

FdWUlmLovLsuK-2UFZew0A.text: Tasty. They have several options of pizza by the slice to go or you can dine in their restaurant. Tried the one with pepperoni and sauce whicb was clearly the most popular. Pretty good, nice crispy crust. Pizza crust is pretty thin. There is a sports arena down the hall from this place that you can take your pizza with you. Also tried their meatball sandwhich which had a very juicy moist meatball topped with marinated italian veggie toppings for nice crunch and texture. Nice easy cheap dining option inside the Aria. Will be bavk again.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yT1pV-KfFPLxQ2c6AYmyqw.text: Hell this pizza satisfied me at 2am, Wanted to try the Blanca but it was not ready and I was to hungry to wait. Got the Margherita which had one piece of basil on it,  Just be warned the line moved super slow and I wish they had to go boxes for one slice instead of carrying my plate back to the Vdara, at least we had a micro in our room to nuke it.   I guess when you haven't eaten since 1pm this pizza is sufficient.   RANDOM FACT: The name FIVE50 is inspired by the temperature at which the pizza is cooked, and the time when the pizza bar celebrates a special happy hour offering daily.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3EjOpRu-DV68WFaodZE-kQ.text: We stayed at Aria and came here twice during our trip.  We also got pizza to go once evening as well.  A lot of the casinos had really small sports bars so I was glad to have somewhere more casual to come have a drink.  The first time we stopped in was for happy hour we saw online.  Unfortunately there wasn't a happy hour.  We decided to have a couple of beers and the warm ricotta.  The ricotta was amazing, but they didn't provide enough bread and didn't offer us anymore.  Drinks were slow and the food was slow to come out.  Another day we stopped by to grab a few slices of pizza.  The service at the counter was faster and the pizza was better then average.    The last time we came we wanted to try the adult milkshakes.  Service was awful at the bar.  We got the Elvis with Rum.  It was actually pretty disappointing, it tasted like a standard milkshake.    I will be back for pizza on the go, but won't sit at the bar again as the service was not good either time.

iG-StJ7jkmFy9Epovdi6Yg.text: Would be 5 stars, but I'm currently eating here and they took my favorite, the Garlic Knots, off the menu. I was looking forward to them for over 6 months since my last Vegas trip, and am very disappointed.   That being said, the pizza is seriously the best!  Bring back the garlic knots! The review will go up to all 5 stars!

uUXgjSv_MjR3Jhu2cHUvgw.text: Got in line today, Saturday Aug. 26, 2017 in the To Go line and ordered 2 peperoni slices. Blonde cashier proceeded to ask me if I was excited about the fight and I politely responded "Not really Ma'am" I guess that was the wrong answer because after serving us the peperoni pizzas on plate, I again, politely requested that the order was "to go". I was in the "to go" line. She rolled her eyes gave us a pizza box and let us box our own pizza instead of boxing it up for us. We pay a lot of money to stay at Aria to be treated with such poor customer service. I hope you dont treat other Asian veterans the same way. Very disappointed. Great Pizza..Bad experience with customer service.

gAguRa5MlotzH7DBhG8U5Q.text: Meh, I've experienced better is a good way to put it.  Needed something to eat when I arrived in Las Vegas and I was staying at the Aria. Found this place in the hotel and decided to grab a slice. At 5.50 a slice, True to it's name, it's not the worst deal in town. Pizza is okay and enough to hold me over. I paid the cashier and he was not friendly at all. He grabbed my slice from the oven and just plopped it on the counter. He didn't even signal my way or anything to tell me it was mine.

ro85_Q5iG5jm0fPjJd0MOA.text: Pizza was huge, hot and good. Server suggested the mint chocolate shake with Bailey's...great suggestion. My friend had the wings and he said they were spicy with a kick. Great price for the portion size.
