yCpDW5e45ZQI1kXwfdTdfA.text: This restaurant is next to the Sports Bar.  It was great to place a few football bets and then have a bite of lunch surrounded by other fans!  Had the cheese plate..We picked 3 different kinds of cheese which were delicious!  It was served on a board surrounded by yummy nuts, berries, olives and warm flatbread squares.

Kdc7iA0Yy6EwJeoQR7yw6w.text: If I could give 0 stars I would. We came here on August 2nd, around 4pm, the pregnant Latina waitress took my payment and made a copy of my card and took it to a gas station and spent $70. Luckily I caught it since I didn't use my card after that. Hopefully she loses her job. This is totally unacceptable.

zu8wYymotZLQJA3u00Y-tA.text: We had a blast here and had a party of 15! N we ordered a little of everything on the menu! Pizza AMAZING! Service AMAZING!!! Coming here is a must when in Vegas!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_f6shMxzEKMg269qteCCJQ.text: 12.28.14 We wanted a space to watch the afternoon NFL games. The sportsbook was packed. This was right next door. Draft beer choices were plentiful. The garlic knots caught my eye. And my tastebuds. Good choice to start a Vegas trip, if I do say so myself. yelp.com/biz_photos/five... Notes: 550 is the degree at which they cook their pizzas. It's also the cost of a slice. Perks of sitting at the bar. Total damage for two: $46

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. draft beers and garlic knots

L0PewpOqhc1s4g3UJJwDZQ.text: Greasy NY Style Pizzas with somewhat limp crust.   Ordered Half TRUFFLE - TRUFFLE SALAMI, BECHAMEL, PARMESAN, FRESH THYME, SHAVED TRUFFLES and Half FORAGER - WHITE SAUCE, MUSHROOMS, BACON, WHIPPED RICOTTA, SPINACH. Both were great though it would've been better if that crust were crisper and if the Truffle side actually tasted like it! Found it funny how all the advertised 'Truffle' items we tried in Vegas were weak in flavor. That's never the issue in L.A. I suppose they're more generous with it out here.  Service was excellent though which was the standard for any of the NY style eateries we visited within the city. Super flirtatious entertaining character behind the counter firing pies kept winding me up. Found him to be humorous. Overall, we were stuffed to the rim and satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge Pie!

DQRLwRFRya_10CyaZqcytA.text: Service here is impeccable, the gorgeous girls are always beaming with huge smiles as they serve u giant slices of pie! I try to always stop for a slice when I'm at the Aria Poker Room. Some of the best wood-fire oven pizza in Vegas, hands down. A little on the pricey side..$7 or so for a slice but it's very large and filled with healthy toppings.

uOG_eezh9dupHql-wFXzOw.text: 28 bucks for a specialty pizza. Not cheap but it's the strip so what do you want?   The pizza itself is good and there's a good variety of pies to choose from, or build your own. I've eaten here twice and service was good both times. Food came quickly and was delicious. Pretty much what a pizza place like this should be.

D3KkPh4lgx525ZrhpLKAEw.text: The bartender, Megan, was the rudest woman I've ever met. She gave the worst customer service I've ever experienced and was extremely neurotic and unpleasant. Pizza was amazing, wish I could say the same about the service...

_SjNS-_s8N-AaxSawK-w8A.text: My girlfriend and I decided to try this place on a whim because we were feeling a pizza, didn't really want to do some hole-in-the-wall pizza joint, and I was up a little bit on blackjack winnings. We chose to go to Five50 because of positive reviews on OpenTable, good pictures of the pizza, and the fact that it was at the Aria which has a lot of prestige under its belt for its age.  We were quite impressed with the pizza and the service here. It's just swanky enough to feel like you're getting your money's worth but not so much that you forget that it's still a sports bar with a casual ambiance. They serve Fiji water, which was nice, albeit expensive. All-in-all, with two bottles of Fiji and our pizza, we spent about $45. Not terrible for Vegas, especially being in the Aria.  We've both decided this ranks as probably the 2nd or 3rd best pizza we've had in our lives, so, that says something!

wQ1v0aQj_BYUhpGV25O-8g.text: Went for lunch and ordered from the lunch special two course option- either a cauliflower soup or peach summer salad and a personal sized pizza for $18. The salad was surprisingly pretty with butter lettuce, ham and a white cheese that reminded me of a creamy mozzerella or Burrata with sliced peach and lightly dressed. The margarita pizza was amazing- wood fired crust was cooked perfectly, and the cheese, basil and marinara were all on point. All the pies I saw looked great! Good place to go watch sports also.

I--lE1sEoreN1scdM7HJIQ.text: K first things first...  I'm 5'2 sitting at these tall barstools  that are Freaking me out, Causing my feet to dangle and Loose my shoes. So let's rephrase that: I'm 5'2 sitting barefoot at these tall barstools.   Their napkins look like those blankets that newborn babies get swaddled in . It was weird wiping my face and reliving the birth of my children.   Anyway... The pizza came. We got the Gotham which is pretty much code for $28 supreme pizza. But this was a superior supreme. The crust was crispy and chewy and airy at the same time. The cheese was perfectly gooey... It came like 20 minutes after we ordered which I guess is standard but it felt like forever because my toes were Kung fu gripping my shoes for dear life. I hate these bar stools but I love their pizza. And the lady that served us was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s a box. Of pizza.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool decor.

zu5F-wq1KTV3ZMc_jMsuSQ.text: Pizza is tasty, pizza is good, pizza is your friend.   Five50 makes good pizza, but it's not memorable or noteworthy. The place is right near the sports bookie in the casino and therefore it's very convenient. This is a good place if you need a meal but unfortunately it falls victim to the price inflation of the strip. 1 Slice is $6 and there might be 1 or 2 beers under $10. You're basically paying ballpark prices. Again, if you're in the Aria and you need a quick lunch this will definitely make do, but you're paying premium Vegas prices for non-premium, albeit serviceable food.

cFq0wB0QNf0Cgn6fRqbo-Q.text: The Forager!  Only slice of Za you'll ever need... Hands down my favorite I've experienced.

DTpM4fQKM5ugmi9mWbEjVw.text: Pricey but amazing pizza, appetizers, and shakes! We ordered the meat pizza and it was delicious! We also ordered their Mac n cheese and it was so cheesy and delicious! Final thing we got were shakes! I got the s'mores one and it was pretty good but I tried the Elvis shake and that one was waaaay better!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores shake. Graham cracker and toasted marshmallows on top.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meat pizza (don&#39;t remember the name) but it was tasty either way!
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n cheese.... no words except you gotta try it

dKnM9GFAh4R16F8hUegWHg.text: Excellent food and staff! We ordered the jalapeno corn arancini and an half margherita and half Gotham pizza. Really tasty!  Our server, Victoria, was exceptional!

29vr2PBGsVO2SM2IZvHDYA.text: This is one of our regular haunts when we  go to Vegas, which is frequent due to business.  The waiter remembers us and pretty much our order.  The gotham is an awesome pizza, and even makes a great breakfast the next day too.  Don't miss out on the meatballs.   One thing that keeps me from giving it 5 stars is the bar menu.  When they first opened they had a decent amount of seasonal cocktails.  This went away a little while back and the bar focuses mainly on beers, ales, and cider.  One time we went and ordered margaritas, they went back 3 times for being undrinkable.  If they would amp up the cocktails then i'd go back to 5 stars.

4GXAnOp-WsdrJj50gS4gbw.text: Located inside the Aria next to the sports bar & poker room. You can order pizza by the slice or order from a full menu that has some nice foodie choices.... Not just your typical toppings. My husband & I sat at the bar & were waited on promptly. Ordered the picante pizza which had ghost pepper salami, chilis, & roasted red pepper on it. At first the crust looked like it would be heavy but it was light and airy topped with Spicy goodness!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian sausage
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped salad no onion
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buratta, Scarmosa,&amp; Mortadella

x4Ye0VNNxNucESOtXWOYkA.text: *** PROS *** * Quick "to go" line for slices of pizza * Amazing, delicious pizza! We had the Gotham w/pepperoni and other meats, and a slice with white sauce, spinach, mushrooms --- both were heavenly!! *** CONS *** * None. Go now, eat, and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza oven

yzAgTSRHR56Wj94KxphR5Q.text: Been here 3 times. Each time the food is excellent and service less than excellent. Pimento cheese crostini was best starter of the four we had. Beer selection hits all styles. Watched the chef hover at a table for about 30 minutes. Only two wait staff for the first 45 minutes covering 12 tables. Would go 10+ minutes without seeing either of the wait staff in the restaurant (what the heck was so interesting in the kitchen?). Farmstead and Gotham pizzas are favorites of the group.

OHOCvsyhJW6nl1wQOMZlSw.text: Two course lunch special at 18, not a bad deal. We were staying in the Aria and were hungry before checkout and decided to give Five50 Pizza Bar a try. The service was ok, the food was okay. We didn't have reservations and checked in with the hostess who said there was about a forty minute wait for a table but there were open seats in the bar. We decided to sit at the bar, but soon realized that the service at the bar was super slow. One bartender, ten plus seats. The bartender finally gave us some menus and more than enough time to decide. We went with the two course lunch special: first course: seasonal soup or the spinach and pear salad, second course: mezza luna pasta, personal pizza (up to three toppings), or a specialty pizza. I went with the seasonal soup which was tomato bisque and the Farmstead specialty pizza. The bartender was super sweet but was also super busy which led to a lot of wait time.  The tomato bisque was served first. It was a mediocre soup; creamy but a tad bland. I would have liked to have a piece of bread or some type of carb to go with it. It was not anything beyond mediocre. After what felt like a long time of waiting, our individual sized pizzas arrived at the bar. The Farmstead pizza is topped with creme fraiche, country olives, prosciutto, arugula and a farm egg. This sounded a lot tastier on paper than when it came out. They are very stingy with the ingredients and my pizza was a bit bland. I was expecting the egg to be cooked over easy on the pizza but instead the yolk on the egg was fully cooked and I was not able to disperse it all over the pizza. Disappointing. I was also missing the ooey gooey cheesiness of a traditional pizza.  Conclusion: I should've went with the personal create-your-own pizza. I assumed that the specialty pizzas were the way to go but it just meh. I saw a few unoccupied tables throughout the meal and wondered why the wait time was said to be forty minutes. The pros about Five50 Pizza Bar is that you can get a whole pizza or an individual slice, the two course lunch special for 18 bucks, and they are open late for that nice greasy "had too much to drink" slice. The cons: pizza was dry and the ingredients were scarce, the flavors did not blow me away, and you can get a tastier (and cheaper) slice of pizza on the strip. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmstead

d_UThdPmCiZwAhGL9h__ng.text: Over priced Burned crust 16" pizza in a 24" box (sleezy advertising) If this restaurant didn't rely on (literally) captive patrons, this would be a $12 pizza at best, instead of $30. But, Vegas.   I'd seen these big boxes of pizza being carried around the hotel and wanted some, but deceptive advertising won't fool me again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza is much smaller than their marketing sized box.

aJTGmA9Q40AQEp_MGAmaWA.text: Food was great tasting and our server John was very attentive.  My kids shared a pepperoni mushroom pizza.  My wife and i shared an italian sandwich, shrimp pasta, and a small ceasar salad... and we all shared a calamari appetizer.  Everything was perfect.  Really hit the spot after a long drive from L.A.

fLxJUYynte5j2LHJht-ZDw.text: Loved it. Only loses a star because these are GUT BOMBS. They will have you waddling or taking a nap without a problem.  Not much to say here other than excellent pizza! Thin crust style, so no Giordanos or forks here. Cheese slice and Gotham slice. The cheese wasnt too greasy, tasted fresh, I mean, I know its Yelp but what else can you really say about cheese pizza?  The Gotham slice was great, essentially a meat lovers style. All the ingredients were good, fresh, quick and polite service. I took it to go, so cant speak to the sit down service. Food was great, and I'll be back next time I'm near Aria!

ebgQrMV9pTRKy1_WKKqX9A.text: First pizza wasn't whole milk mozzarella, my bad.  Asked up reordering, got the ok but not the body language that it was ok.  New pizza came, and it was like they spill an entire sale shaker on it.  Waitress now had no time for me since it was my second complaint, and manager also wanted no part of dealing with it. I won't return, the pizza is nothing special. Nor is the service.

A-poNlRVnNzBa06glxgK0Q.text: Aria is beautiful. However, another joint that should NEVER come up on Yelp, particularly high up on the list when I am seeking Gluten Free Pizza. They have none. I guess it's not their fault but they should not be listed under GF pizza.

w8bfysxrQKb67zaVq2HwwA.text: To go service was friendly and relatively quick. Pizza is overly greasy and overloaded with toppings. Not a bad slice but nothing memorable either.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza in bed

r4uZuyAQe2QbG6740tZKFw.text: Very disappointed. Top 5 worst pizza I've had. $27 for a pie. Cheese wasn't baked enough into the sauce.i would've waited for a pizza that was thoroughly cooked.

IFsagmb6WSpzCpjS2NpF7g.text: GREAT FIND ! My wife and I were in Las Vegas in 2017 for 2 days to attend a birthday party for a dear Aussie friend. Everyone attending the birthday celebration was booked into the huge Aria Resort & Casino complex. We flew in on July 2nd from San Diego, CA and believe it or not it was 113F when we walked outside the airport terminal at around midday catch a cab to our hotel. After checking in we decided to find a place within the hotel that served great craft beer because I needed a really satisfying beer after our flight. Our first choice seemed a winner with a huge craft beer selection but after getting slugged over $18 with tip for a glass of Delirium Tremens at a well-known pub inside The Shoppes at Crystals I was suffering tourist price shock. We left there in a hurry to head back into the Aria Casino itself and discovered the Five50 Pizza Bar. They served wood fired New York style Neapolitan thin crust pizzas ...just our model ! It was like a welcoming breath of fresh air from the moment we walked in with a nice big open space, cool wall decor and good classic rock music cranking out. We found a table and before we knew it a friendly server with a big smile greeted us to take our lunch order. This place was a great choice and it kept getting better. I kicked things off with a Victory Brewing Golden Monkey Belgian - Style Tripel.....my absolute favorite craft beer ! After studying the impressive pizza menu we ordered a large Gotham Pizza to share...$28 I believe. My craft beer tasted really good and was a decent price...no more than 10 bucks from memory. Our huge 16 inch pizza came out in a few minutes and looked fantastic on it's elevated rack. Our obliging server grated some fresh Parmigiano Reggiano Cheese over our pizza and we dug in. The pizza was full of flavor and the sauce was particularly outstanding. I ordered a Duvel Belgian Golden Ale....reasonably priced at $9 for a 12 oz bottle. My wife and I even struck up a friendly conversation with a young couple at an adjacent table. This pizza restaurant played excellent classic rock background music the whole time we were there and we enjoyed the overall atmosphere a lot. We loved our huge gourmet pizza and I enjoyed a couple of great craft beers at a fair price. There is also a beautiful looking full bar and an extensive wine list to complement the great craft beer choice. I read later that this classy restaurant is headed up by James Beard Award winning Chef Shawn McClain so that says something. We think this place inside the Aria Resort & Casino is a top value eatery worth visiting on the Las Vegas strip !

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s us in the Aria Casino.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The grand entrance.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The huge bar.

97VoiBcmyt3eJwPqqQttbQ.text: Went here for lunch with the bro cuz we were craving for some pizza and we weren't disappointed!  We ordered the Gotham pizza which comes with pepperoni and sausage. The meat had plenty of flavor and the pepperoni was crispy and thin. I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed eating the toppings lol. Cheese was abundant and delicious as well. Lots of stretchy gooey goodness with each bite! I would have given this place 5 stars, but I feel it really falls short in terms of the crust. With everything so flavorful and delicious it really contrasts the plain and burnt tasting crust. It felt like I was eating cardboard at some parts lol. If they added some garlic or cheese flavor to the crust then it would have been perfect.  One pizza was enough to fill up 2 people and it only cost about $35 which is pretty good considering it is a meal on the strip.  Overall I'd recommend for you guys to check this place out if you haven't don't do yet. It is easily one of my favorite pizza spots on the strip and I'll probably be back to try out their other flavors. Hopefully the crust will be better lol.

EYQhH4WQJbusUsgPVkJiZg.text: We came here on a Sunday around 4pm for early dinner so our wait was only about 10 minutes. Staff was friendly and checked on us frequently. Garlic knots were awesome and the marinara that came with tasted homemade. The spaghetti was also delicious and the sauce reminded me of authentic marinara that my Italian friends and family have made. The pizza was mediocre. After having pizza in Italy and NYC, this one was a little disappointing. We just had the margherita so maybe the other pizzas taste better.

nWt_1fyNv6N-kOY5lOGsAw.text: Wow. Just left this place and had the most unfriendly hostess with long brown hair tell us there was no pizza because the oven was down. It's our 14 year anniversary and after having had a couples massage at the Aria spa, this woman almost ruined my evening with her attitude. I don't even know what we did to get such an unkind response but holy crap.

UtAbqfIingU3aeXn_D7gSQ.text: Pizza is really expensive- but it is Vegas and it is Aria- so expect to pay more for less.. I've had better pizza at Pizza Hut-- but the service was out of this world and the chicken saltimbocca sandwich was one of the best I'd ever had.

zaq5g_eBIFnEZ8hyP6ws8w.text: My partner and I dined in, sharing a pizza and appetizer. While the food was pretty great, I found the service to be lacking. The waiter spoke only to my partner the vast majority of our visit. I was invisible enough to the waiter that when he cleared the table, the pan tilted in such a way that pizza crumbs fell all over my lap. I received brief acknowledgement of my existence at the end of our visit when the waiter said goodnight after I had paid with my credit card (which had a name that is ethnic enough to not be confused as my partner's). The food was a 5 but the service was a 1; overall, the visit was a 3.

LgI1IXW5HZx58tEMlqfAVQ.text: Just okay as an overall experience. From the beginning it felt like they weren't prepared for the  4th of July holiday crowds. There was a wait, which is fine but the young lady at the front wasn't greeting anyone like you want to be greeted but rather trying to keep the he order of who is next right in her mind instead of writing it down. The waiter did his best I guess seeing as they were clearly understaffed. I had the meatball sandwich which was extremely dry, hardly any cheese and came out luke warm. They were so busy I didn't bother sending it back. I probably wouldn't come back here as other hotels have solid pizza spots with better service for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v59yNGEyiKWebAy0w1IU-g.text: I have to say, I wish there was one of these near home, without doubt one of the best pizzas around.  Excellent crust, crisp not too thick or too thin, subtle yeast flavor.  Gourmet toppings are amazing.  The Truffle pizza with crisp smoked bacon, truffles and potatoes with a cream sauce is amazing.  More traditional, the Gotham has pepperoni, sausage and olives, but their tomato sauce tastes so fresh, perfect!  Add to that a fantastic beer selection and consistent service, plus doesn't hurt to be conveniently inside the Aria hotel, Vegas.  Worth a visit or a late night snack!

cnMzzUYYtTJe37t4wfiWZg.text: September 7th, 2017: It's the first game of the football season.  The Patriots are playing (and losing to) the Kansas City Chiefs, I've been eating rich seafood for the past couple of days, and all I want is to toss back a Moscow Mule and eat a slice of pie (with more seafood on it lol).  We got some wings and the North Beach pizza.  Those wings are ridiculously good.  I didn't even think I wanted wings at first but I'm glad they were ordered.  Perfectly fried, enough vinegar for a decent pucker, and the sauce had a nice steady heat.   The North Beach Pizza [Clams, smoked mozzarella, sweet onions, and oregano - "An Italian immigrant neighborhood, the home of Marilyn and Joe Dimaggio, the cradle of the beatnik movement, and a delectable pizza inspired by the heritage of the north bay."]: This pie was also delicious.  Served hot from the oven with a delicious grey char on the crust.  I was hoping for a white sauce but it worked well with the sweet tomato sauce.  The sweetness from the tomatoes complimented the sweetness of the clams.  I would still rather have clam pizza with white sauce though.  The pizza was foldable without dropping any toppings and easy to chow down.  We ended up boxing the leftovers to eat cold the next morning.  Five50 is located right next to the Sportsbook inside Aria.  So if you wanna watch the game or a fight, this is the place to be if you still want to eat, drink, and be comfortable while watching TV.  Plus you'll be away from the cigarette and cigar smoke!  It's a 3.5 stars place and a $30 pizza but since I'm vacationing, I'll round up.  It's not the best pie on The Strip but it still made this gal happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza Bar.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clammy.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. North Beach Pizza.

k8n7kmkRg2xbvREtNRuG0Q.text: March Madness weekend and we were looking for lunch when we saw a advert for Five50 pizza. This place was a pleasant surprise, and reminded us of the wood fire pizza restaurants we frequent at home. Pizzas were the same price range we are used to paying at home, mid to high $20 which is surprising with it located in a casino. My husband had one of their IPAs, and the pizza was quickly delivered to the table. We sat and watched half a game, and took a few pieces of pizza with us for breakfast the next morning. Really one of the best meals for a great price on the steip.

EVs8t-i5YJqgWqYc4xp-1g.text: Sadly my slice of Forager Pizza was sour to taste and no mushrooms found!  Crust was still amazing!  Better luck next time if I decide not to try something and somewhere else!  Cheers!  Five50's Forager Pizza to go - oh yea!  Bite into the gooey cheese, the chucks of tasty mushrooms, the thin crust perfectly grilled!  Along with an ice cold beer and NFL - a wonderful Sunday afternoon it makes!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sour Slice of Pizza - unhappy customer here

hxYsl-_WkJeCaizKvLQ7sw.text: Easily the best pizza I've ever had!! Order the Gotham pizza. We did one slice and ran to a show. Came back later and ordered a whole one. Service was just ok. Come on dude! Laugh at the drunk customers humor and earn that tip!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QJZwAMpe9n5MyeWS5K4Ssg.text: The pizza is pretty tasty. You'd be angry to pay $30 for a pizza of this quality at a pizzeria, but the convenience is worth it for residents of the Aria. My biggest complaint is that my wife and I ordered a pitcher of Pale Ale and were served a very happy IPA (and I know my beers). Could've been ok if the server had checked in with us, but beer and pizza arrived at the same time, and we didn't see our server until I waved my credit card in their face as they were walking by. Service is abysmal here. Pizza is decent. Convenience to Aria gamblers is good.

w7t-mUIBvcIeu4E409o_eg.text: We stayed at the Aria recently with some friends and made two stops to five 50. They have a great selection of beers on tap (if you're in the mood for a boozy lunch) and plenty of options with pizzas, charcuterie, sandwiches, and salads. If you are into cheeses - something from the mozzarella bar should do the trick. The pizzas and were delicious and the crust was top notch. The take away bar is great for a late night slice, don't look past the Forager. Great place!

RgZsO3WJOqep2g43GUCZWA.text: The pizza was so delicious! Gourmet and sinful. Came on a Sunday night to meet friends for dinner and drinks. Our waiter was excellent, not fake or over the top, but super knowledgeable and efficient. It was busy, prime time, so we did wait a while for stuff to show up at the table, but we were there to relax and have good conversation, so nobody minded waiting. Plus, the pizza chefs are back there making everything from scratch, so you know, it takes time. My Bloody Mary was perfect. The Caesar salad was incredible. We ordered three pizzas and they were all to die for. We ordered two desserts, which were both splendid. Afterwards, the waiter was very kind about taking photos of our little group for us. What more could you want?  Yeah, it's oily. Sure, it's fattening. It was a little bit of a wait at times for food to arrive.  They're busy, because it's really good. Have a cocktail and enjoy being out! (Also, they have tons of pizza by-the-slice business, so all in all, I think they were doing a great job of handling the rush.) I would recommend this place to anyone coming to Vegas looking for epic pizza.

nBH5qJjE5InXMhjm87ojYA.text: Delicious pizza!! We had the white pizza with mozzarella, ricotta, and basil. It's a little on the pricey side but well worth it! Also had the arancini balls, same thing a little pricey though very good! Service was great too. Would definitely go back.

PPvhmYEXpBDbibDQsDJmXg.text: Go to Cosmo secret Pizza if you're drunk and in a hurry, go here if you want a sit down pizza. Drink menu was amazing. We usually go to cosmo secret pizza and went here because the line was WAY to long, you will not be disappointed. UMM don't go to a pizza place for bread sticks, go for pizza. Staff was very friendly and made the experience fun. Ate leftover next day, made for a good hangover meal.

D2DWbWA2t2fGJ248J16Pyw.text: This pizza was amazing in my opinion. Not sure where the negative reviews are coming from. Went to buy pizza by the slice at about 11pm the other night and it was quite busy.. so much that they couldn't keep any pizza out. Was nice that we got fresh pizza that hadn't been sitting out. We were staying there at Aria so we took our slices back to our room. After I ate my slice, my mouth watered for more. So much that my husband and I couldn't wait to buy a whole pizza to take home the next day. We got the Gotham pizza. I can't say anything about the other kinds because we didn't try those. The meat was very tasty on the pizza and the crust was really nice. I'm glad I don't live in Vegas because I would be going to this place every week. I definitely look forward to going back on our next visit to Vegas. It is expensive for a whole pizza... With tax it came to $34 for a whole Gotham pizza but it was worth it and we enjoyed it very much.

PHlfuDaOUXT6qC8FZPShTw.text: Average pizza, overpriced.  Good for a quick meal if you're at the Aria, but nothing special.

gmmLHoUQV67aVcCI3q3rGQ.text: I thought the pizza was okay but certainly not great.  We got the Gotham and some of it was burnt on top and on the bottom.  I wouldn't go here again with so many great options in Vegas.

DxjbT_8dLfexfuI84H1uIA.text: Charcuterie board was absolutely delicious!  Drinks were fabulous, fabulous!!  Service was ok, kind of slow, pizza took awhile and when it arrived it was very disappointing.  We ordered a pizza that had clams on it and they were tiny and still in the shells, one per slice of pizza. I think they forgot about our pizza because it didn't seem cooked all the  way, the middle was very limp and mushy.  For this to be a pizza place overall I enjoyed everything but the pizza.  I would go back for the drinks and appetizers, definitely not the pizza

THCFRWglWGWVgweKhASxvA.text: It is almost impossible to find pizza as good as this unless you are on NYC it Italy.  Excellent!

GiBuDMnORnDKBC8-EoVu6Q.text: I ordered a slice of the blanco pizza and an arugula salad. Both items on the menu were very tasty. The pizza had great flavor! I would definitely come back here!

UyEWELVUzWa4BmtXZpUMbg.text: Ate here in August. We Always stay at Aria. Got the pepperoni & house sausage pizza. We were surprised the crust was chewy after being cooked in a wood-fired oven & the toppings were quite greasy. Really a let down for the place & price!!!

y3Ftc3gX0uYP-_JS1yLuyg.text: This is the best pizza ever. I am originally from NYC and used to think it was Johns in the Village but I am changing my mind.

VlqzA9LN8s3m0EOXNmP38Q.text: Fabulous woodfire pizza!! All their late night over the counter pizzas were deeeelish!!! I killed 3 slices! And they are not small slices and Iam not a big girl, just have a great big appetite for good pizza!  Perfect crust, cheese galore, not too doughy w a good amount of sauce. Worth to eat there twice during my wknd stay!! Cheers!

JOiav-yS8fJ9sM0BWLPIHQ.text: This place near the casino makes fantastic pizza! We wanted to get some good food without spending a lot and get out quickly so we decided to try this place. We were seated at the table in about 10 minutes and ordered a margarita pizza. The pizza came out quickly and the crust was amazing. Perfectly done, with the right amount of crunchiness. I have had some neopolitan pizzas that are too soggy, but this was awesome, eat with your hands style pizza, no fork needed. Very good taste - nothing crazy, just good pizza at a decent price. If you sit down be prepared to sit closely next to other people, the tables are set pretty tight together. Aria has good food choices and this place does not disappoint!

k0kb2H80w6F4V7DP5Dqp8w.text: The slice counter is awesome! Great value on higher end pizza on the strip. If you are not a fan of the greasy pepperoni and cheese from the other joints, give this a shot!

F-bdDnmjojIkOcTlZG6Gmw.text: I've been here a few times, Gotham!  The pizza does sometimes come a lil greasy, but get it right out of the oven and it's money!  I ordered mine a lil extra well done and it was spot on.  It's definitely a lil too pricey in my view but considering where it's locate, it's to be expected.

b3zAuqlexSCI3pGbvcW04w.text: Terrible pizza extremely disappointing especially from a James Beard Chef. The Forager was so greasy and under seasoned. Wonderful ingredients however poor execution, not impressed at all. Will stick to Settebello at least the pizza is seasoned and good!! The bread sticks are a palate killer and ruin your taste buds loaded with grease and spice. Little over priced in my opinion after 2 glasses of wine, beet salad, cheese and charcuterie $100 plus tip, the food and the service were both bland. Step it up we expect more out of a James Beard Chef, especially because Sage is incredible.

zjM2HbDqDhJ6cvkygDGdFA.text: After a long day, and running around, my go to meal is always Pizza. For a quick slice I made my way over.  I only wanted a piece to go. They had four pizzas to choose from. They each looked great.  I went with the meat lovers pizza, see the picture.  The pizzas appear to be from a fire oven. I feel that adds a little extra taste, as long as it is not burned.  Also, they were not just out of the oven, so they had time to set. This was truly a great pizza. 9.5/10 While I ordered the pizza to go, they have a few standing tables to eat your slice.  Also, just around the corner is a cafe you can sit down to eat.   Ciao

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great meat lovers pizza Mrpink

8yXCn8UHuRomjSGIVeDfYg.text: I came here with my mom, brother, and boyfriend's mom for lunch on Christmas.  I ordered the Blanca pizza, which I did not like. Usually I am a huge fan of white cheese pizza, but something in this one just didn't work... (Note: pizzas are big enough for 2).  My mom ordered the meatball sub which was actually pretty good. We didn't care for the chips that came on the side.  I do have to say that the apple squash soup was good.  For dessert we had the vanilla ice cream sandwich. It came on a thin and crispy wafer.  Was different but good.  The service wasn't good.  Maybe because our server had to work on Christmas, but either way. When we were done we sat with dirty dishes in front of us for a long time before anyone came to ask if we wanted boxes or dessert.  Our waters were also completely empty and we had to hunt our server down.  The manager came by to check on us but we didn't want to get anyone in trouble  Food wasn't great and neither was the service.    2 pizzas, 2 subs, a soup, 2 sodas, and one dessert came out to $125.  I'll have to try something different if there is a next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blanca pizza

F4bk5IdCZTY9ifsCTja2hA.text: I just paid 4.87 for a 12 oz sprite ... do I need to say anymore? Oh and a counter kid who makes 8.75 had the audacity to get an attitude with me can't wait until I'm thirsty again.

_4gOFlcjc59UZ-ycZEBusQ.text: The pizza is delicious and for $5.50 a slice it is probably the best deal in Vegas. Their adult milkshakes are creative, fun and yummy. I had the root beer float with jaeger and I want to go back for the Irish car bomb and another slice of the forager.  Update:  went back everyday!  Late night pizza, awesome.  Breakfast pizza, awesome.  I wish I could get the forager at home.

ZSx7TkufN5kKSZw8mCRK1w.text: I've been waiting for this pizza place to open for a while now. And finally on 4th of July was the grand opening! And wow this place is going to be a huge success! It's located right by the Aria sports book near the Zarkana entrance.  The Aria signed an exclusive joint venture with the James Beard Award-Winning Chef and Restaurateur Shawn McClain. To have his name behind it, you know this place will receive top notch quality control and ingredients.  This place makes me love the Aria poker room even more now. (I'm going to gain so much weight from these pizzas everyday LOL)  I believe pizza by the slice goes for $5.50, and apparently they set oven temperatures to 550 Fahrenheit, and at 5:50 pm happy hour starts! (Hence the name Five 50) Pretty catchy I say. Oh and thanks for this information Nelson Q. :p  I tried three 16 inch pizzas with friends. All priced around $27-29. They were the:  TRUFFLE: potato, truffle salami, bechamel, fresh thyme, truffles  BLANCO: fresh mozzarella, ricotta, olive oil, chopped garlic, basil, and white cheddar  FARMSTEAD: country ham, creme fraiche, farm egg, olives  I would say the crowd favorite out of those three was the Truffle, definitely a unique pizza! The Blanco was very good as well, and the Farmstead wasn't our favorite. Just the over easy farm eggs on top where the egg yolk starts dripping everywhere wasn't the best texture and consistency to have on a pizza.  This place is a great upscale pizza joint and I would highly recommend a visit here if you absolutely love pizza and stopping by the Aria! The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is honestly because I've had better pizzas elsewhere in my lifetime. :p

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle pizza. $33
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza box
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Off hours

cNeTxN7I4A3nWOngUDVV_A.text: Don't let them fool you about the size of the pizza.  I'm beginning to wonder if they try to make you think it's on the small size so you order an appetizer.  We ordered the Gotham pizza, lots of yummy protein and what not.  But we started with the chopped salad (also very yummy) and then came the pizza.  Rolled out pretty content.

l7Xql4b3H_8jSQUhifpaMA.text: Vacation pricing at it's best.   $34 for pizza takeout is steep, but we are on vacation! Gotta take that regular price and x2.   Got a half forager and half margarita and it was good. The crust was a little tough for me but it was topped with some really great ingredients so I'm not against it. Overall it was a solid pizza, still not happy about paying so much for it. We are staying in the Aria so it was really convenient. It sure is a lot cheaper than the buffet called "the buffet." Definitely wouldn't come if not staying in the Aria.

6IaDC0UqFh74D8IxHcL16w.text: We arrived around 5:30pm headed to one of the shows. The restaurant area was less than 1/2 full, if that..   The couple we came with walked up to the bar, during Happy Hour, and got a good price on a couple of drinks and then we were seated. We quickly found out that you had to sit at the bar for Happy Hour prices, otherwise drinks were full price. That put a  limit or an end to what was purchased, with that said the drinks were normal tourist price but were terrible.   Now, the food   We both ordered a Build your own 16" pizza with a starting price of $22, for cheese only. there were 3 sub areas of ingredients that could be added. Each area was from $2 to $4 per ingredient.   The waitress raved about how good this, potentially $40 - $50 pizza was going to be so we went it. Honestly, the food was ok but it wasn't even close to what I would call great pizza. If i had paid $20 for it then i would recommend the place but it's hugely overpriced even for a tourist area.   if you're looking for good pizza at a decent price -- go somewhere else  I don't see us going back

RzyJaUoM_e7eJ40YW5pguA.text: Good place to go for a quick bite to eat. We were staying at the Aria and rather than eat an expensive meal for every meal while we were in Vegas, we stopped by Five50 Pizza Bar for lunch a couple of times during our stay. Once we ate at a table and the other time we ate at the bar. The service was good. The food was good - we ordered pepperoni pizza, margherita pizza, and caesar salad. The restaurant also offered slices to-go, which is a great option for those who really need to grab a quick bite. Might stop by again if we're in Vegas and staying at the Aria again.

fb7Gqtd7GZhBwdvU0TgunQ.text: So I've been meaning to write a review about this place, bc I came here with a group of 11 and they were SO accommodating!  We got to sit at their special table reserved for larger parties, which was super luxe and somewhat sectioned off, which I like.  The only problem with this table is the fact that there really isn't much room between the chairs and the "wall," so it seemed like the servers were having a hard time getting around us.  Not a big deal since we made do, but a bit of a design snafu.  They have a great selection of cocktails, wines, and beers, although it's vegas and I was pretty hungover so I had iced tea instead (this was ok, but had an over-steeped, bitter aftertaste).  Since a portion of our party got there first, we decided to order a couple of salads: we had one with arugula and one with burrata.  Of the two, no contest: the burrata was the clear winner, the perfect riff on your classic Caprese.  Being that our group was so large, we just decided to order one of each of their specialty pizzas.  In addition to your standard fare like Margherita pizza and Sicilian, they also had a few more unique ones - one with clams, one with truffles, and another with egg!  The pizzas are actually a lot bigger than I thought they would be; they're 16 inches in diameter.  I didn't get to try all of them, but the two I did have were SO delicious: the Forager (with mushrooms) and the Farmstead (the one with egg - mind you, I'm a huge sucker for runny eggs).  TIP: Not sure if it's standard that they bring hot chili oil with the food, but if you don't get it, ask for it.  That stuff is amazing.  Because we ordered so many pizzas, they notified us that it would take a bit for them to come out.. That being said, they brought out a few of their appetizers to tide us over.  The toasted marcona almonds were good (although not as crunchy as I would like), the olives were really unctious and delicious (but if I could eat one thing for the rest of my life it would probably be olives, so I'm slightly biased), the veggies were pretty standard (good but unremarkable), and the chicharrones are the best darn chicharrones I've ever had (haven't had a wide variety, but these were perfectly seasoned and fried).  The service was great, although there were a few kinks here and there.  Drinks took a while to refill and such, but it was their second day of operation and the rest of the friendly service more than made up for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the snazzy wall separating our table from the main dining area.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cool chandelier above our table.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer and cocktail selection.

M3bt0dRc-UV-b70v1ouj1w.text: I ordered the pepperoni pizza for my little ones, some wings, and one of their specialty pizza... I cannot seem to remember what it was called but it had spinach, white sauce, and bacon in it...  Although pepperoni pizza was decent, I really did not care for their wings or their specialty pizza. I would give this place a try if you are around the area... otherwise, you can skip this place IMHO.

kD45OggAbrE-mBENkTgVHA.text: The food is great here! The Gotham Pizza is the best! (It's like a meat lovers) it's always nice and toasty.  The sausage sandwich is really good! It's a good portion. The garlic knots are tasty, small serving though.  The service is great, depending on who you get. There is a male sever that isn't the best.   It is rather convenient that you can walk up and get a slice to go. It's the best $5.50 you can spend.

-FblwhZLL7bgvdLaOT_D0Q.text: Got a chance to try Five 50 today on my buddy's poker comp dollars - the only way I would feel like I would eat a 28 dollar pizza :\  The pizzas were excellent, both in quality and taste. Certainly, this isn't delivery pizza, and is a just a notch above a CPK. The crust is fluffy and yet at the same time crisp, and the toppings are clearly of a high quality.  We tried the Blanca with spicy italian sausage and the Truffle as well. We enjoyed both of them thoroughly.   Certainly, you are paying a premium here. 22 (cheese) to 29 (truffle) for a (non gigantic) pizza is at best considered "casino" pricing, and at worst, just flat out a rip-off. I don't think I could even justify coming here to spend 5.50 on a slice, as the slices aren't really "meal" sized like some places.  We also had the pork belly appetizer, which, when digested with all the ingredients in a single bite, was just absolutely incredibly. Still, it would be 15 dollars had we been paying ourselves.  In the end, it wasn't a bad experience at all - in fact, service was really good and we came away very happy. However, the bill without consideration of comps would have been 100 dollars before tip (3 beers too). That's a lot for a pizza meal! It was good, but not THAT good...

pl2lVTKTMRRjoW_vsLCwbA.text: *Thumbs up* The pizza is fine -- nothing memorable. The crust isn't thin, nor thick, just in between. It's not particularly cheesy, either. If you're too lazy to walk and craving some late night grub to sober up, then the pizza will satisfy your stomach. I used my MyVegas rewards, so I got 3 slices for free.  *Thumbs down* Your better off walking the extra 10-15 minutes next door to Cosmo. Secret Pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DD9_Q440ZVuNDI2847fAEQ.text: This is just for the to-go slices, since our group wanted to hurry and eat and return to the casino.  While not cheap, this is one of the less expensive places to grab a quick bite. My friend had tried the Godfather, which was a meat pizza and encouraged me to get that. However, I couldn't resist the mushroomy goodness of the fromage. It tasted every bit as delicious as it looked, and those slices are huge! Definitely a good place to visit if you want something yummy fast.

bPBVWxIVwE99o_s1B-RIZw.text: Our group of 3 decided to go here on a Friday night and we were told it would take about 20 minutes to be seated but to wait around and it might be sooner.  Went to the to-go counter to get a drink while we waited and no one came to take our order and we saw there were more options at the full bar in the back so we headed back there.  We were about to order and then we were seated.  The person (who I assume was our server) came over to fill our water glasses.  He never even looked at us or said anything, clinked the glass water bottle on my friend's cup and then spilled water all over my glass and never acknowledged any of this, just walked away.  He didn't seem new or clumsy, just didn't give a crap about his job.  We looked over the menu and were disappointed to see they had something called "mozzarella bar" but it was really just a list of meat and cheese for a charcuterie plate and only one type of mozzarella; I had seen this online originally and was excited to try some new cheeses. After at least 5 minutes of sitting there with no one coming back over (and they had plenty of servers to handle the people there) we decided to leave.  If we were going to pay $30 for a pizza, the service needed to be A LOT better.

MEYrcg2_yIXCB4iBP_9sgg.text: This was our first time here. Our waiter wasn't that detailed as to how the pizza should be ordered and well didn't even read the menu until after we order.  Anyhow we order 1 pizza which is 6 slices.  I forgot the pizza price but each topping is $2, which adds up quickly. LoL  The pizza was yummy, nice and flavorful. Crust was thin and had crunch.  We also order a salad which we also enjoyed, it had beans in it.   Service was good, but could have been better.  Price is high compared to other joints.... Pizzeria and Blaze is a lot better, but here in Vegas you sometimes have no choice when your hungry and don't want to leave the hotel.

_AUHOJhbYBhkodNRTv8wOQ.text: We stayed at the Aria were this place is located. The resort is beautiful and very elegant. This place was so crowded that we decided to eat here. Food not bad but I think it was crowded because the bar tender was very generous.

b-IUYXDaxC-ycWPFArCo4g.text: We wanted to find a hang out spot to kill sometime and since we were stating at Aria, we decided to just stop by at one of their spots.  Walked in at around 330pm and was able to find a spot at the bar. Ordered some drinks and appetizers just to kill time and hang out.   - Old Fashion - this is one of the best that I've had since the one I've tried in TN. They squeeze fresh orange to give it a fresh taste and it's absolutely perfect.  - Bloody Mary - they use fresh ingredients and a homemade tomato juice that's absolutely amazing.   - Beef Carpaccio - this was just ok, it came with arugula, sliced beets and peanuts.  - Chef's 3 - we chose burrata, mortadello, and cappicola. It was an amazing mix of meat and cheese. It was served with their homemade mustard, pickled veggies and olives.   I would definitely come back here for their old fashion, it was my absolute favorite. Staff are very friendly and tentative. Great food, great drinks and great service!

10LtQTYvxUQUuBKba-F1wg.text: The BEST Pizza in Vegas.  Apparently just declaring best in show isn't enough.. Is it the unique quality of toppings and tastes?? Is it the fact the pizza is cooked in a wood-burning oven?? Or that for a few dollars and two minutes time, you can eat amazing pizza without any hassle.   There is a full bar and restaurant seating in case you want to wine and dine but no matter any of the additional critiques that might go into these reviews, the pizza is so GOOD that even if the waiter dropped a plate or forgot my Coke and called me silly, I'd still award 5stars cause it tastes that much better than any other pizza I can think of within any reasonable distance.

vDO62Rm8YAXX_gIWdCBmzA.text: I liked Five50 Pizza Bar. So much, in fact, that I ended up coming twice in the course of one night at the Aria. It was an easy, comfortable spot for dinner as well as for drinks and dessert after some time on the casino floor. The only problem with Five50 Pizza Bar was that the pizza was no good.  We came for an early Sunday dinner after driving in from LA with no particular plans. We were thinking about leaving the Aria, which is where we were staying, but inertia got the best of us when we stumbled across a pizza place right by the sports betting station. It was only 5:30, but we were hungry after our time on the road, and the restaurant was beautifully empty.  I liked the vibe of the place. Very much of one piece with the Aria, ritzy and modern with high ceilings and interesting decor, but casual and fuss-free. There was a large bar that ended up being half the point of the place, and service was solid. We ended up coming back with a couple more friends when we needed a place to catch up later in the night. We brought our leftover pizza for them to eat, and our server didn't call us out for having the take-out box on the table.  That pizza, though, was some of the worst I've had in a while--no contest when measured against others in its price range. These were expensive personal pies, and they just didn't taste good. They were flawed on a basic level, limp and greasy with way too much cheese. The toppings were good, at least. The Catania came with white sauce, garlic puree, Italian sausage, rapini, and roasted tomato; the Forager with white sauce, mushrooms, bacon, whipped ricotta, and spinach. Pretty good ideas, but not enough to redeem the pizzas.  Weirdly, everything else was great. The beet salad was excellent, a colorful mix of local beets with watercress, farro, pumpkinseed vinaigrette, and grissini. One of my friends doesn't like burrata, so we got it with goat cheese--accommodating kitchen, and a nice substitution. When we came back after dinner, I had some kind of craft beer on tap (I forget which, but it was a good one), and partook in a couple of decadent milkshakes. The Vegas root beer float was a satisfying shake loaded with vanilla ice cream, caramel, Butterfinger crumbles, and Boylan's root beer. The mint chocolate swirl mixed mint ice cream with chocolate syrup and chocolate mint cookies--what's not to like there? All shakes were available in adult iterations, but the beer was good enough for me.  I enjoyed Five50 Pizza Bar despite its failure to deliver good pizza. I'd recommend it for an easy drink or meal if you're hanging out at the Aria. I wouldn't hesitate to go back; I just might avoid the signature offerings.

RzeEJrm6_lh44JE79XCt8g.text: I don't have pics because we woofed it down!!! But we ordered the small mac and cheese the arugula salad and a pizza with tasted like an alfredo sauce with tomato, sausage some type of greenery I'm assuming it was maybe little broccoli it was absolutely incredible! We ate as much as we can it had so much flavor! This is probably the best pizza in Vegas! We ate at a couple other places this past weekend and it was just basic Pizza it was crap but this pizza was awesome the mac and cheese was so juicy and Rich and tons of sauce and flavor! The arugula salad was a healthy portion and tons of fennel! Ask for a little bit more dressing or lemon with Cracked Pepper on the top it was awesome! The service was great as well our waiter was awesome and excited to help us! We just kind of wandered around Vegas until I got tired of walking and I stopped here and said to please and that was it be sad and it was the best decision we made! if I find the picture again on here on Yelp I will grab it and refer to it that's how I found it it was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. this is what we ordered! It was excellent I totally recommend it!!

6EMyCgn9fpStX9SfhzgtYA.text: Amazing pizza! Great service! The shake was good, not great. I would recommend this place!
