Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QFNLXXkhydzgheSsB9seXQ.text: When I first saw signs that this place was opening soon, I was excited. I'm not sure why but I guess it was good advertising. After going the first time, I wasn't impressed. It wasn't bad or anything but it def wasn't memorable. We ordered the Gotham pizza which comes with pepperoni, sausage and salami. It was a little too much for me.   During the most recent Restaurant Week, I noticed they had a good lunch deal so my friend and I decided to give it another try. After we got there and saw what was including in the deal, it seemed like a better idea to just order what we wanted. It probably came out to the same price and it was good we wanted to eat.  The garlic knots were decent. Nothing to rave about. The pizza is cooked in a wood fired oven, at 550 degrees. :) This time we ordered cheese and pepperoni. It wasn't bad but like I said, its not my favorite or that memorable. The service wasn't great. It took a while for drink refills and they weren't even that busy. Overall, I think this place is expensive for the quality. Considering the location, I guess it would be less expensive than the other options though.  Tip: They sell pizza by the slice. This would be a good option if you're staying at the hotel or need something fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uUfGsc1kjUxcw1esT4_dUA.text: Located inside The Aria hotel and casino, Five50 is a great spot to grab a quick slice or have a nice sit down meal.  Five50 offer take away option and sells by the slice.  When staying @ The Aria Five50 is always a must.   Highly suggest:  Fried Calamari Meatball Sandwich  And any of their pizzas   Elvis Shake -  BANANA & CHOCOLATE ICE CREAM, PEANUT BUTTER, CANDIED BACON, WHIPPED CREAM ADD MYERS'S RUM -$6-

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMG.......Pizza!
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari.......YUM

9u6HMr0eTHjYv4uzpU-9nw.text: My wife and I decided to grab lunch. while gambling at Aria.  We ordered from the lunch special two course option- either soup or salad and a personal sized pizza for $18. We both ordered the POACHED PEAR SALAD (Benton's Country Ham, Wine Poachachached Pear, Babyabyaby Greens, Toasted Pistachio's, & White Balsamic Vinaigrette) it was delicious.The lunch pizza comes with the choice of 3 toppings. I choose (italian sausage, meatballs, and onion) The crust is thin and tasty,and the wood fired crust was cooked perfectly. There's the perfect amount of sauce, and the shredded Mozzarella cheese is creamy with an amazing richness. Two people could likely split a pizza especially if you get a salad or appetizers. The pizza truly has "east coast's bold flavors and Italy's delicacy to create something totally unique." They sell pizza by the slice, highly recommend giving it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. POACHED PEAR SALAD - with  Toasted Pistachio&#39;s, &amp; White Balsamic Vinaigrette
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Pizza with italian sausage, meatballs, and onion

RP6VROmjim6vGAt17uwlnA.text: If you need a quick slice or craving for great New York style pizza then this is your answer. I've already written a review of this place in this past and this is definitely one of my favorite pizza place in town. Don't forget to try their Five50 Chopped Salad too, one of absolute favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SQe0tYRrsJFs-LKSgNIWag.text: I have dined here twice and enjoyed it both times.  The first time, we sat at the bar before seeing Zarkana. It was a busy night and the service was a bit slow, but friendly. Not a big deal - we planned quite enough time before the show and weren't in a rush.  We shared everything:  Garlic Knots ($6): Great portion and huge knots. Really tasty.  Beer Mac 'n Cheese ($12 - half order): Again, good portion size and really good - the prosciutto is a nice touch.  Chef's Selection Charcuterie (6 for $28): I know it seems pricey, but man was it worth it! They were not stingy with the meat/cheese and we actually got to choose the 6 we wanted. We went with both Burrata and Buffalo Mozzarella, as well as the Humbodlt Fog. For meats we had Mortadella, Soppressata and Prosciutto. Everything was really fresh and SO SO good. i would definitely order this again and it was perfect for sharing.  Finally we got the Gotham pizza ($28): Also pricey, but we both really enjoyed it. It had pepperoni, salami and sausage.   We ended up with way too much food and were stuffed. They also have good drink specials - I thought the prices for the beer/shot combos were really good and they have a great selection of beers.  The 2nd time I dined there, I just grabbed a quick slice from the slice counter. The great thing is that the counter is open until 3 AM on Fri/Sat. It was just $5.95 for a HUGE slice of pizza and it was really good. This time I got the "Forager," which has whitesauce, mushrooms, bacon, whipped ricotta and spinach. I've been dreaming about this slice ever since.  Overall, it fits a certain "niche," it's connected to the Race & Sports Book and can be considered a fast casual experience. Or you can grab a slice on your way back to your room - both are great options. I'll definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slice of the Forager - SO delicious!

iXcYWOTIAshcV9Yt5sSn4A.text: This probably one of the best pizza I ever eaten. We order a large pepperoni and salami . It was so good. When im in town  again I will be coming here

7GooZhZZ567LGLWxypAA0A.text: Omg thanks god they have new management , Jonathan what a great GM and zoey our helper great attitude and great food. Thank you guys for turning our experience here 180 degrees.

BN_Amjfy3ewCFSi8FH2OFw.text: Great tasty pizza.  Our party of 5 each ordered a pizza and shared with plenty of leftovers. Pizzas took over a whole second level of our table.   We Tried the Mac and cheese - dry and flavorless.  Enjoyed the atmosphere. Very good for talking, no loud music.  Nice upbeat

7ZcHTD44vHJk7UIKlnYTUg.text: At here twice while visiting for a conference. Nothing more convenient than the walk up slice counter. About $6 for a slice of pizza is totally reasonable in Vegas. I can't remember the name of it, but the one with the mushrooms was pretty good. The mushrooms were fresh and they kept them large enough to really taste.   The calamari was solid but nothing too spectacular. The the fennel salad was perfectly dressed to avoid too much dressing and there wasn't much fennel taste (which I actually prefer).

upnHxNBIu-_MJH9tmbc5Zw.text: Nice, solid place to get dinner in Vegas, especially the Aria.  One thing to note for families is that this restaurant is near the sports book which is now smoke-free.    We got a super early dinner (hadn't eaten since driving from Pasadena to Vegas in the AM).  Ended up splitting a hummus small plate and a margherita pizza with my cousin.  Both filled us up pretty well.  The drink menu was pretty standard that had decent choice of beers and cocktails for those interested.  The restaurant itself is nice and cozy for the most part.  Most of the tables either surround the oven or the bar area, which is located in the middle.    You can also grab pizzas to go to from the front, which is good as well.  Price is bit expensive, but you're in Vegas.

N23Jnut_W4xaREobxJLpHQ.text: Really loved the pizza here while staying at the Aria and the fact that the pizza bar stays open late was a HUGE plus. Obviously eating there and getting a fresh made to order pizza is better than a reheated slice of pizza that's been sitting out for who knows how long, but even that is still good! So that says something! Def try it both ways! You won't be disappointed

Gohy_3esUuYjglgMAit2ZA.text: Stayed at Aria on our last trip (Dec. 19-21). Stopped by Wed. evening for a late dinner and got a slice of the Gotham pizza to eat in the room. Hot damn, that was one AWESOME slice! They pop the slice into their wood burning oven for a minute to warm it up. You can tell they use high quality ingredients, and the Grana Padana cheese really stands out. The toppings, especially the pepperoni, are nice and crunchy thanks to the high heat of said wood burning oven. It was ~$9 with tip (I tip, even on to-go orders) and it was worth every penny. So much so that I got another slice Thurs. night to bring back home. Ate the slice Fri., and yes, the crunchiness of the toppings and the dough did suffer, but it was still better than anything I could have gotten elsewhere, even freshly baked. Can't wait to grab another fresh piece (or maybe a whole pizza) the next time we're back, especially since we usually stay at Aria or Vdara.

t17AL6EmOH2TZUS8N2l8-w.text: Absolutely amazing pizza. I bought pizza by slices and the size was really big. The dough was so delicious and had crispy edges. The sauce was very tasty with many ingredients on the top of it. The place itself look nice and the staff was kind.   I have a great meal and will go there once again surely. You must try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ABGIQMoUNx5PKrnrwKjpeA.text: This pizza is good, and the salad is fresh. Best Margherita pizza outside of Italy. I also had the chopped salad with it and it was amazingly good.

nTW7pmgsTYC6XF_aOmQ6_A.text: Come here if you want a quick snack. The pizza was a little greasy but overall tasty. They have a to go line of about 5 pizzas sold by the slice. It's quick and efficient. Located in the back of Aria near the sports club.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forager: mushrooms, spinach, ricotta

EAGV5NId-AAvTXTmM18T5w.text: Bummer we had to give it a  3 star due to the $18 chopped salad...salami,provolone,mixed lettuce...only got a few pieces of  meat and cheese,way over priced-yes we did mention it..we did enjoy the pizza,pasta,chocolate milk shake everytime we visit tho.

3xzeFqrDT8FVKlnPWZaSWQ.text: This place is amazing! Staff made sure we were very well taken care of and the food was awesome :)

MKl3kBpq2t4nH_awT2vf7w.text: Cheese pizza was really good. We arrived at Vdara on a Thursday at midnight. Everything around the immediate area was closed. Thankfully this was place up open until 1am.

g-04kC-XYxqtThBPHPLRqA.text: It was ok. Nothing to brag about. Especially for the amount of pizza in reagrds to price. Service was also ok. The waiter looked bored and his service and attentiveness (lack off) confirmed it. Im a local and I was taking some out of towners on the strip...next time ill go off strip to many other better pizza options.

myekQI1wxaC4tHdtTNWCgA.text: Best pizza I have ever had! I'm still dreaming about the pizza!  The waitress was not friendly, but who cares if the pizza is that amazing!

nHHi6JFCU-MGEm4fZM-Mwg.text: The 5 cheese pizza is great..went to a conference 2 weeks ago & i ate this pizza everyday for 5 days lol..tried the pepperoni as well..& the cheese spinach..they were gd but not as good as the 5 cheese one..

9ulRZ94jBlnrlabQOsY0ng.text: At $5.50 for a single slice of pizza this place is a deal in the land of overpriced meals.  One slice is more than enough to fill you up for a few hours and the pizza was delicious to boot.  You have to order off a fixed menu if you want to purchase by the slice but they have something for everyone, including a vegetarian option.  You can also order a whole pie with your own toppings but expect to pay $35.00 MINIMUM for a basic 3 topping pie.

g-2rVMdvjo0cV4p9mcEZnw.text: SOOOOO YUMMY. wings & pizza to go? YES, please!!!! I'll eat here every time I stay in vegas.

dOltWdHpqvzflDgAE-z-iQ.text: Very good pizza, bought it by the slice and unless your starving 1 slice is enough. Would have given 5stars if the girl at the register would have smiled

21dCuwk5lQhyz3cPHgkQzg.text: My boyfriend and I walked into a restaurant filled with screaming football fans this past Sunday afternoon.  Being that we are not sporting fans we were quickly annoyed but got over it and settled in at the bar (which was not crowded)  We ordered a couple of cheese slices, caesar salad, and the italian hero.  All were awesome, fresh, and decent in portion.  However, service was lack luster.  Originally my boyfriend ordered the meatball sandwich and out came the Italian sandwich instead.  We didn't care and we have both worked in the industry and understand these things happen but when the bartender looked at us like you have two heads and claims that we didn't order the meatball sandwich, I was a little put off.  Whatever, I was hungry and with that I ordered an additional cheese slice and again I got that look from our bartender like "Really, you guys want ANOTHER slice, how could you?!"  It was odd.  Also, our drinks were left empty after we finished our first glass and remained that way for the entire meal, we were never offered a refill (again we didn't mind and god forbid we ask for something else we would like to consume!). Food....awesome. Design.....awesome. Acoustics......not so awesome. Service......with an attitude.  Four stars because because we didn't get many items from the menu (but we will be back to try more) and that lame bartender is very replaceable and so I won't judge the restaurant, it's menu, or it's concept on something that is as disposable as a inefficient employee.

nNPra3VEdbpsKVqZzmORBg.text: I had the chopped salad and a few slices at the Bar. The salad was great it would have been better if I would have gotten no hot peppers. The forager slice was good and the plain slice was a little better. I cant give this anything higher then 3 stars, although it might be some of the best pizza in Vegas.

0CodAuGlD-kCQg8g8UrBYA.text: Great food followed by great service! Great selection of wines with a wicked selection of beers, IPA's were top notch. Can't wait to go back! Shout out to Micah, the manager of the restaurant who was very attentive and made us feel at home. Try it peeps, you won't be disappointed!!

yKOHSbsEhQpijfrGLRRuIA.text: Grabbed a quick slice between meetings and gambling. A good cure for a mid day hangover.  The pizza is decent. Not as good as a Chicago deep dish. But this is Las Vegas. And I don't expect the best. Was a good value also.....

vQGIC-Wv9YYqTn7eiY44dQ.text: Pretty tasty pizza options and all things considered affordable for the location. My main compliant was the burnt edges of the crust. I get it, it's cool to show you cooked with fire but the taste is awful! Finally, the staff is mixed between those who seem too cool I help you with your late night or mid day pizza fix and a few genuinely happy to give you that which you need to make it a few more hours in the gambling area.

2eVt1cMMtt8KEB1JyDx6tA.text: We visited on a Monday at 7:45 pm.  There was no wait so we were seated right away.  We waited 20 min for one beer and water.  Grumpy waitress took our order shortly after.   Took over 30 min to get pizza.  We ordered the Gotham.  Crust is very soggy and not even browned on the bottom, despite the edges being burned. Pizza had little flavor and sauce tasted like a spaghetti sauce.  Waters were empty most of the meal. Had to ask for parm and peppers.

NesWveFbUrL4srLdSM1IrQ.text: We were in vegas for 4th of July and we had the chance to try Five 50...  I was really amazed at the food.  We had the truffle and Gotham pizzas and they tasted Great.  They also have high end beer on draft.  The atmosphere is really nice and cozy.  so the food was excellent but the service was even better.  We had a nice guy named Sam wait on us and he kept checking back on us when the food was taking too long.  Over all, this was a great place to dine at.  Highly recommended.

qeYs-mZ-K0dZ0F_C3JW0bA.text: Great pizza from a woodburning oven.  Grab a slice and a beer to enjoy while taking in a game in the sports book or sit down in the very nice looking restaurant.  Either way, delicious food that is reasonably priced (by modern Vegas standards).

qMV02H6eoSImADHqZc9aOw.text: Great place for a recovery meal with a large group. Blanca & Gotham pizzas are the best! Great ambiance and visually pleasing from every angle. Great beer selection too.

VEdmQViXvC-M1pj-jnrqFg.text: Let me start off by saying the only reason I didnt give this place 5 stars is because it is extremely pricey! However, it is delicious! I know many locals try to steer clear of the strip but really this place is worth a visit. Be prepared to spend some $$ though.   This place is one of my top pizza places. We opted for a full pepperoni pizza as I dont care for slices. The pizza was flavorful and the crust was amazing. Definitely recommend if you love pizza!

RYibSC1f-8J_7p_80xldbw.text: Might be the best deal at the Aria! We hit this joint up late at night, and ordered pizza by the slice(which is about the size of two normal slices of pizza). It's $6/slice, but it's great pizza that's baked in a traditional fired oven. Seriously good pizza that's at a whole new level compared to the other large slices you can find on the strip for $5. *****

toOAOkVPxnwCEJ3Y5s71VQ.text: I don't understand why they make people wait when the restaurant has plenty of empty tables. Additionally, I don't know why they put tables so close together then we someone is seated right next to us, two couples pretty much got up and left. And there were plenty of other tables to be seated at. The service was not up to par.  For that nonsense, this place gets a single "*"   However, the marguetta pizza was delicious with a great crust and the meatball app was very tasty.   I find the front of the house operations were poor.

C_8ibh99lpLnOK98qzScCw.text: Fantastic pizza!  Perfect crust. Just chewy enough and the toppings are delicious. My better half got the meat pizza and we shared the Gotham and spinach and mushroom - forager and Blanca. All were great. The ricotta was the best. Best meal since we've been here. Also very reasonably priced.

sOKsI6LW8nrgNE5TTFEIRA.text: Awesome place. Pizza is amazing. Bartenders are amazing. Definitely coming back here next time I'm in Vegas

riC0lXreP9EYf_XjIHEkxQ.text: Food was good, but CHECK YOUR RECEIPT! Not only had tax, service charge, AND gratuity added, but about half of the drinks ordered were all mysteriously $4 or $5 more than what is on the menu. The bottle of bubbly that was ordered was $8 more than on the menu. Some of these were corrected by our server and some were given a bs upcharge excuse. Again, not a bad place but check your bill!

opVpjov470Pz5iQg-8hGzw.text: Got take out pizza from this place. So-so pizza with a young blonde cashier who calls everyone "Hun" and will repeat that word at least a dozen times while you're waiting in line. She tells me a slice is $6.50. I told her I want a small can of diet coke and she tell's me that will be $11.50!!!! I asked her if she had that right, a small can of coke for $5 and she nodded affirmatively. The balls of these greedy owners to think of marking up a can of coke 2000% from their cost.  Is this the last can of coke in Las Vegas? This is the kind of markup you see from a creepy guy in a film about survivors of some weird post apocalyptic future where there's no fresh water. Avoid this place.

pBkAXg6E4_cK4714BqwbqA.text: Chef Shawn McClain has it going on.... I like "pizza" okay I LOVE 'pizza', and this place is the bomb.  Great selection, cool atmosphere and awesome service.  Weeee did I mention I love pizza?

PEshwk4qbDGA4i02fK2WXg.text: Our original plan had been to go to the Aria buffet and then off to our show but after an hour in line we realized it wasn't going to happen and had to come up with an alternative plan fast. It turned out to be the Five50. Best alternate plan ever.  I always judge a restaurant by customer service first then the food. The customer service was spot on the evening we were there. We had no wait, our order was taken quickly, drinks arrived in a timely manner, as did the food. The server, Sam, was very  friendly and courteous.  We had a basic pizza with onions and bacon. It came with full on slices of bacon and chunks of onion. No cutting back which made the price more than worth it.  It was hot, cheesy, and messy just like you'd expect a great pizza to be.  I'm not sure how to judge the cost. Yes it was expensive but it's Vegas and it's the Aria. What do you expect? As long as the customer service and food are above par then I'm fine with cost.  I can definitely recommend Five50 and we will be back.

svXYzbAhw-xBXMQNOG3-vg.text: You can't go wrong here. The brick over pizza is some of the best quality I've ever had. My wife and I hit it up a few times within 4 days. Quick and delicious!

CKQl9ECtAODcNEUfAnZR7A.text: Secret Pizza is great, but Five50 is better.  Was just back in Vegas for a show, and made the now obligatory trek over to Five50 just before closing.  The place was hopping, but they got the pizzas out quickly.  SOOOO much cheese on the 5 cheese and the perfect amount of spice in the sauce.  The crispness of the crust has a hard time holding up to the generous toppings, especially after a trip across the street to our hotel, but it was still delicious with just the right amount of tang and a pleasant amount of chewiness.

O47wI6Ha8HLQ8lIIJah_bw.text: Best pizza on the strip. A bit pricey, but it's located in the Aria, so you should expect to pay a bit more. Nice location near the poker room and sports book. I prefer to hit-and-run the degens in the poker room, grab a slice of pizza and watch sports.

SBgKgRzaFNDi32Xd7CCrLA.text: Seriously, I can't believe I haven't wrote a review on this place because it seriously stole my heart! my bf and I travel to Vegas once a month and stopping to get a 16inch pepperoni & mushrooms pizza is non negotiable. Their pizza is by far one of the best ive ever had, the crust is so delicious, they cook it in their brick oven and it gives you that fire flavore. If you haven't tried this place,  your taste buds are hating you right now!

ONS8G8jmzUvHN7KQDA07IQ.text: We decided to have the three course meal.for 20 it was a great value. Started with a melon, prosciutto avocado salad which was amazing. Added garlic knots and went way past my expectations..cheesy soft inside and crunchy outside. We had the gotham and the forager personal pizza's. Both were yummy. The cons were it took forever ti get out food. Not even the appetizers came out quick. They didn't make the right pizza I ordered so they brought out the one they made and made up for it by making a bigger one of one I ordered. I would definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slice of the Ghalagher. Best white pizza I&#39;ve ever had.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cantaloupe prosciutto avocado yumm

fskM5sk27B5NzA-rSSe3Qg.text: Got there for a late night snack. The pizza options looked so welcoming but it was 11 pm and we wanted snack. First of all the waiter took one drink order and disappeared in a rush! Did not come back until 5-10 minutes when we saw another guy who we called to our table but finally took the order of food and drink. Two glasses of beer took them 15 minutes to bring. Then we sat and waited for one appetizer (mac n cheese) and a chicken sandwich. After 35 minutes I showed my 35 minutes I showed my yelp checkin time that we have been waiting. He was very nice and apologetic. He brought the mac n cheese and said "don't want to serve raw chicken"! Please don't underestimate my knowledge about food! The sandwich arrived after exactly 47 minutes. Both mac n cheese and the chicken grilled sandwich tasted good just a little too fatty but ok. Waiter was also nice and gave me one extra glass of beer. He was trying to make it up for the almost an hour wait. I'll love to come back to try the pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good. Worth trying.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich waited 47 minutes for it. Too fatty but good.

-oxkRDrc6OLY6Qz5NoUHYQ.text: Stopped in to grab a snack and drink at the bar mid-day during our stay at the Aria - atmosphere is 5 stars for its trendy/modern style and super friendly bartender. Drinks were fine, but overpriced even for a Las Vegas strip resort ($15 draft beer) and the food just wasn't good. Had a few small plates, most notable the meatballs tasted odd...not recommended. All in all there are so many good little spots in Vegas....this one can be skipped!

cg_aQAa9H0Gn5HajJnTivw.text: The manager and the man at the pizza counter are a generous two stars and the pizza is almost four stars.   I walked up to the pizza counter, curious about the pizza. I asked if this was Neapolitan Pizza and the guy seemed annoyed I was asking him a question. He said it was a hybrid between New York pizza and Neapolitan. I then asked him why the pizzas on the counter looked different than the one being made and he said because they are different pizzas. Obviously I knew the pizzas were different because of the different toppings, but I was basically getting at the pizzas have been out for too long that they look completely different from the one being freshly made. I then asked to speak with the manager to tell him about his employee who clearly was annoyed answering questions. He seemed to hear me but at the same time did not offer me a discount or anything to make up for the disappointing first impression. I should have left after this but I still ordered a slice of pizza. I ordered the spinach/ricotta/ mushroom pizza and it was just rich enough without being sickeningly rich. The crust had a sour flavor which is completely different from a New York pizza or Neapolitan. I appreciated them trying to be different but it was a little to sour for my taste. The crust was chewy, all the ingredients paired nicely together, and the sweetness of the ricotta helped balance out the sourness of the crust. I must say the pizza was pretty delicious, but the price is a little steep at almost $7 a slice.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ricotta/spinach/mushroom

enVdk1boJxeLtgdx9aMS0w.text: I always visit Five50 when I'm in Vegas. It's tucked into Aria, towards the Sports Book. It's not a huge place but it's a hidden gem in my mind. The pizza is some of the best I've had. If you're in the mood for pizza on the strip, Five50 is must to check out.

pAWQ8vwJxv1jeZ_I0Maq9Q.text: I really enjoyed this place on my recent visit to the Aria Casino. It's located near the sports book, which was a plus for me.  The pizza was great and they had a nice selection of local craft beer, which was nice since I was visiting from out of town.  5 Stars all the way!

cxHQZ_FBwL60TWWDZTKBVg.text: The Forager (mushroom) pizza was just fantastic. Hot and fresh, and with plenty of toppings. The Beer Mac'n'Cheese was excellent as well. One of the best values on the strip.

0oZAeRASyQta9ndqgXdP2w.text: I did not expect much from looking at the pizza bar, but getting a fresh pie was a different story. The pizza was delicious. I got the Farmstead for my half and my friend got the blanca with peppers. Luckily, my meal was paid for, otherwise it would have been a $100 tab for the one pizza, an appetizer and several drinks. Not worth that kind if price but if you limit the $8 beers you'll be okay. I recommend getting whole pizza made for you and not settling for pizza that sits and waits at the pizza bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half farmstead, half blanca with peppers. Liked my farmstead half so much I never tried the blanca side.

0ZqGhVVfvHeqVl1l_-X7Fg.text: Five50 Pizza Bar is located in the Aria. The decor is unremarkable though there was a great selection beers.  I ordered a margarita pizza - this is a basic pizza when done correctly can be utterly amazing. It is usually a fresh tomato sauce, basil and mozzarella cheese. This pizza was really disappointing.   $30 for a 16" pizza that was literally dripping in grease. We had to use 4 napkins just to soak it up, it was served luke warm, had to be warmed up, which resulted in more grease. The crust was odd - it had a sour dough taste.

Jcp1g-Ll70tzZ77JEXAlZw.text: Tried the Pizza by the slice counter on our first night here at resort, best pizza I've had in a very long time and I'm from Chicago, so believe me, I know my pizza! Decided to try the actual restaurant for dinner tonight. Ordered Cesar salad for dinner, not very tastey, not enough dressing in salad, but croutons were delicious. Overall, I would recommend that everyone gives these guys a try.

Hj3Jg7wbNycPEPa8p2MU1g.text: Had a craving for pizza while in Vegas for a business trip.  I often gamble at Aria so I decided to give Five50 a try for the quick service counter.  There were 4 pizza choices but they seem to fly off the pan with everyone in line.  I had a slice of the forager pizza and 4 cheese.  Both slices were great tasting and the thin crust was nice and crispy.  It motivates me to try the full restaurant the next time I came.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars was the lack of choices at the quick service counter...it didn't look like they could make enough pizza's to keep up with the walk-ups so it was a downer not being able to get what you want...instead..settling for what was there at the time.

xe1FF6keUMT6I0rROfNiCw.text: Awesome place, great food and atmosphere. Our waiter was friendly and prompt. Chef Shawn is a great guy and I highly recommend this restaurant.

XwCdp_iqHobP5nKIsvi1WA.text: Actually, the pizza was pretty good.  The dough was a bit soggy but such is life.  The service, however, yeeks.  I booked an 8:00 table via Opentable.  I got there, and though the bar was crowded, many tables were open.  I waited...and waited.  Finally, I got a drink at the bar.  I managed to find an open seat, which helped.  Then the hostess (8:30) came to take me to my table, except that there WASN'T A ****ING TABLE.  I was told it would be another 20 minutes or so.  And I had lost my seat at the bar.  Thanks.  The hostess offered to comp me a drink.  Unfortunately, she evidently didn't tell anyone else, as my drink was still on my tab.  I'm on expense, as I'm here for work, so it really didn't matter enough to argue the point, but come on.  If you promise something, follow through.

IcWc6HiTocae6gQ-OM2RuQ.text: Pizza was so-so, server and service was horrible and server was incompetent. Thursday is industry night and I am in the industry so I should have received 50% off, waiter refused to give me the discount and then proceeded to tell me that it was only for MGM employees. Then took the cash of the table as his tip when he was to apply the cash and then run the card for the balance. HORRIBLE experience.

2uJTurPPITgBolkowgcQlA.text: Great pizza. Crust was amazing. Thin and cooked to perfection. Pepperoni and cheese was very tasty. Would come bAck again for sure.

jVwNSXYN4PE2xxUMkixDFQ.text: Certainly cannot agree with the 4+5 star reviews ot this place, since it may be the most expensive pizza restaurant in Las Vegas. We ordered the Gotham Pizza, which is "supposed" to include pepperone, sausage & salami, but there was ZERO salami, & only a smattering of sausage. Perhaps a dozen circles of pepperoni. Lots of cheese if that pleases you? For $28 I think customers should expect something "better". Onions? Peppers? Olives? Mushrooms?  However, anything above the minimal serving of meat, would push the price well above $30, since each ingredient adds another $2. For those who want to spend $30-40++ on a 16" pizza, I wish them well. For us -- we go to Wolfgang Puck's in the Crystal Shopping Mall attached to ARIA, & get a better pizza for 1/2 the price.

sfIsjw_V4cP9pABZd23UsA.text: Very warm and inviting as soon as you get to the entrance.  Pizza is great with an excellent selection of craft beer   The bartender David is knowledgeable with a great sense of humor.  I will be heading back there ASAP

Kqv-AVsu-OALhCUdWrK4lQ.text: This place was almost perfect! Pretty quick service and very friendly, delicious pork belly crostini and forager pizza. The cheese plate was just ok. 4 stars instead of 5 because 5's are for beyond perfection, which is hard to find! I'd go again, especially for the pork belly crostini!

TiAinE7wXSPfnd1OgKIbfw.text: Very poor quality for the price. The slice counter is under staffed and the wait time is long just to get a simple pizza slice.  When you order a whole pizza to go from here it comes in a different size and price not listed on the menu. I tried this once and that is when I realized how low quality the cheese is here. Because I had leftovers I put them in the fridge for later. The next day when I took the pizza out to eat it a plastic like layer had formed over the top of the pizza I was so disgusted I had to throw it all away.

C-9Gp2bKORsJk2WQ2G_gtA.text: We had a great dinner here the other night. We tried the mozzarella sampler and the forager pizza. Both were great, as was the service.

CdlkloKiul8nBw9Mp5TJug.text: If you happen to be in Aria, it's a good pizza spot. Overall though...eh. Greasy pizza, good chewy crust, service is subpar. If you're in Aria and craving pizza then go. But living here, there's no need to go out of your way.

8JJtA0ADA3J5zQfo_F56QA.text: Ok if you're able to bite it as soon as it comes out of the oven. Thats kinda hard to do if you're not dining in. If you would like to find a seat to sit and enjoy it, good luck with that. This pizza gets cold pretty fast, not warm, cold.

EOHI58gUxJbz-Je0xHGH9w.text: Yummy!!! I love this place!!! The truffle pizza may be a bit pricey, but it is the best pizza that I've ever had in my life....Soooooo Good!!!

2c7X2vc_qb9yywzJsRANEg.text: We ordered the garlic knots and the marguerita pizza which were both excellent. It was plenty of food for two moderate eaters. The televisions were playing a good game, the place was not too crowded, it was a nice atmosphere. However, my problem came when two couple who sat after us got their food before us. I thought it was strange so I mentioned it to my partner who had also noticed. We then had to wait another 15 minutes for our order to come out.

ol2QKOHwazcKWmMUstwZ7Q.text: One slice of pizza was 6 bucks. There is not really a place to sit. The attendant wanted a tip for handing me a slice of pre-made pizza...seriously?!

TtzMI7mBjGcSen0h2t5v2w.text: Margarita pizza was absolute delicious! Only waited about 15-20 for our food to arrive and our waiter Sam was very accommodating! Drinks were very good, I ordered a Cosmo and my pop had a margarita!

hfspFO7dhGA9YHXg7dPYDw.text: Best shakes ever! I got the smores one and they actually roast a marshmallow and put it on top! We got a half and half pizza both were great and the spaghetti was awesome, the noodles and sauce were wonderful. Good prices too!

WI33UK-NqSWcd81M9xRYXw.text: So far so good. Stopped in for a quick bite to eat before heading back to work. Very nice wait staff and quick to respond. I ordered the Italian sub which was really good and didn't take long at all. Hopefully I will get a chance to come back later to spend more time here but pressed today. All in all a real nice place, good atmosphere, great waitstaff and the food was really good.

I6uSsGM11DqaGbyYpk03QA.text: This review is based off of a quick togo order: nabbed a slice of the Gotham pizza and it was awesome. Can't comment on any other aspect of this place until I return for a sitdown. Line was very quick for to go orders.

OeZ4udnGbdjpu-EVMqZhuA.text: So freaking yummy.  Try the Spendinis. So good we ordered another after finishing the first. We had the Margarita pizza and didn't disappoint! The cheese was perfect and so was the dough. Service was solid. Definitely recommend.

Hwh-MMe1wavXzyBZtkEslg.text: Great pizza, good service, solid all around!  We had the cheese plate as well which was delicious.  Definitely check out if in the aria.

ZyYf9DJFJ-NSqpnuFlgOqg.text: Why is this place so hit and miss.. It used to be consistent with service and food but recently few times it's been below average. Came here this Fri and brought my friend and his family along because I told them it was the best pizza in town. I made reservations for 430pm and we were seated right away.. Our server was a guy who was a little cocky...but whatever he was still nice.   We ordered two pizzas and the first one I told him I wanted it well done.. He said they come out nice and crispy so no need to be well done.. Well this wasn't the pizza I was eating so ok.. The second pizza I ordered I wanted it well done because it was the one I was eating.. So again I told him I wanted this pizza well done and he said again they come out nice and crisy so no need.. I told him I always get it well done n they have always done it for me.. And he again said no need and don't worry about it.. It'll come out nice. Ok whatever..  Well when we got our pizzas.. Guess what... Not well done enough.. And the 2nd pizza..the one I was eating was warm not hot n the veggies were on the luke warm side.. Like they had it sitting there before the other pizza was done.. Well I was irritated because i wanted a well done pizza and trusted the server which I should not have.. Now for me to send the pizza back to have them atleast reheat it would take another 10-15 mins.. Which means half the table would be eating while the other half waited. At this point I was so pissed off I would have said something to the server but I wouldn't have been nice about it. So I bit my tongue n ate the pizza. Next time I go il make sure I do not get the same server.

GUayO8vChH3hNUi3djWyYg.text: I am a local and need to get some quick food going on as I was starved. I sat at the bar and ordered a slice of Gotham pizza. Megan the bartender was great.  So I am sitting there over 20 minutes and I am thinking to myself it is taking so long because they ran out and had to bake a new pie.   The slice was delicious when it finally came. A couple sat down next to me and ordered a couple of slices and they had them in 2 or 3 minutes. Wat?  I spoke to the manager on the way out and asked him why mine took over 20 minutes and the people next to me to maybe 3 minutes at the most. He stated, "maybe she forgot to order it".   I don't really care the reason because this was a broken first expereince. I did not ask for anything. I did clearly tell the manager that I needed to know why the delay for my Yelp review.  One might think, in Las Vegas, that a manager might comp a $7.00 slice of pizza or offer me something to bring me back.  5 stars for the food. 1 star for feeling like I was jacked around after the delay.

IiARwwMVD8qeTuNo4IogwQ.text: Stopped in for a quick bite between meetings and it took a bit longer than I would expect, however I want to pay a big compliment to Bonnie who was managing a TON of people at the bar and was managing all of their expectations with grace despite some issues that were slowing down the kitchen. As a customer, I didn't mind waiting because I could see how busy the place was and Bonnie was doing a great job of not loosing her cool considering she was caught in the middle of everything.

qMR4DHu6SXCpjdT5AD7frQ.text: Looking for a good pizza spot and this place came up. The inside looks great. We had the Gotham pizza which was good. But our serve John wasn't to talkative. It didn't look that busy on Sunday evening had if he came to our table 3times it was news to us. My husband did want another drink but when he did come over we both decided that he didn't get one because of the long wait. Good pizza though.

wNLHf41F7tC1jWk3Mnb2kQ.text: What a great meal and experience!  Have stayed at the Aria before and never been here.  Mistake!  Will be back!  Our server Aaron was attentive and knowledgeable.  Pizza was delicious and the salad was as well!

JspbtCZBjeg2-BeSqjNCuQ.text: I didn't like how I was treated by the "cashier" Christina  She refused to look at me  Hesitated to take my card Slammed my pizza (box) on the table.  She was however very please to the people in of me. And behind and I had to ask myself why was she so disrespectful to me.  The color of my skin-is the reason I wanted to give this place zero stars.  Damn and in a luxury hotel one would think the only color they see is GREEN, but not with Christina.  Note: I went back and spoke with the manager (Sean) and he told me the cashiers name. He did apologize, but what will happen to her from here. I got the impression  of nothing.

62mmyk97JKuM_3s1bqAIoQ.text: Yes this pizza is overpriced because every restaurant on the strip is overpriced.  But this pizza is so good.  It's very underrated.  I really loved it, the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was it was pricey.  I had a slice of Gotham.  This is a great NY pizza.  The ingredients and sauce were on point.  The pizza was piping hot fresh, the bottom was nice and crunch but never burnt!!  The dough was so good.  If you want thin crust pizza, cooked NY style, with no black burnt spots and tastes great, this is it.  I only wanted to have one slice before going to bed, I ended up having a second slice was it was so good!  Additionally, the waitresses are lovely and friendly.  My server was Megan and she was great!  Customer service was excellent and fast, refills on drinks without asking.  I will return again to Five50!

YZ1t9BVPYy8w9IA4Z5Vntw.text: This review is in reference to their takeout counter which is right as your walk in on the right.  This place make a really great slice of pizza.  The pepperoni is my favorite.  I have been here several times late at night after being out and about and they have never let me down.

INGesSVVWIDRjHK8Ga4rag.text: Came here after working a long day for an event in Vegas with some of my team members. Service was nice, we received our drinks pretty promptly. We also shared the Gotham and Magharita pizza flavors to score the deal that was on the menu for two pizzas. There was so much cheese in both pizzas that it was a mouthful everybite, and my stomach started to hurt afterwards (mainly because I'm lactose LOL). They were good, just full of cheese  We only really ordered from here because there was nothing else walking distance and we were STARVING. I wish we went somewhere else though, the food here is pricey.

xmMwdBDBIB-SEW41gfQ1qQ.text: Living in Las Vegas we have many wonderful options for pizza. However,  if you want more than a "pizza joint" atmosphere paired with an amazing menu of appetizers, flavorful pizza options, over the top shakes with great service give Five50 a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JbubpeHeuxWE9eLn53goCA.text: Yo!  This pizza is GOOD!  Yes it's overpriced.  It's in a hotel for crying out loud. Not any hotel but it's inside of the Aria so of course it's expensive silly :)  But it's good.  I don't mean good drunk pizza.  I mean good damn pizza.  The crust, the sauce, the oven is hot, the ingredients tastes so damn good on the pizza, especially the basil.  Is it the best pizza you've ever had in your entire life?  Probably not but man it is good!    After an awesome pool party we walked back to our hotel hungry as hell.  We stopped in Five50 Pizza bar because we wanted good food that we did not have to get dressed up to get.  4 of us, ordered one slice each, different varieties (pepperoni, margarita, meat lovers, veggie) that's why we didn't get 1 large or XL large pizza.  Literally after the first bite we all ordered one more to take upstairs.  Loved it and would eat here over and over again.

ieCq07_AFDLJn4z9UKFK0w.text: I LOVE FIVE50. It is my favorite pizza restaurant in Vegas. I love the individual slices, especially the Gotham or Truffle. A great place to get a drink and enjoy the pizza and appetizers (all delicious).  Staff is attentive and quick. The food is always good and quickly. It is a little more expensive but it's so worth it. AND yes, I think it's 100 percent better than secret pizza place in Cosmo.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham

MAX5NOCsibQ5u0z1SGieJA.text: This pizza place was awesome! We got a slice of the Gotham which was good and a slice of the White pizza which was my favorite, it was creamy and cheesy goodness!  Our cashier was nice and we got our food super fast!   However there aren't many options for getting pizza by the slice, next time I'll definitely get a table so I can try one of their more creative looking pizzas.

2DqF2dqQzE1iYvO0IlJAzQ.text: This is amazing Brick Oven cooked pizza!! Their wings are delicious. It's sad that you cannot order pizza by the slice at the table, you have to order a whole pizza!! Servers are not friendly. They seem unhappy with their jobs.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Five 50 Pizza Bar located inside Aria hotel.

B-lXCXpC-kXEVtTeg3C-pg.text: Some really dang good pizza here. It's great cuz you can grab a slice to go, or sit down and order a whole pie. Menu is not limited to just pizza. This restaurant has as its founder a James Beard award winning chef. Been here a few times over the years (including last night for a slice, oink), today we tried the lunch special. Highly recommend! You choose between a salad or soup, then choose between a pasta or an individual pizza. $18. If you want to  you can add a milkshake for $5. The pizza was much bigger than any personal pizza I've seen before. You can choose from their options or build your own with up to three toppings.  Delicious crust, delicious toppings.  Today I ordered the CATANIA:  WHITE SAUCE, GARLIC PUREE, ITALIAN SAUSAGE, RAPINI, ROASTED TOMATO Delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. CATANIA WHITE SAUCE, GARLIC PUREE, ITALIAN SAUSAGE, RAPINI, ROASTED TOMATO
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasonal salad
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elvis milkshake: peanut butter, banana, chocolate with !candied bacon!

1llvkt_oC5umdEJMR1FVhQ.text: We were staying Aria and looking for a casual bite on a late Sunday night to take back to the room. Five50 Pizza to the rescue. It was almost closing time but the gentleman at the counter was super cool and even boxed up our 4 slices in the big pizza box. We went with 2 slices of Gotham (pepperoni, salami, sausage, mozzarella and grana padano) and 2 slices of Forager (white sauce, mushrooms, bacon, whipped ricotta & spinach). Both pizza types were good and definitely hit the spot. The slices are big and the crust is great. Great flavor combinations, the both of them. Re-heated in their wood burning pizza oven at just the right temperature and length. We really enjoyed it.  We stay at City Center often so we will definitely have to try and have a sit-down meal at Five50 next time. Located inside Aria Hotel right before the sports book. Very busy area of the casino so you may think all they sell is pizza. But they have a full menu of Italian fare.

bmPLZ7DphEatauZUMj_S3A.text: I can't speak for anything other than the Margherita pizza and the garlic knots, but they were both terrible. We spent the night here and we decided to try it out because we were hungry and it was late. The garlic knots were hard and doughy in the middle, but the tomato sauce dip was redeeming. The margherita pizza is positively one of the worst in town. I have lived in Vegas for 5 years and I have tried many different pizza places. I would rank this below Costco and tie it with Little Ceasar's. The dough was like a busciut, tough and dry. The sauce was a joke. The whole pizza was a joke, especially at $30!! (You can get arguably the best margherita pizza in town for only $15 at Settebello).  The experience there is not for the faint if heart, as it may very well ruin ones day.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mE0Vz42rQvWOTQRKFYn1lA.text: Let me start by saying that Five50 Pizza Bar is WAY better than the neighboring Secret Pizza in the Cosmopolitan.   Numerous restaurants state that they use only the freshest ingredients, but at Five50 Pizza you can taste the freshness.   I brought two finicky eaters with me for my first visit. We ordered a Margherita pizza and a Caesar salad. Five50 Pizza took two very simplistic dishes and made them extraordinary. I loved the crust, the sauce, the cheese...EVERYTHING!! Even my picky eaters couldn't get enough of the pizza and salad.  Five50 Pizza doesn't try be something they're not. So, don't come here expecting Chicago style pizza. They actually have more of a East Coast meets Italy vibe, so it's big but not greasy. You can't go wrong getting a pizza pie here.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

8bWF-X1EmtcaXGhdXVafRw.text: After a long day of traveling, I finally got checked into my hotel room at the Aria.  I wanted something quick to eat before I went to bed and was happy to learn they had a pizza restaurant in the casino.  I headed down and ordered my two slices and a bottled water to bring up to the room.  The wait was short, the service was friendly but the price was ridiculous, about $25.00 for 2 slices and a bottled water?  You have to be kidding me.  I was expensing it for work, so I wasn't too worried about it, but still that is a bit ridiculous especially considering a whole pizza is a little over $30.00.  Had I been provided a refrigerator in my room I would have just went for the whole pizza since it is a better deal.  Anyway, I ordered the Gotham, the slices were pretty big and the flavor was on point.  Probably some of the tastiest pizza I have ever had.    Bottom line... To be honest I would definitely go again even with the outrageous pricing.

IKYlPjqfCxzgxfOdKWY3Xw.text: We were craving a late night slice of pie after a long day walking the strip. This place did not disappoint. New York style pie. Appears they have a sit down restaurant but we just got it to go. Only complaint is that lady working the counter talked too fast. Had to say what a few times to get. Guess I'm just an Ohio bumpkin. Hard to keep up in sin city.

_k00t3qDiqCCtTQ9Gp2XVg.text: Hidden in the very far back of the Aria is Five50 Pizza Bar. Not busy and therefore we were sat quickly. Ordered a wheat beer recommended by server. The pint was 9.00 and was pretty tasty I must say. Water is filtered and comes out of a fancy bottle without ice. We ordered the chopped salad and Gothom Pizza. The chopped salad was enough to split at 14.00. It was full of Italian meats and cheeses and you even could find some tasty greens. It was mighty good. We also shared the Gothom pizza (priced at 28.00) which was 16 inch topped with a variety of Italian meats. It was thin crust right out of the very hot oven. Tasted like it came from New York and although we were stuffed we enjoyed it to the very last bite. There is no reason to not give this place a 5 star but the management had only one server for the restaurant. As good as he was he was over worked.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza ovens
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham Pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped Salad

lyPzJ8Ge1jhurTPVsY8tZw.text: Aria employees got a little taste of Chef Shawn McClain's Five 50 Pizza Bar slated to open on July 4th, at the former Skybox location. I  was lucky enough to try two of the eight pizzas available. I tried:  GOTHAM: sausage, pepperoni, salami, mozzarella, grana padano  THE FORAGER: mushrooms, spinach, rosemary, and whipped ricotta  Both were very delicious, and the crust was perfectly crunchy with a nice chewiness, and tons better than Secret(ly pathetic)Pizza across the street. Other offerings they will have-  MARGHERITA: tomato, basil, and mozzarella  NORTH BEACH: clams, smoked mozzarella, sweet onions, and oregano  FARMSTEAD: country ham, creme fraiche, farm egg, olives  SICILIAN: pancetta, broccoli rabe, pepper flakes, and white anchovies  TRUFFLE: potato, truffle salami, bechamel, fresh thyme, truffles  BLANCO: fresh mozzarella, ricotta, olive oil, chopped garlic, basil, and white cheddar  I also overheard  one of the guys saying that a couple of different sizes were going to be offered and prices weren't available at the time. they were also in the process of finalizing all menu items.  Other fun facts:  550- The ideal oven temperature for Chef McClain's pizzas, and 5:50pm....the start of Happy Hour!  It will be an open kitchen with three different areas:  SLICE COUNTER: You will be able to walk up and order a slice and grab a cold one  CRAFT BEER BAR: Full service bar in a centralized location featuring 6-10 craft beers  MAIN DINING ROOM: a combination of two and four tops with communal dining to accommodate all guests  Stop in for a slice or a whole pie..It is Dee-Lish!!!    ALOHA!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Opening on July 4th!!!
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Info on Five 50....
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. what 550 signifies......550 degree oven, and 5:50pm...the start of Happy Hour!!!

fImWg2z57cj7Vz4fxlqk1w.text: I was really excited when I heard there was going to be a new pizza restaurant opening up in Aria.  So I dropped in to check out this new pizza joint at Aria called Five50 with a friend after work. It is the second restaurant opened by Chef Shawn McClain (Sage) at Aria, so the expectation of excellent food was high.  The Five50 name seems strange, but according to them is the ideal temperature for cooking your pizza in the oven (so is that Fahrenheit or Celsius?). And until just last week, 5:50pm was the start of their Happy Hour and the promotion was 50 cents beer.  Now HH is from 5PM to 5:50pm (is it still considered a happy HOUR if it only lasts 50 minutes).  $5.50 might also be the starting price of their pizza by the slice (don't hold to it in case I am mistaken, but it would fit the pattern of this gimmicky name).   The restaurant is beautifully designed.  It looks great from the outside, although the "VIP" area near the back and by that "wall" is just too cramp to be fully functional.  Service was friendly and efficient. Since the restaurant is still new, it also appears that they have way more staff on duty than are needed.  Will be interesting to see if the staffing level will remain at current level in 2-3 months.    After looking over the menu, which is mostly a beverage menu (the entire outside cover of the menu is the wine, beer, etc menu), while the inside menu consist of Snacks (5 items), Small Plates (your upscale appetizers), Salads, Pastas, Meat & Cheese, and the 8 pizza selections or you can customize your own.  Tried the Forager Pizza (Mushrooms, Spinach, Rosemary, Whipped Ricotta) and it was good. The pizza crust was the star, while the toppings were quality it was also  not exactly generous.  If I was hungry and didn't have a late lunch, I can totally finish this 16" pizza myself and not break a AYCE sushi coma sweat.  So it was not even a challenge to split it with another person.  If I come back I will want to try their Gotham and Truffle pizzas.  Their Small  Plates and Pasta items sound interesting too, which may actually be the more exciting offerings from Chef Shawn McClain's new pizza joint/craft beer sports bar.  Food:  3.5/5  Quality ingredients used on tasty flat bread pizza, part of the overall tasty crunchy crust was sadly burnt.  Creativity:  2.5/5  Nothing that I have not already seen done somewhere else.  Considering the talent of a chef that bested an American Iron Chef, I know this place has way more to offer in this department.   Price/Value:  3/5  Casino pricing for the convenience of not having to walk or take a cab somewhere else.  If you want better value for your dining dollars, get a panini sandwich from Jean Philippe Patisserie (in Aria and Bellagio).  Service: 3/5  Never had bad experience from any of the wait staff at Aria, but waitstaff could be better trained on what is offered on the menu.  Are breadsticks complimentary? If so, we didn't get any while we waited for the pizza.  Decor:  3.5/5  Hip, upscale decor with dim lighting that fits the overall darker color scheme of Aria (not my style preference, but I just like the brighter more energetic look of other interior decorator's executed vision more).  A-OK and perfect for guests in Aria and CityCenter complex.  (Needs better HH)

oYP80R9VoBB5E9M7vt8uTg.text: The pizza here is crazy good. We ordered their meat pizza, baked Mac n Cheese and cheese platter. Everything tasted great and was cooked PERFECTLY!!!     We will be back!!

68wdu9t1eSy5VwRuRiNiSQ.text: I have been working at Aria for years and finally had the opportunity to check it out last night.  I am so glad that I did.  Brad was behind the bar and he was great!  I ordered two glasses of Barbera wine and two slices of pizza, both were d'lish.  The service and food were great, and not overly pricey for the strip.  Brad reminded me that Thursday is service industry night and half off, so I will definitely be back!

PSMZkK5_sW42FdBRjpRt-w.text: Have to have this in your rotation if you're staying at the Aria and need quick food or a quick beer

XABfHAAu4zyQQGq5NDp48Q.text: Great wood fired pizza.  Good service even for late night crowd. We did 16" pie, (6 slices)- half/half Gotham and Truffle, both delicious!  Chopped salad was great side.

hFh30dqCQEkFqv53mOjW-A.text: Really good pepperoni pizza. Okay margarita pizza. The atmosphere is nice. Good place to watch a game and have a nice slice or pizza

6ukJGl9nLxwY-BRwItperg.text: We ordered the Little Gem Caesar salad and the Margherita pizza. We shared between three people and were full. The pizza was delicious. The sauce was sweeter than most places but very good. The salad had larger pieces of lettuce. Would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little Gem Caesar
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita pizza

uKkJDyGa60w988Uk2lSzHQ.text: Pizza and beer for Breakfast it was. They open at 11 and we were the first ones there. The pizza and ingredients are all made fm scratch. It's Delicious!  Honestly one of the Best Pizzeria I have ever been to! The personal pizza is good enough, you can order a side salad or butternut squash soup on the side, both delicious!! I would definitely come back here again and again on my next visit to Las Vegas!! My husband ordered the 5 cheese and he loved it! I had the another signature, has white sauce, ricotta cheese blended with other good cheese, spinach and bacon inside. Both pizzas were Very tasty!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butternut squash soup, delicious!
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad, really good!
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottom pizza has white sauce, spinach, ricotta cheese, mushroom, ,&amp; bacon inside, sorry forgot the name.  The top pizza is a Five Cheese

GdqLsFkxlvAyvA8RmVWdoA.text: Came in looking to try out Aria's new casual pizza place. The concept had a lot of promise - a grab and go pizza joint located right next to the poker room, race & sports book, and casino. I redeemed MyVegas rewards to get what was billed as a slice and a beer for about 10,000 points. To redeem points,  you have to go to the mLife desk in the casino. The clerk gave me a $17 voucher good for whatever I wanted at Five50, which made me realize that a slice of pizza and a beer cost 17 dollars?!?!?   I ended up redeeming for two slices of pizza and a bottle of diet coke for $15. I got the Gotham and the Margherita - both were good, but nothing I'd clamor to return for. They set up some round tables off to the side near the entrance to the Sports Book for people who just want to grab a quick slice. Frankly, I still prefer the pizza over at the Cosmopolitan's secret pizza place more, but Five50 is a decent option within Aria.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tables for a quick bite

s3JqFtWOAXeIDTyCy3Cf1g.text: Some of the best Pizza I've had outside of Italy and New York! I came here twice to grab a slice for lunch during my recent stay at the Aria. The first time I had the Gotham slice which had some great tasting meats on it but the star of the show was the 5 cheese for me. It had just the right amount of cheese on and they blended together to make a delicious gooey topping. The tomato sauce had a good tang to it and wasn't too sweet and the crust was golden delicious.   I wish they stayed open later though as it would be the perfect snack to refuel my gambling habit.

6XUbEZOKRCdIz98WKaCvSg.text: We have 2 kids that wanted pizza from Five50, but the rest of the family were planning to eat at the Thai restaurant in Aria.  I called restaurant reservations and they said we can bring pizza from Five50 to The Lemon Grass (the Thai restaurant in Aria). So we got 2 slices of pizza for the kids.  But because the wait time was too long at the Thai restaurant we decided to dine at Five50 as well.  They won't let my kids to go into the restaurant because they were holding their slices of pizza.  Are you kidding me???  I find that hard to believe!!  They let us bring pizza to another restaurant to eat but not in there own restaurant???  My kids felt unwelcome that they couldn't go in to join the family to eat but had to stand outside to finish their slices of pizza before they can go into the restaurant?!  I understand that the restaurant wants the customers to enjoy the whole dining experience and not to eat the take out pizza in the dining room. But that's just 2 little kids that were hungry. The rest of the family were still going to order from the dine in menu.  I found that very unreasonable and total lack of flexibility!!!  Although the server tried to explain but it completely ruined our dinner experience.

Lw3QlR9N5guLB4tqtsgbMQ.text: Pizza Type: Thin Crust Business Type: Independent Beer/Wine: Descent draft beer, bottles and wine selection  Overall opinion: As is tradition for me when trying a new pizza place for the first time, I had the Margherita pizza. It was delicious, and the freshness of the ingredients was apparent. My only issue is the value proposition, which cost it a 5th star.  They only offer one size (16"), which is too much for one person, but not enough for two, and they run around the $30 range. It was a great pizza, but should have been at least $10 less.  Because of the price of the pizza, I didn't get one of the delicious sounding milkshakes on the menu.  I would have ended up spending close to $50 for one person on a light meal.  Bonus:  Located at Aria Resort in Las Vegas, this is the only location and is headed by James Beard Award-winning Chef Shawn McClain.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of April 2016, Part 4
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of April 2016, Part 3
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of April 2016, Part 2

xjtYwzGga3NlNcsr0hPlyg.text: The server Amanda was what was lacking here.  The food was a little pricey and tasted fine but the server,  she was rude and slow and made our entire table feel unwelcome.   We came on a Tuesday night when they were not particularly busy.  It seemed there was only one server for about 8 or more tables. We waited awhile until Amanda came to our table.  She seemed highly annoyed and was really short with us.  We felt like we were bothering her.  Two pizzas and two appetizers took 30 mins to appear and someone in a suit brought it to the table.  There was a nice bus boy that refilled our water and was doing all the busy work for Amanda.  I work in the foods industry as did everyone at my table.  We could tell Amanda had a lot of tables but we watched her make this poor bus boy do all the heavy lifting while she just kind of drifted around the dining room.   When one of my group asked her for a to go box, we got  more attitude.  Amanda was annoying,  inattentive and lazy. When I come back I hope she's not there.  The service really overshadowed the food this time.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy bottle holding not so fancy water
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni and cataña
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs

GCMndS4ZaR2JBNenobizGQ.text: If you are a pizza place and you fuck up pizza then something is clearly wrong with you. Five50 thankfully does not..however I did go for Happy Hour and ordered pizza by the slice.  I highly recommend (if they are still doing it) to show up between 5-5:50PM during their happy hour, get faded and eat pizza. The ultimate sloth life daily regiment.

L0Hz_978nI5OhVwJueb9XQ.text: Lunch is a forgotten meal in Vegas.  Endless crowds queue up and drop benjamins on brunch and dinner -- but nobody gives a damn about lunch anymore.  While I mourn the decline of lunch, I also take full advantage of it.   That means finding the best lunch specials available -- and the lunch special at Five50 Pizza Bar is a perfect example.  I normally wouldn't go out of my way for a place like Five50, since similar concepts are a dime a dozen in San Diego.  What San Diego doesn't have, though, is an excellent pizza-centric lunch special, consisting of soup and personal pizza for a mere $18.  (San Diego also doesn't have a restaurant with Shawn McClain's name behind it.)  When I dropped by at around 11:30am on a Friday, the crowd was evenly split between twentysomethings nursing hangovers with take-out, business travelers and solo diners at the bar, and larger families and groups in the dining room.  Five50 is actually very easy on the eyes, with retro-style murals on one wall and cool interlocking wooden brick latticework on another.  Since Five50 is tucked in the very back of the Aria casino, thru-traffic is minimal, making it a surprisingly quiet and subdued place to grab a meal.  Like I mentioned, it's really all about the lunch special here.  The soup of the day was minestrone, which was absolutely perfect -- warm, hearty, comforting, and healthy to boot.  For the pie, I tried the truffle pizza, which comes with salami, potato, and creamy bechamel.  While the flavor of the pizza was good, it was also a total greasebomb.  I also wish the potatoes hadn't been so hard and undercooked.  Service is fine in that stand-offish, I-have-no-reason-to-friendly-to-you-since-you're-a-tourist-who'll-never-come-back-here sort of way, which is typical of the Strip.   That said, I'll still probably come back next time I'm in town, if for no other reason than that lunch special.  Join me in my crusade to make lunch the new brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. truffle pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. minestrone

BdZAPpdxJqTrO9MPreI8Xg.text: Sports bar themed spot tucked in a casino corner, featuring brick oven pizzas made to order. My companions split a Forager and still had a couple slices left over. I got a sandwich, not bad but I didn't expect much, though the potato chips were fantastic! Really good service especially compared to other casino restaurants I tried, and food came out right away. Prices are pretty typical for hotel restaurants if you don't try to eat a whole 16 inch pizza yourself. Went here on a whim and was pleasantly surprised.

ZZFG3zUXVV9El_9oEhmb0w.text: Shawn McClain Five50 pizza bar at Aria serves the most delicious mouth watering Pizza. We had the Gotham pizza, a NY style pepperoni and cheese thin crust pizza with oils dripping! Two of us ate the whole 16inch pizza. Also, try the Carpaccio for starters... It's the best I've had! Match with the house Cabernet and you'll have a very satisfying dinner. That should cover your protein meal for the week. The service not so good. After we got served, our waiter didn't came back to our table to check on us until we asked for the bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FRZ7qA4VVGD6I3nYlGfqtg.text: TRUFFLE PIZZA. I repeat. TRUFFLE PIZZA. The mix of truffle, potatoes, pepperoni, and a bechamel sauce sounds odd by my oh my does it work beautifully. Highly recommend.

v88oUcVJkL9efWHB8MoK4Q.text: When my husband wanted to grab pizza to bring over to our friend's place, I looked at him puzzled. I complained that there's so many other better choices than pizza. I mean c'mon it's pizza and this is Vegas!! But boy was I totally completely wrong because the pizza was so freakin delicious!!!!  We ordered 2 whole pizzas: Gotham and Forger and 2 salads: Caesar and Italian. We picked up our togo 50 mins later and headed off the strip to our friend's house, which was 25 mins away.   Once we got there, we all dug in. To my complete surprise, the pizza was still crunchy and not the least bit soggy. The dough was so perfect and the flavors all meld together in harmony. It was so good that I ate a total of 3 1/2 slices (the slices are huge!). I really couldn't believe how good the pizzas were!   Now I can't wait to go back to Vegas to grab some pizza. I wouldn't recommend the salads though. It was small and boring. Skip it.  Remember, the next time your SO suggest to get pizza, don't be an ass because you might end up eating your own words like I did.

rtFeTDm4AlswWPi8wPm54g.text: There aren't many dining options for lunch at the Aria, so we were excited to see Five50 was open.  The restaurant has a comfortable, laid back vibe to it, the service is good and the food was delicious.  We started with the meatballs and the mac 'n cheese and then I continued with the $18 two course lunch of the beet salad and a personal pizza with mushrooms, onions and meatballs - yummy!

TsfNR-F-Adb7jpOrsJ9rZg.text: Okay pizza, horrible service...I think our waitress was bothered by the fact that people were at the restaurant.  The pizza took a long time considering the restaurant was less than half full and then came out with burnt edges.  We had to ask multiple times for water and had to track down a bus boy to get a napkin and silverware for my husband.  The manager appeared to run around a lot but never checked in at our table, neither did our waitress.

q5-4IkevSu8ZN5zq__ppTw.text: Came in here at 10pm after a long day on the Strip. We were a little on edge not having eaten since lunch. Amanda took great care of us & got our food & drinks out quickly. She was great & Food was delicious ! Arancini, meatball sandwich & Gotham pizza. Crust on the pizza was really good. I'd recommend this place to anyone who is looking for great service, pizza & drinks.

0QpHyGmzuvZFNIZHITFIeQ.text: Great pizza and even better service!  The Aria knows how to train great people that are super nice and friendly.  Love this place

9q8BI29xqePx4gMjOMYWlQ.text: Heirloom Tomato Salad. Shrimp Crostini. Gotham Pizza.  Pretty good. :)

-L279qvYqA1qV34piPeFbw.text: Great salads, but this place tends to burn the crust making the crust taste terrible.  Our crust as many others we saw were, was burnt circumferentially - we tossed 3/4 of our $25 pizza.  They also had a hard time keeping our drinks full and a looonnngg wait for our first drink. Also, ARIA just started charging for parking - expect waits getting in and out of garage during busy times as well as the added expense - as if you didn't already lose enough in the casino.

MwfT8dwT2ZKWSiN8dJpBbw.text: Great pizza, delicious sandwiches, lovely decor, fast service, and the prices aren't outrageous for Vegas.

3oLTz0x2PDEQJbigLBh5Lw.text: Pizza, renowned chef, located in my fav LV  hotel...what's not to like? I'll get to that shortly.  I guess the name comes from the ideal temp to cook a pie in the oven. What I will say is it made for a comical exchange between me and concierge to see if we could get a reservation:  [Curtains part, our hero stands outside in sunny SoCal in front of a non-descript office building filled with boring ass people.]  "[Man answers phone] Hello, mlife concierge, how may I help you today?" "Hi, can I book a reservation at Five50?" "Certainly sir - which restaurant?" "Five50." "Yes sir, but which dining establishment?" "Er, Five50?" "[A slight undertone of frustration is sensed in the man's voice] Yes sir, but which of our restaurants are you inquiring about?" "Five50! The new pizza joint you guys opened a few months ago." "[Sincere apologetic tone] Ohhh, I'm so sorry sir - of course, I'll look into that for you right away."  [Camera cuts to the man and our hero sitting opposite each other in front of a raging, elegant fireplace in matching burgundy leather armchairs, toasting glasses of finely aged scotch whiskey and laughing heartily as they reminsce about the good ol' days and that one time when the hero called to make a reservation. End scene.]  So I made that last part up but yeah, no reservation needed. ANYWHO.  Layout of the restaurant is cool, and the divider from the casino floor is made out of wooden blocks stacked on the ends of one another so not to fret, you can still peek through and people watch, i.e. dudes can still oogle at girls dressed to the nines (I myself wouldn't partake in such an activity as a gentleman but good info for the rest of you dogs out there - you get a pass since it's LV after all) ;) Plenty of space so you're not elbowing the table next to you.  Meatballs were really good and garnished with arugula and radish; tender and yummy. Calimari was okay...a little too much flour and fairly greasy. Real disappointment was the pizza; we got the Forager which had mushrooms, ricotta, brussel sprouts and something else but there was clearly a thick layer of oil on top of the cheese; don't think I've ever witnessed oil as a topping, even at fine pizza places such as Pizza Hut or Dominos. I mean, it was so bad the crust was almost translucent...that's just nasty and sloppy work imo. Speaking of the crust, it was baked too long so it was hard to bite into; maybe this place should consider a name change to Five00? I will say the pizza tasted excellent overall, a bit too cheesy and rich for me (lol @ diets), but the flavors were all present and intermingled well.  Service was good, though our server was an awkward little deer which was kinda cute and endearing - I'll chalk it up to Five50 being relatively new.  I'm definitely down to give it another whirl, but please, do something about the oil - think of the children! Price is fair for what you're getting, and c'mon, you're balling it up at a pizza joint in Vegas. Watch out Cosmo Secret Pizza, there's a new player in town. And other than the slightly confusing name, it could give you a run for your money and potentially be a future jackpot spot for pizza lovers.  Ended with so many gambling puns - what do I win?

ZuNxm6oLk-dT8RrcgQLI8A.text: The fiancee and I are big fans of Chef Shawn McClain's other Aria restaurant, Sage, having enjoyed memorable food and drink while there.  Given our past enjoyment of his cuisine, we decided to try his newly opened FIVE50 Pizza Bar.  Our decision was made even more palatable since we'd gotten coupons for a free slice and beer from MGM's myVegas game on Facebook.    We arrived around 6pm on a Wednesday night.  There was no line at the slice counter where pizza by the slice was sold.  We noted immediately that not all pizzas available in the sit down part of the restaurant were available by the slice.  No matter, since the Gotham ($5.50 per slice/$28 for a 16" pie), a meat pizza topped with pepperoni, sausage, salami, mozzarella, and grana padano was what I wanted and it was on the abbreviated slice menu.  FIVE50's slices are taken from their 16" pies, which are divided into 8 pieces, so slices received aren't very large.  Also, since they're pre-baked, there's no telling how long they've been sitting on the counter.  My slice was plucked off of the counter and slid into the wood-fired oven at what I'm assuming was 550 degrees to warm it up.  A few minutes later, I received my slice.  The crust was decently flavorful, crispy at the edges, but not necessarily chewy throughout.  I attribute most of the lackluster quality of the crust to the fact the pizza was pre-baked, had cooled down absorbing the grease from the relatively ample amount of meaty toppings, resulting in the crust becoming soggy and limp.  I was pretty unimpressed.  My fiancee didn't fare much better with her selection.        The beer selection at the slice counter was also abbreviated with only two beers available on tap and a handful of bottles.  It was also surprisingly unimpressive with only one of the beers available (a bottled Dogfish Head) sounding remotely interesting.  Unfortunately, they wanted $13 for it, which combined with the slice of the pizza, exceeded the value of the coupon.  I could've paid the difference, but as a matter of principle, I'd never pay $13 for a 12-ounce bottle of beer.  My parting thought was that FIVE550 may be a very good pizza joint with a solid craft beer selection.  Perhaps our luck would've been much better had we sat in the dining room, ordered a whole pizza, and tasted a freshly baked pie.  However, you won't get that experience by the slice at the walk up counter.  It's overpriced...expect to pay $16 for a beer and a slice, and it, sadly, underdelivers.

4hXMxd_hsweU159XWlWGJQ.text: This review is for a recent sit-down meal (my first time at Five50).  Next time, I will try the pizza to go (which did look absolutely delicious.) My best friend and I wanted to grab a small bite and beer at Aria.  We decided upon Five50.  For starters, it took a solid 10 minutes just to seat us.  I figured the place was packed, but once we entered the dining area, over half the tables were empty.  Not gonna lie, I was slightly hungover from Saturday night escapades, and was particularly thirsty.  It took a SOLID 15 minutes (yes, I looked at my clock) for any server to even acknowledge us! Once we were finally acknowledged, it took another 5 minutes to bring over a carafe of water. I understand that there seemed to only be 3 servers...but again, the place was not that crowded.  The servers weren't in much of a rush either.  The food itself was very, very good, as was its presentation.  I got the mac & cheese and my friend got the wings.  If I were rating Five50 solely based on food, I'd give it 4 stars.  The service definitely merits no more than 2 stars though.  While our waitress was friendly, the lack of attention and length of time it took to get our water, food, or really to ask for anything additional that we needed was just way beyond what it should have been.  I'm patient when I need to be (place is packed, servers running around)...but this didn't merit much patience (not crowded, servers chatting it up instead of checking on their guests).
