As mentioned previously, I'll definitely give it another chance and try the pizza.  If I ever come back here for a sit-down meal though, I'll bring a bottle of water and anticipate delayed service.

h4NuBgfCeyQ45vUZB-W-iw.text: Five50 Pizza Bar has some of the best pizza I have ever had! I had both the Forager and the Truffle pizza. The truffle is definitely my favorite. Great atmosphere and a friendly staff (:

B9VFWQXA0gckADFBqXJODg.text: I came here to redeem the MyVegas reward for a free slice of pizza and beer. Since I wasn't really feeling a beer, they said that we could sub it with a soda. I wish we could've gotten an extra slice of pizza instead, but no such luck.  We got a slice of the forager (white sauce, mushrooms, spinach, bacon, and ricotta cheese) and the blanca (mozzarella, ricotta, cheddar, basil, and garlic). Both pizzas were really good and surprisingly filling. They were super generous with the toppings. We walked around the strip all day but weren't hungry for a good six hours.   The cashier woman was eh, not very friendly at all. For saturday lunch, it was extremely empty in the restaurant. And at $5.50 a slice, I don't know that I'd come back. But I love being inside the Aria, so it was good for a one-time experience.

lpy2skSdbUqpI_POu86a2g.text: We just wanted to grab a quick bite there. Super nice place. The design is phenomenal like the entire Aria. Everything is about color and texture. Well the staff was very friendly and helpful. We chose six items from their Mozzarella bar. I was surprised about the quality of the food. Very exceptional. I saw them making pizza and what I saw convinced me. I will be back there to try more items for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 items from their Mozzarella bar. Phenomenal quality.

3HhPpCPWiwkrXV4EwN6K5A.text: I heard many good things about Five50 so I really wanted to try it when I came for my birthday weekend.  It's Vegas and its in a casino so of course the prices are going to be higher than your average place.  They weren't too much more than I was expecting and I left completely satisfied with my meal.  The service was very good.  The waiter and the guy helping him were very attentive and on top of things.  I ordered one of their special drinks - Well Suited.  It was a deliciously sweet drink.  It's my birthday so I spent the $14 for it.  My husband and I split the pepperoni arancini to start.  These were Ah-mazing. They give you a bechamel sauce and marinara sauce to dip in too.  They had great flavor and I could have eaten a million of them.  I want the recipe.   We then got the Blanca pizza.  We are a sucker for white pizza.  It was very cheesy and tasty and the crust had good texture and flavor.  The oils from the pizza toppings mad it a little soft but that didn't bother me too much.  The pizzas are also bigger than your normal gourmet pizza place.  I was pleased with the size and was not hungry after eating.

oMuWOTJV_DeFfahj6crDEQ.text: Went here for dinner.  Make sure to get some items from the build your own charcuterie board, amazing selections.  Also, the pizzas are a little larger then personal size, order some appetizers and split a pizza, then you get to try more great food.

FfEZ74NykBo9YX1fwBxOSQ.text: Five 50 is a great pizza place. Great slices for $5.50!? Why not!?  Pros: great tasting pizza, cheap, great portions, quick, fun staff. Cons: greasy, not too many options.  I love this place. Would recommend it to anyone wanting pizza or a quick bite. Would be 5 stars but the pizza options need to be better.

B2L1lnamOAOkBsPS92hU4w.text: Must get the Gotham and truffle pizza!! So delicious and the crust is perfect not too thick or thin. The prices are alittle high at $30 a pizza but the flavors are so unique and every bite was good! Can def split one pizza.

5ff-HT-W7In0Ld1TBbpbKg.text: Stopped in for dinner on August 1, space at the bar and tables but they were doing a decent business because you can also buy pizza by the slice and it appeared you could get it for take out which was odd to see in a casino.   Anyway, they have a great beer selection, about 13 taps of all varieties, some national brands but a lot of regional beers.  The salads are good portion sizes but the thing that I really enjoyed was what they called Pigs & Truffles. This was a shredded pork cannelloni on top of spinach in bechamel sauce with some truffles on top.  The shredded pork in cannelloni was awesome, I love cannelloni but it usually comes with ground meats, not shredded. The pork wasn't dry at all and had a nice texture to it. The spinach had a bit of a peppery taste to it and it mixed very well with the creamy bechamel sauce.   The place has only been opened about two month and is buried back near the sports book at the aria but if you are there, give it a shot.

07iyh8lFWGjSS7au4zDSYQ.text: I came to Five50 pizza bar on Sunday to try their Restaurant Week lunch menu. I am super pleased with my experience. For $20.13 I received an amuse bouche of super addictive cheesy, garlic bread, a cup of white bean soup, 2 margherita pizza slices and a vanilla ice cream sandwich with a shot of blood orange soda.  Everything was super delicious; the soup was nice and hearty (although I could've done without the dried herbs) and the pizza was super delicious. For dessert I expected a run-of-the-mill ice cream sandwich, what I got was a sandwich comprised of two galletes with vanilla ice cream, how cool is that? The blood orange soda is made in house and was amazing as well.   The service was great as well; our waitress told us a ittle about the chf and asked us where else we were going to go for RW. She recommended Sage, which I tried at RW when it opened and is mind-blowing.   In short, you must try their Restaurant Week menu, I dare say it's the best deal yet!

b10MMpahfoEl-MYl4UL0Pw.text: Decent enough pizza. Much better beer list then most of the nearby competition. Staff (1 specific person - ours) was not friendly or attentive. Otherwise, this place sort of blends into the background.

sTxRHy35takEuFvv_Cjetw.text: Pure pizza heaven!  I love my pizza and this place makes some great pizza. My fav was double sauce with olive. I ate the whole thing myself. Brick oven crust is fantastic - chewy, crispy and extremely tasty.

XDkcX7IS_UUGzjkCOuG72A.text: It was okay pizza. Nothing beats the pizza at the cosmo. No one beats that. The service was aigjt nothing special. Not the friendliest. But the pizza is okay.

h1GrZhubhkxp4A37VQAAsA.text: I am currently in Vegas and decided to try the new Five 50 Pizza Place at Aria that opened yesterday.  It was WAY overpriced and not worth it at all - the slices are TINY - and I mean TiNY (think of what a slice of quiche looks like) and True to the name of the place, each mini slice is $5.50!!! Two slices for $11.00 do not even equal one normal regular slice anywhere else. Last night all they had left was Margherita pizza (I was told it was a 40 minute wait if I wanted another kind!!!) so that is what I tried - it was just ok, certainly not worth $5.50.    For slightly more than the cost of two of these ridiculous slices, you can get an entire pie at Wolfgang Puck right next door at Crystals (yes, even to go, and without an insane 40 minute wait) and Wolfgang Margherita pizza blows the $5.50 slice right out of the water.  By the way, I am a native New Yorker and I know good pizza - while this pizza certainly isn't bad, I have had way better.  Two thumbs down with a recommendation to avoid.

vVpkT_qaOwI2IAXWk_U5fQ.text: I ate here with 3 friends around 5pm on a Saturday. One of my friends had a sore throat and was looking for a specific whiskey to help her throat. The restaurant did not carry the whiskey so our waitress went to ask her manager if my friend would be able to go get her drink from the casino and bring it in. Next thing we knew the waitress came back with the whiskey. She went outside the restaurant and tracked it down and only charged her $10 for it. Fabulous service for such a casual place. The pizza was delicious as well. Very rich and filling so I would definitely recommend sharing or just ordering a slice. I had the farmstead pizza and it was amazing. All very delicious and fresh ingredients. I will definitely be coming back for more.

TwVQ_-dDeiWivZsWifks3A.text: Checked out this place tonight while staying at the Aria. Probably the most budget friendly restaurant here other than the cafe. The pizzas here are priced in the high 20s and it is a 16 inch pizza which will definitely fill up 2 people with 3 large slices each. Getting one slice is not an option unless you take it to go. Note there are a few standing tables right outside for this purpose so if you don't want a sit down dinner, do that instead! Place is very cute, host staff was okay, waiter was so great (thanks  Wissam -shaved hair with goatee) now to the food. Got one pizza to share half Forager and half Truffle. Got the Forager with Mortadella instead of bacon and it was the most delicious thing ever! So juicy and yummy and so many mushrooms and the mortadella gave it a fresh kick and I'm in love! The truffle was a bit of a disappointment it was kind of dry didn't have many truffles and barely had any sauce all cheese. Another big issue I had... there was way too much oil/grease on both the pizzas. I soaked out the grease with four napkins and my hands were still drenched. Would come back though and would recommend - especially for some late night drunchies!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Forager (with Martadella instead of bacon) and Half Truffle

9vnMyJr2OxUMv7Oc0aHLAg.text: This is a new cool spot inside Aria, they have great food and a great vibe.  I've been in there a few times and every time their is a good looking group customers and the good service makes it a comfortable place to jam before the club and or a show.   Go see my boy john Venegas.

RQcPg1eNy-OotZG2SE-TEw.text: We had the pleasure of dining here for my birthday at the end July with a group of 8 of us.... not only was it a great meal, but 4 of us went back the next day to try other items.  McClain's creativity at this particular restaurant is a fresh and contemporary twist on foods that are very approachable, with many outside the box fun ideas as well.  I've had the pleasure of eating at all of his restaurants (Chicago and Vegas) over the years and he's really hitting his stride with a fun and totally new concept with this place.  The pizzas are amazing and not to be missed... but if you want, you could easily skip past them for some amazing other dishes at this place.  The beers on tap are different than most all places, and the bartender is quick to make a suggestion. The appetizers are amazing and different - I'd recommend ordering a few to get a try of the different fun things he has to offer.  The gotham or the blanca is my favorite... it would be impossible for me to make a choice between the two.  Overall, this place has a fun and casual feel but with an upscale elegance to it... it could easily be an appetizer & a quick drink type of place, or a slice to go.... but I would really recommend relaxing and having an interesting beer and a long night of fun tastes and fresh bold food.  You're going to want to go back the next day... I did.

grwRiz9JShhywsXlTL055A.text: we had three pizzas in my group. I tasted all three and I'm a fan. Upscale pizza at a casino, who'd have thunk it? Far better than Secret Pizza, tucked away at the Cosmo.

jQPMFs8AqYz5SZQ_z15DBA.text: Not great, not bad. Pretty expensive for pizza, but then again it is a pizza spot in a major casino on the Las Vegas Strip. The pizza it's self is pretty good, a little less grease would be nice though.

QxupDj5gC5uKBFJk2maKlQ.text: Fantastic pizza and antipasto dishes. We ordered the meatballs and the arancini. Both were delicious. Reasonably priced (for Vegas) and high quality. A great casual dining option.

okXAKEwtYN0ffpK1zur0eA.text: Awesome pizza. Great bartenders. The happy hour 50 cent beers are terrific. Looking forward to coming back for dessert!

Ok3k7khiqNvCIhrqYZJWwA.text: The pizza was good, but then again it's kinda hard to mess up. If you are looking for a quick fix and you're in City Center then I'd recommend it. I wouldn't say it is worth going out of your way to try.

7oqm3caAbA-dDrhpJPbSoQ.text: Not your average Pizza place...  I see a lot of people complaining and criticizing on here about the $5.50 cost of a slice of Pizza and it's size. This isn't Domino's folks or little Caesars. It's an upscale pizza place by a well known experienced higher tier chef and the food shows!  We dined at Five 50 over the weekend and thought it was awesome. We weren't sure what a pizza place would be like coming from a chef of Shawn McClain's caliber but we weren't disappointed in the least. It was even nice seeing him there expediting all the dishes and adding the finishing touches!  Our server John expertly guided us first through the drink menu and then through the food. We ordered everything he suggested and couldn't have been more pleased. The truffle pizza was to die for. Yes it was pricey, but you are paying for high end ingredients and it shows. The pork belly Carpaccio was equally as impressive.  If you want a down and dirty cheap slice of pizza that's as big as your head and mediocre in taste this isn't the place. If you  want to enjoy a good slice of pizza or other dishes, made with high end, fresh ingredients... I say go, and go again... and if you are dining in definitely ask to be seated in John's section.. he is super knowledgeable about food and will direct you to exactly what you are craving!  We will definitely be back again (and again and again)

IeWDypgcp9YlwRGtT960jg.text: Great choice after a long night of drinking and dancing, the joint for a late night craving!!! Crust is a perfect thin pizza, not to thin just perfect. Cheese is fresh and silky, sauce is just right, Gotham was great but the Margherita just was right for a night of drinks.

ZQLKLzOlX5OKI20DZTS2xA.text: The service was fab (she had my Diet Coke replaced before I was halfway through), the pizza was good (the crust was a little salty- we had the Margherita), and it was very conveniently located inside our hotel. I'd go back if we needed something quick, but at $26 for a pizza, and nowhere near the taste of pizza back in Boston's North End, I wouldn't go running back.

jE-JSvFKHF4I4dy-dTVhIQ.text: Grabbed a slice before we saw zarkana and were very pleasantly surprised. Amply sized slice for the casino-price. Great taste and VERY cheesy like I like it.

nPdgQydUo1GzFES6BFXyAQ.text: Great if you are looking for a quick bite to go. Pizza by the slice is great! I really liked the cheese pizza. They use sourdough crust and the pizza is perfectly thin!

8auN-_K7tMICZCiCqEyesw.text: having this place in our hotel was awesome. we sat at the bar and had some delicious pizza by the slice for affordable prices (by vegas tourist prices anyways).  we tried the margarita, blanca, meat, and forager. all were delicious. honestly the plain margarita was my least favorite bc the other with toppings were sooooo good and baked to crispy perfection!

sy89DpVxunNwzwrZP7yNFw.text: Had a late night craving. It was after midnight but they offer individual slices up til 2am. One velvet rope there and you have to guess which way to go in and order. I asked for one slice, pepperoni with sausage. I was told I had to take whatever was coming out of the oven. Okay?? Lucky there was a pepperoni coming out sans the sausage. 1 slice $5.50. The slice was a nice but 3.5 piece of pepperoni doesn't do it. They skimp on the toppings. For 5 bucks, the toppings should be plentiful, but this is not the case. Overall the taste was average. 6 out of 10 Nothing special. The crust was thin, crunchy and good. However, you will get much better at the Cosmo next door with their secret pizza place. Next time, I will take the walk there to satisfy my craving.

soFdeXU7aW7310XUGkQAwA.text: Absolutely loved this place. Came here for dinner, however we opted for take out instead to save some time. Ordered a furgrov pizza, which had mushrooms spinach, rosemary, and ricotta. So yummy. It's New York style pizza with thin crust, just how I like my pizza.   Since it is a pizza bar, they also offer individual slices for $5.50, hence the creative name.   It's located in the Arya casino and resort. :)

WkAk0SXUjY1bX6rU1R2k3w.text: Ate here on Thanksgiving, after giving up on trying to find a buffet without a 2 hour wait.   We each got a beer, split a salad and ordered an entire pizza. Our bill was under $50 and the food was really good! We even went back to the hotel with extra pizza, which we ate for lunch the next day.   I would highly recommend this tucked away gem for a "cheap" and delicious Vegas meal!

ubCUBEwVh7hj_dJrNWG1Pw.text: We made reservations at Five50 for 5:30pm on July 16th.  We were greeted by the friendly hostesses. We were escorted to one of the booths - very comfortable.  First, we were served breadsticks and Artisan Sparkling Water.  Then I enjoyed the excellent appetizers and salads. The Grilled Garlic Sausage with white beans and fennel salad was my favorite and I also enjoyed the Arugula & Fennel salad. The Tomato Salad and Pork Porchetta were enjoyable too. Note: There were 3 adults a toddler and infant in our party, so we shared the tastes.  Our server, John, was professional, courteous and attended to our needs. I told him a type of beer I liked and I asked what he recommended. He said a Ballast Point on tap - smooth.  We ordered two pizzas, a Truffle Pizza (more than mushrooms) and a Margherita Pizza topped with basil (my favorite of the two). The pizza was not greasy like some fast food delivery places. It was crisp and fine.  Having something sweet to go with your pizza is a must.  I shared a Fried Zeppole with powdered lemon sugar and limoncello sabayon, and also the Milk-Chocolate-Lavender Custard dessert.  The architecture was fascinating: the cylindrical features, variety of materials, and choice of artwork. In different areas, you have black and white tiles, a dark wood, a long chalkboard (possibly 2) with menu items and drinks listed, light wood, a mesh of wood or metal.  We spent just under 90 minutes there. The All-Star Game was on the TV, but the TV wasn't "in your face" or the main focus of the restaurant.   After paying the bill, and was getting up, I asked our server about the different types of seating, just because I wanted to know.  There is a private table for a group of about 10, some booths like the one we sat in, table seating from semi-private to what I would call "center of attention", and bar seating which is well spaced.  As we were leaving, I saw the counter area and the ovens set at Five50 that's [550 degrees Fahrenheit].  I saw Shawn McClain and it was good to talk to him for a few seconds.  It's an excellent place to eat before an 8:00pm show, or any time for that matter.

sb_vPgZqHffRRO3YDPetFw.text: Decent pizza located inside the Aria. I'm not the biggest fan of pizza so it's hard for me to be greatly impressed by it. Our group of six got a farmstead pizza, a forager pizza, and an order of chicken wings. Wings were decent, although not very memorable. The forager had white sauce, mushrooms, bacon, whipped ricotta, and spinach. The farmstead consisted of proscuitto, creme fraiche, farm egg, and country olives. Both pizzas were pretty good and offered some unique, interesting flavor combinations. They were generous with the toppings although there was quite of bit of grease on them. Some of the slices had quite the soggy crust. At close to $30 per pizza, it's definitely not on the cheap side either. I'll probably try to find someplace else to eat next time I'm in the Aria.

xoLyZklO-1v94PQK86P0Ag.text: Great atmosphere, but we got fleeced. $55 for two drinks, one beer, calamAri and garlic bread. The calamari wasn't sweet like I'm used to getting the coast. The sauce on the garlic bread was phenomenal. Id give it five stars if it wasn't for the calamari. Not deducting a star for the price...expected on the strip.

2y-ev5M7MHVo_7TOS0WarA.text: Unfortunately my friend and I got food poisoning from 550 Pizza Bar, Saturday June 21st 2015.We took a  mushroom pizza  up to our room at the Aria at midnight. We both woke up at 3 in the morning vomiting for 8 hours straight . It was an awful experience.

PxFjm6v-i4iOlnIDoTu-HA.text: Way over priced food is awful& disgusting so as the service . Food is greasy service is terrible we paid 150 dollars for 2 pizza & a salad. With all the choices in Vegas this is last place you should go. Overall it's awful& it's the pits. Full of weird crowds

IP-xiB2fSP2TWbsbW39rYA.text: Stayed at Aria and decided to have dinner at this place since I've seen plenty great reviews on Yelp.  Needless to say, our Yelpers are right on the money.  This place, not only has great service and attentive servers, they also have really great pizza!  Ordered the GOTHAM.  Didn't disappoint.  Had cravings for it the next day. Yummy.

muCa2_M3J3oCdLCoUTUcCg.text: They do a mix between standard New York style and Neapolitan without really being exactly either. Quality product, pizzas are very good. Beer selection is excellent. Fennel and arugula salad adding the chicken is excellent. Expect prices to be higher than normal as is standard inside casinos

MxQ5BwJe_qEKHpKTRW7rKA.text: One of the best meatball subs I ever experienced.  Creative and top quality pizza  choices.  The service has always been spot on and the decor is modern and comfortable.  Crazy good happy "hour".  I find myself stopping here a lot and have always left happier than I walked in.  Well done Aria.

MCIxmTOEuSJcupNkaiCTcg.text: Great service, awesome pizza. Love the combos they have -- the flavors were great. The beer selection is pretty stellar as well.

FGRPCDdbQUrviJhPe3TM9w.text: Not only was the pizza very good for thin crust, it was very good for any crust. Service was above average and very quick. Prices for LAS pretty reasonable. Nice decor.

sfCrirjtRaHZralzGmi0wA.text: The pizza looked as if it had been sitting for a while. We got two slices from the bar, the tomato sauce was cold and the dough had a good taste but was really tough and chewy I would recommend going to Secret pizza at the Cosmopolitan or somewhere else that doesn't charge $6 a slice for old pizza

a2_eF7lP3BtIbknX5B7a9w.text: this is the 1st and only time I will ever say this -- the salad was the star of the meal. the arugula and fennel. with cheese. oh, so delicious. I ate nearly the entire plate, except for the bites that my husband had to literally had to distract me for so that I wouldn't notice his taking away the best parts of my life.  the sandwiches were OK. the pizza was good, but I mean -- $30 for a whole pizza? for 2? (not 2. don't believe the menu. unless it's a very hungover or very drunk 2.)

ZbRkZonjSWdn1eGqP14DXA.text: Used up part of our daily resort credit one night here and went with the regular cheese pizza.  Very Large, almost too much... see, the pizza is very thin, which I don't mind, the sauce had a nice tang to it, which is much appreciated and the cheese was pretty good, but the weight of the cheese and sauce weighted down the pizza triangle about 2/3 of the way...to my liking, the crust should be able to stand up to the toppings... the crust however, had  a very nice crunch, and I usually don't eat the crust, but I made an exception on this one.  Service here is very strange, borderline bad, with pretty snobby staff. I inquired if our to-go pizza was ready to which they implied "4 more minutes"... so we waited by the little tables right there in plain view... few minutes go by, I see a pizza sitting there and ask if that was mine... "oh, yes" they say.  Wait, I said, you don't call them.... to which I quote "no, not really.... sometimes the girls will" .... so you know I'm right here... and you leave my pizza to get cold here on the counter?? ugh .. enough said.

ludu_Rv3EuXS2VvWJH7sLQ.text: Consistently delicious and a pretty good value. One of my favorite pizza places in Vegas.

bZz833wVc6V6oT-CJoCezA.text: We were staying at the Aria when we came here one night. Service was good. It was a little slow but then again- when I go out to eat I'm not in a hurry. I want good food and to enjoy the company of the person I'm with.  We got the gotham pizza which was good, and the Mozzarella Bar with 3 items and let our server pick. It came with prosciutto, a hard sliced cheese (I forget the name) and Burrata. On the plate was also mustard, thin bread (naan like), olives and pickled veg. This was phenomenal! I loved it. That plate alone was well worth the money.

zAykRa-xBN0cZPrv1hZ_tw.text: This place only gets two stars because of the really good beer selection. The pizza was the greasiest I have ever had and my partner's sandwich was pretty meh.

CFI29YpJFNV-7sX07hYIaQ.text: They just opened a few days ago.  It's a pizza joint near the sports book.  You can eat there or get a slice to go.  I got the sausage and pepperoni.  Maybe I was starving and somewhat inebriated, but I thought it was so damn good that I kept wanting to go back for more.  Think New York.  Big, thin slice.  The crust was crispy with a good char.  I'm not kidding... of all the things I had while in Vegas, this pizza is what I'll miss most.

reDdQpp98brvPpv7c624Gw.text: Really average pizza in a fancy setup. The crust was not crisp enough, instead we had a limp crust which was weighed down by too much cheese. The spicy pizza had hatch chili peppers on it...And the garlic bread was so oily, it seemed to be fried instead of baked. The tomato sauce was great though.

1hUDr0n-O50bavK63rfM8w.text: It's an amazing late night or end of your night place to grab a slice of pizza. That's how I came across this place at 1:30am. The pizza are throw into an oven to warm up or create your own. They also have sets to order from jn you want to dine in but late night crawlers can grab a slice by the entrance by 2:00am - they have slices of the set and picked through the glass. Located near the sports bar / poker room. Easily way to stag a slice a pizza and get back to what is more important in some cases. The pizza was good for the price but try to avoid the one with a lot of cheese, it was to much cheese for me - unless u like cheese

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance logo

nlNpZfslGcOw0z0iPd8oZQ.text: This place has good ambience and service, but the pizza leaves a lot to be desired.   Initially I was impressed they offered a clam pizza. It sounded very appetizing. The flavor of it was good, but it was pretty greasy. It almost felt like there was meat in the sauce or something and I'm a vegetarian. The garlic knots were hot and well flavored, but they were pretty expensive for what you got.   My husband ordered the Margherita pizza and he said it was standard. Nothing much to write home about but not bad. Unfortunately, the middle of the slices were very soggy and heavy and it was impossible to take the pizza out of the pan.   All in all I'd say that if you were watching sports at the Aria this place is okay, but if you want some really good pizza, go to the pizza place at New York New York or one of the Italian places at the Venetian.

QLFb5LcFMTfTr9WLRcDRFg.text: If you're a pizza fan, you will love their slices! Lines is always long because this place has quality food, one of my favorites of the Aria hotel.

hnMUJjdkWoqWsNURTPKgmA.text: This pizza was good!   It is overpriced. Just like everything else in Vegas. However, when my boyfriend and I came to this restaurant we were STARVING, and suddenly $5.50 for a slice of pizza didn't seem so bad lol. We did not order a pizza to go, just three slices of pizza that could get into our mouths as soon as possible. I only tried the 5 cheese which was really great. Another thing that's cool is they will heat the pizza by the slice in their oven for a minute to get it nice and hot again, I thought that was a nice touch. Also they hostess and the woman who gave us our food were both extremely kind and efficient. It was good quality pizza with good service and if I had the craving for pizza I might eat here again.

sSAskCLaeYyS2Yi_zNlJeg.text: 4 stars for the truffle pizza and 5 stars for the server named Aaron?  I think this place is a pizza jackpot. Our server was soo friendly and he genuinely treated us as if we were his long lost buddies. Why can't every server be like him? We ordered the truffle pizza and it was melt in your mouth amazing. Last year we only ate at the to go counter but this trip we took a seat in the dining area. We will be back!!!

BpIJn78yNo913vEwADKObg.text: Went here with a group of friends and I was not disappointed.  We had a reservation (highly recommended) and were seated right on time.  The staff was friendly and courteous and our waiter was very knowledgeable.  Walking in, the restaurant has all the feel of a modern and upscale restaurant, but doesn't feel pretentious or stuffy (we dressed smart-casusal).  They actually have a to-go slice line near the entrance in case you need your late night fix or don't have time to sit down to eat.  The decor is very nice and the restaurant has a warm and inviting feeling thanks to the wood features and Edison lights.     We ordered drinks and the porchetta (grilled pork belly) and arugula & fennel salad.  the porchetta was absolutely delicious with a nice mix of salty/savory from the pork belly and tart/sweet from the apple.  The arugula & fennel salad was very tasty, tangy and fresh which provided a nice contrast to the porchetta.  For main courses we ordered three different pizzas, a Truffle, a Gotham and a Blanca.  I ordered the truffle and it was absolutely amazing.  I tried the Gotham and it was also very delicious.  I did not try the Blanca but my friends said that it was very delicious.  All things considered, the prices are very fair and it was well worth the experience.  I would recommend this place and we will go back next time we are in Vegas.

eBtzFCeuidsI_j57lhq8qA.text: Pizza was good. We ordered the Gotham (meat lovers one) and the white pizza (with ricotta and spinach). While we were seated fairly quickly (we were a party of 6) the pizza took over 45 min to come out. Seriously?! What pizza takes that long to cook?! While the Gotham pizza was full of flavor, it was dripping in grease. Not very nice. The white pizza was a complete disappointment. It lacked any flavor and it had so much ricotta cheese I wonder if they were even looking while they prepared it. While the ambiance is nice and clean, the food and service needs a huge upgrade.

VGkYEyth2MQugjFf3QE6Tg.text: If you dine in you have to get a whole pizza, which is really  a shame since we ended up wasting half a pizza - but it was a VERY good pizza.  We got the white pizza.  Seriously good.  Caesar salad was "meh"   They have a collaboration beer with Stillwater Brewing.  A saison.  It was delicious.  I'd definitely eat here again, and I'm not a huge pizza fan.

rmwnIMqHb6oTQkjNE6Ffdw.text: I'm updating to five stars. I stopped by for a quick slice of the forager's pizza (big meaty slice for $5.50). Oh man was it good. I am amazed the Aria has such consistently good food (unlike the adjacent Cosmo which has such consistently overpriced food). This dude Shawn McClain is crushing it.

xusEy0HmRWijseFRwGAKqg.text: Stopped here for a quick bite before going to dinner. Had a delicious slice of pizza with goat cheese, onions, eggplant and heirloom tomatoes. Pleasant service also and the place was packed with patrons.

a5eisaRZfjVEvWN4rBQ6mQ.text: Have been here a few times now and I have to say that it could be one of my favorite pizzas in town now. It is thin crust pizza with just the right crisp on the crust. We have tried the Gotham (pepperoni, sausage and salami), the Farmstead (Prosciutto, an Egg and Olives) and the Forager Pizza (Mushrooms, Spinach and Rosemary) as well as the Arancini, their AH.MAZ.ING Garlic Bread and a couple salads. I seem to always go back to the Gotham Pizza....it is by far, my favorite. They have a decent wine and beer menu and they also have a full bar too. ANd if you are only in the mood for a slice to go, they have a to go bar at the front for that. The service has always been good and the decor is nice too.

vZvEuMnInybyqE1X4kNDIw.text: Been here at least 5 times and it's always good maybe the best pizza in Vegas. Still have to try a few more but 5-50 is winning the pizza race.

JNnr6LxYK3Q6KwNpIO4Slg.text: Excellent! Quite possibly THE best pizza I have ever eaten anywhere!  Don't miss an opportunity to eat at Five50!

RYQezuyFWLiYkH6h2Vghug.text: Love this place over Secret or Pin Up! $5.50 a slice! Great place to enjoy inside of Aria!

Q0j0sPlkrLIy37GJT5pxOQ.text: Considering I've lived in the NYC area my entire life, I would have never thought that the best pizza I ever had would be in Nevada. I make a point to stop here...not every time I'm in Las Vegas but everyday I'm in Las Vegas.

Rl7sUDYNjJsIJV2856seng.text: Great pizza thin and oven baked with a great crust! I live in Chicago and I have had arguably the best pizza the world and this place is as good as any. Nice decor and great beer list. If your looking for a quick bite in Aria this is the place. And prices are reasonable. I would highly recommend it

6pbrJBsypVlGIpV4dTUA0A.text: We decided to use our My Vegas rewards to cash in for the slice of pizza and a pint of beer at Five 50.  It's 10000 points which seemed like a decent price for lunch.  We arrived at 11am and went to the hostess stand for the restaurant and told her we were there for the My Vegas deal.  She said the restaurant was not open and to go to the walk up place.  We did.  The person there acted confused and started to say they weren't open, but of course, there were pizzas sitting there, so that made no sense.  She told us that the place where they get the beer is under construction so she had to go get the beers from the bar in the restaurant (like 20 feet away).  We're like, "OK".  Then she says you can have Bud LIght or 3-2-1.  So what we weren't sure about because she was not very clear and it was really loud in there from the overhead music was if we could only have Bud LIght or 3-2-1 because the regular beer thing was closed or if that is all you get on this deal.  Either way that sucked.  If you're using an offer like this to advertise your business, giving me shitty beer is a sure way to not impress me enough to come back.  Next, to the pizza.  There were four options.  I chose the mushroom and spinach with a white sauce and the husband had the many meats selection.  They stick the pieces into the over to heat them for a couple of minutes.  Then since we were told the restaurant was closed, we took our food to the sports book to eat at a table there.  The pizza was fine.  It's that thin crust type which is not my favorite.  The ingredients seemed good, but between the crap beer and the ok pizza and weird service, I have no desire to return.  Then we were checking out the restaurant hours and it said they opened at 11am... sooooo,  Okay then.  Whatever.  Flakey and meh food and drink in one of my least favorite casinos.  Probably will not be back. Can't recommend.

v7xhs-GdpFqnlk_FL3vG0A.text: Finally pizza with something on top! There is this annoying trend in Vegas where pizzas end up with fewer and fewer items on top. Sure yes they all want to make "real" pizza but through all of this a lot of the fancier places have sort of lost the plot a little bit.   In the land where a $30 pizza serves one and has exactly five pieces of mushroom and a thin veil of cheese, 550 is a nice refreshing fun place to visit. The ambience is youthful and cheerful and the menu is quite creative with solid 16 inch pizza's being the focus. Our server was one of the coolest guys we met, super casual and friendly yet very attentive.   The Catania pizza was really good. It had chewy tasty cheese on a really well cooked non-greasy crust and perfectly cooked toppings. We had left overs we took back to the room and tried the following day and it still tasted just as good, goes to show the quality.  But then there is more. You have got to try the Floats here, especially spiked! The Creamsicle  float was simply stunning with Absolut Mandarin, and the most memorable drink we had in Vegas. Will be back for more for sure!

wOoRhDHPz4ke6jyui99WwQ.text: Walking through Aria, we saw numerous huge pizza boxes leaving Five50.  Upon further inspection, we determined that the menu looked pretty good, and that it looked like Neapolitan style pizza cooked in a pizza oven- our favourite!  We didn't make a reservation, and ended up waiting about 20 minutes before being seated.  Funny, because when we were seated, we found that probably 30% of the restaurant's tables were empty.  Maybe they were understaffed on this particular Saturday night?  The server we did have was extremely slow at everything from taking our order to bringing out our drinks and refilling our water, and then finally taking forever to bring our bill.  There were four of us, and we each had ceaser salads, and determined that we'd share the truffle and margherita pizzas.  The salads were great, no complaints there, as was the margherita pizza.  The truffle pizza was completely overwhelming, and I think it has put me off truffles for a little while!  Too much truffle!!  Ultimately, looking back on how much time we spent debating over which pizzas to choose, I think some of the choices were a little too "out there" and there seemed to be something on each one of them that one of our group couldn't handle.  Definitely wouldn't return to Five50, considering all of the other choices for food in Vegas.  To get more stars in Vegas I have to leave feeling not only satisfied, but like I'd return for another meal.

WOk7gdIMfnsW8aZih2-nQw.text: This place is probably 3.5 stars, but as Yelp doesn't allow that I rounded down to 3.  I had a slice of their mushroom pizza - which costs $5.50 hence the name of the place.  It was decent, slightly salty and plenty of mushrooms.  The crust was a bit chewy and thicker than I like.  The price was reasonable for the quality of food, but really if you want the best slice in Vegas then you have to find the "secret" pizza place in Cosmopolitan and have a slice of the white pizza - amazing!

hNY0NJ3xpQMjVRruV4sGLQ.text: It's not the best pizza ever, not the best in the Strip. For the best pizza I would probably go to Grimaldi's at the venetian. But this is good, quality pizza. tasteful and quite convenient if you are at the Aria.   For a quick bite, it gets the job done. You won't be disappointed, especially if you are already inside the Aria. the slices are large and you can get your pizza and pay in about two minutes.

rbP0Qskzwn5Vb7Rff5y3Yw.text: I love any place that cooks pizza in a wood-fired oven, and these guys do it really well. The pizzas are expensive ($26 minimum) but they're enough for 2 hungry people (I guess that's subjective). I've only had their margherita pizza so far but I don't think I need to try another one because it hasn't let me down yet. The dough/crust is cooked well, and it never gets soggy. If I were to be really picky, I'd say that it could be a tiny bit more elastic and not so crispy, but I'm not going to complain about that because the pizza at midnight is so dang good. The cheese is great, they put a lot of basil on, and the tomato sauce is perfect for me. They take a while to get your order out but it is worth it every time.

KQf70_PWC1KDdoRNdxKYLw.text: Great pizza and service! Our waiter Aaron was friendly and efficient. Will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M_gkRbwm37Ou6RcyYd_0Cw.text: Fantastic food. I have been thinking about the pizza I had here for months now. Their pizzas are delicious. The service completely sucks though. The workers are very rude. Other than that I would definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best pizza I&#39;ve ever had in my life

pU_uYnyz842xHQCkCR0A-Q.text: Great pizza, hands down awesome crust and toppings. We had the Forager and the balance between mushrooms meatiness and spinach earthiness was spot on. Good service and modest price makes this is a winner choice. Arugula and delicate squash salad was very unique and not too sweet in spite of the cranberry puree and citrus dressing. Give it a try if you are in the mood to try something different.

BsPkZQfM0fAg6a3-vkdcTQ.text: I frequent the Aria when I visit Vegas and this is a spot that my friends and I find convenient and fun to go to. The CHICKEN WINGS are so good. If I could do it all over I wouldn't even order the pizza, I could stick purely with the wings (and a side of ranch). Two friends and I went a little overboard and also each got the Elvis milkshakes...  AND the Gotham to share... the milkshake was overflowing and we were properly stuffed. May have been a diminishing marginal utility situation where we were over-satiated, but I wasn't a huge fan of the pizza or the milkshake.... Those wings though....

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The gotham
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Elvis milkshake

atiRrCm2dzwm9XYEmb8_Xg.text: I'm surprised this doesn't get 5 stars considering the food you get for the price.  In my experience, there's not many good places to eat on the strip where your bill will come to less than $100 for two.  My husband and I aren't big drinkers so we only had pizza but one pizza was enough to share (even more so if you're taking out since the takeout pizzas are bigger) and therefore our bill came to under $35 for a really tasty pizza.  Even if we'd added on a starter or some sides we still wouldn't have spent close to some of the other meals we had on the strip and the food would have been better.  If you want a low-key meal on the strip this a great place to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half margarita half - Gotham
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Take out - 18&#34; white pie with ricotta and spinach

bJg8hdSkHpRCNmLbxp4pfg.text: Good pizza and salads, not so good service. The cheese pizza and the forager pizzas were both delicious as was the Caesar salad. Unfortunately, and not for the first time, the service was lacking with curt service and partially forgotten order.

Dca3xcWT03Jvji3U7Z3J5A.text: Ordered a pizza from the poker room pizza came out surprisingly fast. Took one bite, totally cold. Plus burnt spots on top. Told the food runner. She asked did we already take a bite. Obviously to be able to tell it was cold. She took it back to the kitchen and they stuck it back in the oven it came back even more black of course. Probably should have just ate it cold....completely let down

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burned bottom
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza came out burned yet still cold from sitting out. Returned to kitchen for them to heat it up and blackened some more.

5caWWGzlOKSp5XLpSLOy7g.text: We have been here several times but this is my first review on the place.  The atmosphere is pretty loud  so don't expect intimacy if you are on a date. There was almost no wait to be seated and we had a lovely server named Aaron who was speedy and polite. We ordered a strawberry lime cider which tastes amazing!  Not too overpowering but just right. Our appetizer of choice was the calamari which is just average. Let's be honest though, it's a pizza bar so would you really expect to have amazing calamari ?  We asked for a pizza to go (half pepperoni and half cheese) Aaron was gracious enough to leave it in the front so we can just grab the pizza and go. This place is definitely one of the better pizza places to eat at in Vegas.   Sidebar: I was walking with the pizza in my hand like a professional asshole and the wind blew my pie face down on the damn sidewalk. Luckily, the pizza stayed intact and we devoured it once we hit the room!

QVmnybNjxRJq0WIJRdnN5Q.text: First night in Vegas and wanted something simple for dinner so have this place a try. Had the beer mac & cheese as a starter and it was very good. Great flavor and perfect size to start. Finished up with the Gotham pizza. It was very good. Cooked perfectly and a nice think crispy crust. Service was also good and attentive. If you're wanting a slice of pizza give this place a try.

5U4PK_YZjKFTPEJS4DavHw.text: Okay, waitress, Cheryl is incredible.  Chopped salad, a meal for two....delicious.  Pizza disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Atmosphere is quaint.  Family friendly.  Prices high, chopped salad is Awesome,  delicious.  Pizza disappointed  $$$$

Tj3jUv152hQh3GOruUjZrg.text: After many drinks in me, I was craving pizza, which is my standard fare of food when under the influence of alcohol. Luckily my friend agreed and we had not gone to Aria yet during our trip, and Yelp directed us here.  Admist the casino and other dining options, located next door to the sports bar area, we were told it would be a 15 minute wait but then called immediately. Score!  We were seated and given drinks shortly after. We saw the table next to us of 3 young boys (10-12) given 3 large pizzas for the 3 of them! We were in shock as they annhilated all 3 pies! they all passed out right after, and it was fun free entertainment.  My friend and I shared their caeser salad, which was really good but glad we asked for the dressing on the side. If you're not a fan of anchovies, avoid this salad as it's really strong. They also provide a side of egg yolk for the dressing as well, but we didn't touch it.  We then asked if we could do a half and half pizza as I'm a white sauce fan, friend is not. The waitress warned us that it would turn pink in the middle and we were okay with that. When I ordered the forager (mushrooms, bacon, spinach) and my friend ordered the margherita, the waitress then told us the whole pink sauce again (within 30 seconds of telling us the first time) and again, we told her it was okay.  Pizza arrived not too long later, and can't go wrong with woodfired pizzas. Mine was slightly burnt around certain parts, but it was super tasty. Hit the spot. My friend's margherita was excellent as well. I couldn't even finish 2 of the 3 slices, so we took it to go and it was a great midnight snack. The pizza was around $26 which was not bad at all.  They also had a huge line for pizza slices to go (and table top seating) which is super smart for people who need a quick bite or craving after drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half forager half margherita
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caeser salad

7oEyKOmmvgeBCWdYZPSYMQ.text: I was here couple of days ago and pizza from the pizza bar was amazing. Decided to bring the kids to try it and got nothing but disappointment. We ordered 2 pizzas. The Margherita  and the Gotham. Both tasty but very very saggy. Not worth paying $26 for a cheese pizza and $28 for a pepperoni pizza.  Service sucks or maybe it was just our waitress.  Just get your slice at the pizza bar!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RKAL6nsHbHvpbNiMrEEbbw.text: I was seated within 5 mins, great customer service. Food was out at a reasonable time. Had a mimosa, taste great. Ordered the Farmstead Pizza, couldn't of made a better choice!This has been by far the most delicious pizza when in Vegas!!! Extra cheesy sizzling, with a medium over easy egg!! Yummmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmstead Pizza! Includes over easy egg!yummmm!

Vg0ZdeHp6JfNyqofZfDDTA.text: "Sex is kinda like pizza. When it's bad, it's still pretty good"   - Stuart (Stephen Baldwin) from the movie "Threesome"  I originally came for the 50 cent beer happy hour they have from 5-5:50pm and ended up with dinner.  The bar was packed when we rolled in at 5:20 but fortunately a couple of guys were leaving.   My wife and I probably wouldn't have come here had it not been for this phenomenal deal on brew.  The reviews have been mixed at best and since there are now some pretty legit spots for pizza in LV, I wasn't exactly rushing to try any of this at strip prices.    The only thing that was pretty consistent with all the reviews was how good the crust was.  If that's the star of the whole damn pie, I figured I would just be screwing it up by adding things like truffle, clams, rosemary or broccoli rabe.  We went with their margherita (tomato, buffalo mozzarella and basil) with extra cheese.  I definitely wasn't getting good value since all the other pizzas with toppings were only $1-$5 more but we did have 8 beers for 50 cents each so that justified my whole deal.    The sauce was sweeter than usual which surprised me upon first bite but it worked.  Cheese was cheese and basil was basil and that was all just a vehicle for the crust.  The crust was really good.  I like it a little well done and there was a good balance of chewy and crunchy.  See you sometime between 5 and 5:50!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese pizza with extra cheese

MVb7mbj2ylb7x3NSb7ALSA.text: The pizza is OK not that good. It is definitely over priced and it isn't worth all that money you spend. I suggest few extra $$$ and go for fine dinning instead. Customer service is so so especially with ToGo orders.

19dczTqO0KP0Z-5SmqFTdA.text: This pizzeria has been open for about 2 months.  Decided to come here after much hype.  Good selection of beer--Intl & domestic--but not quite extensive as a Yardhouse...  Good wine options for a pizzeria, alas I don't drink wine with my pizza.  From 5 - 6pm, they have happy hour and offer 50 cents for a glass of selected draft beer.  The establishment picked up at 5pm....  My party opted to have an appetizer.  At the recommendation of the uber-friendly bartender, we ordered the wood-fired clams & linguica sausage.  Clams cooked in a buttery broth.  Came with bread with baked on tomato and cheese.  Load up sausage, onions, and potato on the bread.  This works well after finishing the clams.  For our pizza, we chose the Gotham.  Your traditional American pizza...  The crust was extra crispy and thin-thin--just the way I like it.  Given a choice, I would prefer the butteriness of JJ Dolan's crust though.  Generous cheese and zesty tomato sauce on the pizza.  Every trip to Vegas, I try a new pizza joint.  I have to rank Five50 my #3 pizza in Vegas after Secret Pizza and Project Pie.  I would rate here #4 if I could remember the name of a small mom & pop pizzeria next to a liquor store about a mile down the strip.  That pizza was superb with a crumby & crunchy crust.  But not to digress away from Five50, the pizza here is worth trying.  Is it a must-stop for vegas?  Not sure about that...

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood-fired clams and linguica sausage...

oDf3c9XojedAa4FHj2TFfg.text: Hot. Fresh. Just what the doctor ordered late night or between gaming sessions at the craps or roulette tables. The sausage and pepperoni slice is delightful.

CggGxwgjJrjeql859q3GPQ.text: Had a great time here.    Sat at the bar.   Great pizza and reasonable for a Vegas Hotel.     Place has nice energy, and well trained staff.   Our pizzas were very good, and other food looked great as well.     Will definitely be back

B9RN2BbJMam6I8naSc3gHA.text: Believe the hype - this pizza is VERY good! The crust is the absolute star, cooked to perfection in their wood fired oven.   We dined in and got the Margherita pizza. I have to say it was among the best I've ever had. Yes, it's a little pricey (as is everything here) although one pizza is enough for 2 adults to share and be satisfied.  It seems to stay quite busy but the service is still fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cxDtIlKtdqYqL0VrzvQRYw.text: This used to be five star pizza.  I went here first thing when i landed in vegas. Not so much anymore.  Pizza slice was small, crust was rubbery,  and barely and cheese. It's also more than 5.50 now.   Pizza rock is my #1 now.  Sorry MGM 2020.

P7HDTDoWqsFkMfVkDBB_rA.text: We decided to try this place last night bc the buffet line was so long. Unfortunately it was not a good experience on the meatball sandwich. We ordered pizza as well. The meatball sandwiches were terrible it didn't even taste like meat it was more like a sloppy joe with a bitter aftertaste. I think it was olives in the mixture but the menu does not describe it properly. The bread was great but the sauce and meat was not good. The service was good and food came out pretty quick. Not sure if I would return bc those sandwiches left a very bad taste. I suggest you note it on the menu or have the server tell the customers.

f0tT4Xd8L-0-pCnAQSRTnQ.text: This restaurant is located inside the Aria hotel near it's Sports Book Area. We walked by this restaurant several times in the past and never bothered to stop. This trip we were in the mood for pizza and decided to give this place a shot. Yes ,the price reflects your at a resort on the strip $$$ . I accept the prices are going to be high . But is the final product worth the price. I would say YES for the pizza served here . The overall appearance of the pizza was very good. The taste of the pizza was excellent , ingredients fresh and oven cooked. The service was excellent. Very clean modern looking restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Pizza

uCEcfyjFEEkMESixq5TJXQ.text: We were staying at the Aria and craving a quick bite so we headed down for some pizza. They have a take out line where you can purchase pizza by the slice, but we decided to wait for a table. The hostesses were nice and quickly got us seated. Our server was super fantastic and friendly! We shared a small plate of the spaghetti (loved how chewy the pasta was) and a pizza. The pizza is a good size and very delicious. The crust isn't too thin so I really enjoyed it. Great casual place for a quick and satisfying bite!

9vDmeIxdDlFaTYVPzixrBA.text: Grub: I have to give 5 stars simply for the pizza, namely GOTHAM.  I have tried pizzas in different parts of the world from hole in the walls in NY to bistros in France.  But this pizza takes the cake or rather "pie".  Something about the chewy yet crispy thin-ish crust to the perfect balance of cheeses and finally the savory combination of meats.  If you want to get into the nitty-gritty it is = Pepperoni, Sausage, Salami, Mozzarella, Grana Padano.  But you just have to try it to know how amazing it is really is.  Rarely do I have lose control and feel the urge to eat the entire pizza and there is rarely a left over slice. I also order the Arancini which is butternut risotto wrapped in cheese and deep fried then topped with marinara.  The hot chicken wings are great too!    This most recent visit, I ran into a familiar face (shout out to JOHN) who recognized me after over a year of not having the pleasure of eating here. I will definitely insist on having John as a server next time, he takes the dining experience here to new heights being attentive and friendly.  What more could you ask for.    Next time - I want to splurge on a Las Vegas root beer float, creamsicle, and/or a milk shake but only after a couple high intensity workouts........

51yeplhe_fmSmC7opvsLWw.text: This place made me feel like a second class citizen. I am so displeased with how poorly I was treated here. My experience starts out with me working a trade show at Aria and visiting Five50 Pizza Bar on my break. I approached the counter and ordered meatballs to go. When I asked if there was somewhere I could sit while I waited on my order Bonnie told me either at the bar next door or at the sports book. When I asked if I could just sit at the bar so I could be notified when my order was ready she proceeded to discourage me by letting me "they probably wouldn't like that since you aren't getting anything." I responded that it only made sense for me to stay in the actual restaurant so when my food was ready I could take it and I moved to the bar to sit down.  I have worked in restaurants for seven years as a teenager and young adult. I used to Hostess do take out, run food and expedite tickets in the window all at the same time. While doing all that I was hospitable and welcoming. I could understand this response from Bonnie if I wasn't a patron but mind you I just spent $16 on food and tipped $3. I am a local foodie and Yelp Elite, I don't think I have ever left a 1 star review but after being treated so poorly I have to tell everyone I know not to visit the Five50 Pizza bar due to poor service and an overwhelming amount of options in Vegas. I would rather walk next door to Cosmo and go to the Secret Pizza shop because at least they are pleasant and welcoming folks. I work trade shows on a weekly basis around thousands of people and I even make reservations for my clients. This is one place I would tell everyone I interact with to avoid. The meatballs were mediocre and had OLIVES and chunks of mozzarella in them so hard pass at this point.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CAjNjVYURn6bS02MH9Q2PQ.text: First time here and while we didn't get any food, my girlfriend and I definitely plan on eating here on our next visit. This time, we got just milkshakes. Cappuccino milkshake in the foreground and the Elvis in the background. There was the option to have these Milkshakes spiked but we were so hungover we opted not to. We thoroughly enjoyed these milkshakes! Very good and highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gDVX5BRNBXpKq3RYwqwJFQ.text: Great pizza, but not the complete deal.   Yes, the pizza was spectacular, but Five50 fails in every other aspect.  1. The dining room is clackity, awkward, loud, and very uncomfortable. Half tables/booths around the outer edge, and narrow deuces that are positioned at ass-level parallel to the bar stools. There's zero ambiance, which is disappointing because Aria has the loot to make this place ultra comfortable. The tables are wooden, kind of simplistically low-end IKEA, like something you'd find in a high school shop class. It's as if this place was designed by Spirit Airlines. The restaurant is a mutation of semicircles and odd turns that spills into the sports book, which itself has television screens that require persons to crane their necks upward like like newborn chicks hoping to receive some regurgitated nourishment from mama bird. What overpaid executive signed off on this design? Seriously, they need to be slapped. Our table rocked, which made it difficult to carry on a conversation.   2. Our server was severely oversaturated with customers. He took our order and we never saw him again because he was so busy. I don't blame him, I blame the management for their absence of situational awareness. Your boy is drowning, go save him. One CO can't guard every inmate in the prison. Before our pie arrived, we wanted to order drinks, but the poor guy didn't have time to offer. That was extremely disappointing because I believe the phrase is "food AND beverage." Just to pay the check I had to wave my credit card in distress. Forget about asking someone to fix our rocking table, which actually is shame on the busser: you must have wiped down that table down 10 times last night and knew it was rocking but did nothing. Perhaps a career in politics awaits you: know the problem, feign concern, gesticulate in outrage, take no action, yet still take the money.   3. Tons and tons of open/empty space by the hostess podium yet no benches or seats to sit while waiting for 25 minutes for your table to become free, cleaned, and ignored of its rocking nature. And why don't they give the waiting customers pagers? Perhaps that's too much technology to expect in the year 2019 for a hotel that promotes itself as being on the cutting edge of technology. Things aren't well thought out here. Even the hostess's uniforms are incongruent with the rest of the staff's attire.   4. Stand-up tables? Really? I thought those went out in the 70's. Maybe in a cramped and cluttered space but the Aria's main floor is wide open.   5. On ALL the TVs was some kind of video shooting game with a perpetrator going house to house and gunning down targets. WHAT the F? Are you kidding me? Forget about such imagery being inappropriate for dining, what about what happened a mile away on 1 October of 2017 when Stephen Paddock gunned down 58 people and wounded 400 from his room at Mandalay Bar? Just 18 months ago. I cannot be the first person to object to this, nor see it as insanely inappropriate, and most of all, highly insensitive, and obtusely disrespectful.      6. Pie was the one of the best I've had, but pricey. So yes: two stars. Basically Five50 is like a half-built race car: great engine but its got no wheels, and even if it did the pit crew would ignore the alignment.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D4kkaYW3QOMY-z4KDz7oJw.text: Great pizza! I had friends staying at the Aria and upon meeting them there I was STARVING. I had just gotten to town a couple hours prior. The restaurants at the Luxor where I stayed closed early and it was after 10 pm. This place knocked it out of the park. Nice bartender. I wish I had been able to try more things. I was too tired. Very nice modern atmosphere. It's pricey but everything is pricey in Vegas. Amazing meatballs. nice cheese and meat plate. Very nice surprise overall. highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H0cs5Kwg8A8izlZh0j8fHw.text: This place is fabulous!! I got the opportunity to come here and try the seasonal pizza and salad and really loved it. The flavors were amazing. I was highly impressed. My friend recommended this place and I'm so glad I tried it out for the first time. I was so hungry and it was so good that I didn't even have time to get pics! I know, awful.   The service was top notch. I would say if you love pizza, you should try this place out. It was by far some of the most delicious food I've had.

q0m_yweWfMKPGrtJi_zemw.text: This place had very good pizza at a very unreasonable price. I got the spinach, mushroom, and ricotta slice for 7. It tasted very good as well they throw it in the oven for you but the price was too high for me to return.

gdf5IG_XmgUn0R9PgC4JHQ.text: Hum no total on our bill and suggested gratuity is ridiculous - simple error or done on purpose?? - good food and drink but beware when check arrives!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bill

d59y38bzw1SfFBu7g8Xrng.text: Located inside Aria hotel, Five50 is a decent Pizza restaurant with bar, but seriously overpriced! Slice of Pizza is $6+, glass of Coke is $5. If you want only a slice of Pizza, you gotta sit at the bar! Tables are only for full Pizza orders!  Suggestion: meatballs are great!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UH_rlpb9MkJXQjng-wHVtw.text: Just okay. But serves its purpose well. We were hungry (shocker) after lots and lots of walking about and doing Vegas things. Even though dinner was a few hours away "hey, look...PIZZA!" and I was off to secure a pie for some snacking in our suite.   I got two pizzas for takeaway to feed the hungry masses and even though it took a lot long than expected to come out...we got pizza.  The crust was a lot more burned than I usually prefer, even though I take the blame here and asked for "a little well done." The pizza was a bit salty, even for sausage, onions, and peppers it had a very salty kick to it.  Our cheese on cheese on cheese pizza was good, also a little crusty but definitely pizza edible.   Server/hostess was nice...place wasn't too crowded on a Monday afternoon in the pre-holidays quiet season. Located in Aria btw in the far corner near the Burger Bar and the Poker Room.   As is everything in Vegas...it was pricey...very pricey. But you should expect that...it's a resort, not a pizza hut.

kelSbLKYV7S_4D_mNkyPWA.text: Five50 Pizza Bar is my favorite pizza place on the Las Vegas Strip! By far the best pizza I've had in Vegas so far. We had the beer mac and cheese, a couple drinks, and some pizza. Highly recommend!! We can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dfRL3yQFgdN7xbzuGyVlYA.text: I stayed at the Aria for a work conference, and decided to get a pizza and salad for lunch. The pizza bar is located at the bottom of the escalators next to the burger place. Get there early because if there's a conference or if it's busy, you will wait! Luckily I was able to order early before the crowds. I ordered to-go and decided to take my food back to my room.  I ordered the arugula salad and a slice of pizza. This meal was about $15 (yup everything in LV is expensive!). The salad was good enough to share for 2 people, but I felt the salad was really dry. I should have asked for extra dressing. The dressing was already mixed in, but I barely tasted it. What I liked about the salad was that it was fresh and not much filler. I wish there was more cheese and croutons or something crunchy other than the radish tasting veggie that topped the salad.  For my pizza, I ordered the meat lovers. The slice was eh. Nothing special. I wish there was more sauce on the pizza. The slice was small and wasn't filling. Wish I was able to get this pizza fresh and out of the oven!

YdjfPMMJ_mS4X1ro8QJSNg.text: I couldn't resist. I just love trying Pizza everywhere I visit. Located inside Aria hotel right next to the sports betting center. Whatever you do, don't order room service Pizza because it's definitely not from here. You can see the difference from miles away. I needed a Pizza redemption since that room service Pizza.   Just by looking at it one can tell how good it is. I ordered a pepperoni and a cheese slice. I can't decide which I like the most. They're both cheese, not too much sauce which is great for me. Freshly made, as I was waiting in line I can see them cooking like 2 more pizzas in the oven. Saw a few kids eating here with their parents, it's a good option for families.   I will definitely be eating here on our next Vegas trip. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry! I took a bite, couldn&#39;t resist. Wow, so yummy.

PY3HUjdwJZDDvJVT12SMcQ.text: Yes this place is really good. Try the pepperoni slice. Fresh & hot. I came here twice for some more pizza. I'm a pizza lover & this pizza is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The oven
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni slice (huge)

8NCznhpvHnVnSyX-dPPX8w.text: Great pizza almost as good as New York City pizza.  Definitely a great place to grab a slice and hit the casino.

S3VA76yOBwjVPCf-6NSFEQ.text: We stayed at the Aria specifically because five50 pizza is there. I first tried it back in April, and when we planned this trip, I knew we had to be as close to this pizza as possible. Yes, I really really love pizza. Needless to say, we got pizza to-go up to our room both nights after gambling. If we hadn't made a few other meal plans for our 2 day trip, I would have eaten in the restaurant because their garlic knots are the best I've ever had! I don't think I'll ever be able to visit Vegas again without having at least a slice of five50 pizza!

lBLazMc4WlPoGyCIaz2ytg.text: $28 medium is too pricey for my pizza taste buds.  Don't get me wrong, it was still pretty good.  You get a few free (but tiny) breadsticks dipped in olive oil.  They do have a full bar and TVs everywhere.  Come here if you want to try something new, and only if you just won money at the tables or at the sportsbook next door.

0k4cMwp4uUZhnGf6HqEYiQ.text: Came here over the weekend and was excited to try Aria's new pizza place.   I tried the Blanco and had a rum, lemon, blackberry drink (sorry I wish I remember the name of it!)   The pizza flavor was unique, and enjoyable, the dough definitely fresh. The only thing was the amount of oil running down the slice, and the ingredients kept slipping off, I had to use fork and knife. Also while the crust was cooked to perfection, I felt that it was very doughy in the center, I could not hold the pizza and eat it with my hands because it would flop.    $14 drink was in a small glass, and tasted watered down. Go for the beer instead.  Staff was amazing, as I believe all Aria staff are. Very attentive without hovering our table.

OgFeQ1-mPO3jaxv_JC5GlQ.text: Had the 5 cheese and Gotham! The 5 cheese was cooked perfectly with a nice crispy crust and tasted amazing. while the Gotham, all though good, was soggy with the cheese and toppings falling off. Both were flavorful and good!   Sorry I just like crispy crust! Lol 4 of 5 stars

JF1MTA4-P4z8E_hY-ai9hQ.text: Split a 16-inch pizza with the bf and got half forager and half truffle. The forager was delicious and so full of flavor!!! It was definitely our favorite...the truffle was a bit disappointing. It was really salty and you can only taste the truffle in a couple bites. If we had to do it all over again, we would definitely get an entire forager pizza and skip the truffle.   Also, if you only want a slice of pizza, go to their counter and don't get seated otherwise if you dine in, you have to get an entire pizza.

wZYqKgGXmQFqdrllyPszcg.text: Beautiful decor!!!! Nice place to watch a game...  Tried basic pizza, it was ok not great!  Ceasar sald ok.  Very busy due to Nfl championship games on, Service was ok.

g8QQYfgFHR3O_l5dL8zO0Q.text: This place has really awesome pizza. We had the Chopped Salad and the Gotham Pizza and both were amazing.   The staff are super friendly and just the right amount of attentive.   I'd recommend this place to anyone.

CCCQRUR4tzpe_9DZbFf1FA.text: Soooo good! You haven't had pizza until you've eaten here! The forager is amazing, however, it's extremely rich, so ask the waiter for a 1/2 and 1/2. The best one we tried was the Gotham! Seriously. Amazing!

JA0U5Gr2R1zM8h_XvQyxaA.text: This is just a review for their walk up, by the slice pizza.   Quick and very, very good pizza. I tired the Forager and my girlfriend the Margarita pizza and it was delicious. Fast and easy, and just enough greasy.

eQ64yaErWFiefwhsg865zw.text: This was our first dinner in Vegas. We had gotten in late due to a delayed flight and were starving. We walked in and got seated immediately. Then we were impressed with a beer menu, there were some we recognized and some we don't get out here. So, we experimented with a couple unusual choices and then stared at the menu.  The menu is small-ish but appears well chosen. We had the blanca pizza and were finely rewarded. It was one of the best white pizzas I have ever had, the crust was thin and crispy, the sauce was very tasty and the toppings were perfect.   There is also a slice bar which is open longer than the full-service restaurant. So if you need a late night bite, it might be your baby.

_rUb824C4h87nWyXMNSjRw.text: Pizza was good but not that good to pay near $30 for 1 16".  At that rate let's see how long they will last. Love Aria but all this price gouging through out the hotel is bad business!

4jlOPZ5-NqLkhtuWYK7muQ.text: Love love love the pizza here! Perfectly cooked and amazing toppings! My favorite is the forager and truffle! Can't go wrong with either one.  John V. Is always so nice and helpful! We tried the garlic bites and mushroom aracini. Garlic bites are not the usual but have a great flavor and crispy yet soft. The service is amazing and always a fun yet sophisticated vibe. Great place in aria!

fcmyisiR0BnUxQCdqgtoXA.text: not a hype!!! Was recommended to this place and I was not let down! This place is fun! Pizza is delicious! I wish I could have taken more pizza home! I'm a pizza lover and my oh my! Exceeded my expectations! Price is def worth it! It's a must go place!

hKSHsKzTbdgeI_FC8pgtuA.text: Excellent choice for a moderately price quality meal in a town of overpriced pretenders. Top notch pizza (with a $5 by the slice option - with toppings no less!) that can't be beat. Good salads and a killer $18 lunch special. Add good tunes and a great beer selection and you got yourself a winner.

Ze1D2nk6r4V38RFhYGIFpg.text: Take out counter sells beer and pizza by the slice for $6. You can't beat the price nor the quality of the pizza. Our slices could have been heated up a bit more hotter tho. Otherwise it beats waiting for a table and having to leave a tip etc. This is cost effective and high quality pizza.  We had one of each type. Gothem and forager is esp great!.  We bought some beers too!  There are only 8 seats though.  We took our meal over to the pastry shop a 3 min walk down the way which had plenty of seating.  Great people watching while eating yer pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v_-PYPDKOtZDmRVdK_lQSA.text: Pizza tastes great. Everything else is not good.  The salad is 14.00 for a portion size that's worth 1.50 side salad. The service lacks any enthusiasm or charisma. A soda is 4.50. I know we are on vacation and can pay a little more for food but thee prices are way out of line for the portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

I0dAzIXzx9HlmZN23P1Ydg.text: For what it is, it gets 5 stars.  It is a pizza place, but it has a full bar, great tasty food and enough variety.  We have eaten here several times and I am about to go back tonight.  If you are visiting, this is much more than safe bet.    Hint:  The big line mid day is for pizza by the slice.  Walk around the line to get to the bar where you can sit down and have a drink and and some great food.

ySMWy42kv75x5pmOAS2Oqw.text: I came here for an impromptu lunch while staying at the Aria hotel. There were four of us and we each got the lunch special, which is a great deal! For $18 we got a prosciutto melon salad and a personal pan pizza. You could either order one of their signature pizzas or create your own with three toppings, so we all got different ones and split them. The salad was delicious - it had the perfect flavor. The pizzas were all unique and you could tell that they had come straight from the oven! We got the meat lovers, the truffle and the spicy pizzas and they were all wonderful. I can't pick a favorite! We also started with a sin city pale ale and a shot of NV whiskey. I would definitely come back here!

jgxvBfnwROJzu2pd52qZww.text: Their food is great. My friends love eating here because they have amazing flavor filled original pizzas. However that doesn't work for me. So sad to see there are no gluten free pizza options. Come on please add this to the menu! So many other places now do it like 800 degrees, which is down the street. When I saw you didn't offer GF we opted to eat there instead so I could enjoy some tasty pizza with GF crust.

eEjuqum4aLCXkrvR0AlSbQ.text: Pizza was excellent. Charred crust typical of New York style pizza. We had the Gotham and added mushrooms which was delicious. The shakes were very good with the option to add liquor to.

yLtgvv4ERsNB5lC3cgeSlg.text: I had their white pizza with spinach and it was out of this world good. We were at the sportbook in Aria and it was just next to the entrance of it. I was almost tempted to get a second slice but didn't cause of dinner plans lol. Worth the $5.50 because it's really 2 slices.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hkqMku_C9EIBctnhfAFvgw.text: After walking around the strip late at night, we had the munchies and were thinking about ordering pizza to bring back to our room at the Aria. There were only about 3 different pizzas in their display window for reheating. We were going to create our own, but paying over $28 for a whole pizza didn't seem like it'd be worth it to me.  We ended up getting a slice of the Gotham which was huge and NY style, but way way too greasy!! They were generous w/ the toppings though, lots of pepperoni and sausages. Cheese was gooey which I loved. Unfortunately due to the amount of grease, the crust wasn't crunchy at all, but rather soggy. For about $5.50/slice I expected it to taste better.  I probably would come back to try their other slices or milkshakes. The milkshakes seemed worth it for the price!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. slice of gotham
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. slice of gotham
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu

cQJrDfrqwBHhC3ch-DBqEw.text: We discovered this place 5 years ago and I cannot go to Vegas and not stop by this place. Best pizza hits the spot after a night out. left overs still hit the spot a day later.. must try the Gotham Pizza and Wings!!! Their Bleu Cheese is super yummy !!!

dcuTi87kwuNoZ7L-AhQulA.text: Gotham pizza is the best pizza I have ever had. Fresh tomato sauce, cheese, meat...everything is so fresh. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham pizza

L9BXMrxUc-vFfRC7m-C8BA.text: I came in to the restaurant at 4:30pm. It was mostly empty, however the service was slow and inattentive.   I ordered the clam pizza and am sorry I did. The only clams on the pizza were 1-2 still in the shell on each slice. You had to scrape them out yourself. I would rather eat my pizza rather than work for it. Furthermore, this resulted in very little crab meat on the pizza. Lastly, there were clam shells broken off and melted into the pizza. They were hard to see. Thus, there were 2-3 bites I literally has to spit out as I was chewing clam shells.   When I pointed this out to the waitress Amanda she said sorry and she would tell the chef. She even admitted that this was not the first time this has happened. Despite my complaint there was not an offer to deduct a portion of the bill or offer of free dessert or something to compensate.   Disappointing.

Fn9JzXkJaiWZ4zvrPpDbIA.text: Given how popular Cosmo's not-so-secret Secret Pizza is for late night eats, I always wondered why more hotels didn't offer something similar.  Especially ARIA, given how far they are from just about everything else.  However, it looks like I wasn't the only one that wondered about that because helllooooo Five50 Pizza!
