Located next to the sportsbook (taking over the old sports grill), Five50 is a trendy pizza joint with both a regular dining room and a to-go counter to get pizzas by the slice.  Both are open relatively late, though maybe not late enough for the post-clubbing crowd (the restaurant closes at midnight, the counter at 2:00am).  Still, they're great for midnight cravings, or people on the go like me.  Of the four types offered, I ordered the GOTHAM since it was simply my kind of pizza - Sausage, Pepperoni, Salami, Mozzarella, and Grana Podano.  Each bite was full of unhealthy, meaty goodness and I liked how the crust was thin, but not soggy.  At the same time, the flavors aren't exactly unique.  I've had others in the past that had more creative and compelling flavors, which brings me to the next point...  ...that as much as I liked the pizza, I'd rather spend the money on something I can't get elsewhere.  Yes, it's the Strip, but $6.50 a slice is nothing to scoff at (thank goodness for resort credit!).  Just getting a single slice might not be that bad, but it can get pricey if you're hungry.  If you're with friends, you might be better off splitting a pie ($20-$30) or simply dining in for the full menu (which looks pretty good, I might add).  While I would otherwise round up from THREE AND A HALF STARS based on taste, I'm rounding down only because of the price.  Five50 is nice addition to ARIA's collection of restaurants, and I wouldn't mind coming back to try the full menu, but I don't know if I would come back to grab just a slice unless I had resort credit or if I was in a pinch.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham - Pepperoni, Sausage, Salami, Mozzarella, Grana Padano

lHQr_KcpSoFljig3vg3r3g.text: My coworkers and I had dinner here after our conference ended for the day.  The food was good and our server was good too.  As I try not to eat dairy, I had a salad.  I tried the ARUGULA & FENNEL salad  with LEMON, SPANISH ESTATE OLIVE OIL, SHAVED MANCHEGO PICANTE.   My coworkers each had a pizza.  They are huge and definitely need to shared.  One had the PICANTE pizza - GHOST CHILI SALAMI, SHISHITO, CALABRIAN CHILI, ROASTED SWEET PEPPERS.  The other had the GOTHAM pizza - PEPPERONI, SAUSAGE, SALAMI, MOZZARELLA, GRANA PADANO.  I tried the Gotham and it was really good.  Lots of good crispy meat.    Definitely a good place for a casual meal.  Good pizzas, good drinks, good salads.

r2Ti4l37rW6npeXcBul0pA.text: Food is great but something about the service is lacking. I want to give this place a better review but just can't at this time. Been twice now and same experience.

fWkaM3CW2QlcVfXz9xWTOw.text: Another fantastic visit to Five50. Our Waitress (Marisela) was nice. Pizza was amazing. Idk what people are complaining about greasy pizza. It wasn't overly greasy it was the average amount. It's suppose to have grease,  that's how a pizza is.   IF you can hold out skip the app. But you'd be missing out. Ricotta cheese is very expensive out here. So I can see why it's $9.  Blanca pizza came with fresh basil on top. Top notch high quality ingredients. Meats added are $4 each & veggies $2. Their mushrooms had so much flavor to them. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blanca pizza $27 added Mushrooms &amp; Pepperoni. They&#39;re meats ate sliced in house. I was surprised.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bill.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm ricotta &amp; bread. I thought it was better than the garlic bread from our last visit.

X844_UrcWdl9n8rNZo4K0A.text: Good/tasty pizza. Quality toppings. Cheese bread was good too. Meat/Cheese tray was decent. Priced too high IMO, but that's part of being at the Aria in Vegas. Service was good & there were plenty of TV's to watch sports. They do sell pizza by the slice to-go. Worth stopping in for a bite though.

FmXHUe1Z1wCVEG67T4PrBw.text: I was in the mood for some pizza, however I had taken my first bite and as I was chewing I felt something hard. I kept chewing and realized something was off. I had spit out the pizza and found what looked like a piece of tooth. It was hard and super sharp. I've never been so startled after eating something in my entire life. It was so upsetting that I checked to make sure none of my teeth had broken off. And as I assumed, I was right it wasn't my tooth. I'm not sure how this could have gotten on my food, and the thought of it terrifies me. I'll forever be traumatized.

kQkk7uYCk0d_Q7bgG6oBJA.text: We had a party of 8, it took us less than 10 minutes to be seated. The server we had was pretty cute and friendly. We ordered WAY too much food for out table. In total we ordered 4 whole pizzas (Gotham x2, North Beach, Farmstead, Forager,) . We should've asked our server to see if she'd think 4 was too much T.T We ate about 3/5 of all the pizzas we ordered. Had more than enough for breakfast tomorrow.  The Gotham was your typical meat lover's pizza. We all finished that first and pretty quickly also. You can never go wrong with meat over's pizza if you fancy protein and red meat.  The North Beach was really good. I wish I had more, but I was trying to avoid seafood thise weekend (allergies) The clan they put on top of each slice was bomb. Really isolated from the whole pizza itself so you can really taste it.  The Farmstead was my most disliked pizza. It had so many flavors going off at one time, but the salty flavor dominated everything. It was very distasteful to me. Of our 8 only 1 of us didn't mind it much. As you can guess, we had this the most of our leftovers. I tasted okay after being intoxicated, still tasted that salty sour taste though.  The Forager... I can't really remember this pizza well. I really liked the Gotham and North Beach, and the Farmstead ruined my appetite a bit. This wasn't that bad though. We barely had any left for this, probably like 1 or 2 slices. I do remember the yolk though. I tasted awkward at first, but then it tastes good afterwards.  I probably will not come here again though, just because there are so many restaurants in Vegas that i have tried before and this played didn't really 'wow' me. Probably because of that Farmstead... lol. Service was great. Watched a baseball game while waiting for our food. Lost a Parley. Ate some good pizzas, ate A bad pizza. Spent a good amount of dough for some dough.

I2dpgXnKmBon78KcAwsHtg.text: Pizza Taste: A Prices: C- Customer Service of Busty Brunette at the take-away register: D-

feo3mkUkotntsyX5UVXphA.text: Margherita pizza was so good! We also ordered the calamari appetizer which I did not love. Calamari was tender and the breading was crunchy but I did not love the dipping sauce (would have preferred marinara rather than the aoili) or the pepper flavor. Just prefer the traditional over their version-wouldn't order again but would definitely go back for the pizza!

-FA7Ut8OHAPfVZgPL5HQZA.text: After working out the whole morning, I worked up a serious appetite. If I'm about to sabotage my regimen, it has to be with something good. Since I was already at Aria for Mega Madness, I might as well stay and eat here.   Pigs and Truffles: Cannelloni with pork shoulder, spinach, bechamel and truffles. This dish is fabulous. It's creamy, rich and you can absolutely smell and taste the truffles. The pork is tender and juicy. 5/5  Gotham Pizza: Sausage, pepperoni, salami, mozzarella, and grana padano. This was just alright...quite ordinary. Grana padano is cheaper than Parmigianno-Regiano and all the other ingredients aren't hard to find/ expensive so, I'm not sure why this is $28. 3.5/5  Truffle Pizza: Truffle salami, parmesan, bechamel, thyme, and shaved truffles. This was amazing! Fragrant, rich and truffly. 5/5  Their pizzas are 16" from $26-29 (some are worth it, some are not - just read the ingredients and use your own judgment). The crust is fantastic, crisp and tasty. They also have pizza by the slice by the entrance. You can choose from 8 pizza options or create your own. They have soups, salads, charcuterie, pasta, sandiwches, shakes and desserts.  The service was ok. They have TV's on sports channels. It's a good atmosphere for a pizza place.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Gotham, half Truffle
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pigs and Truffles

mfJcNYTgyHAWUM1PblMcCg.text: Surprised the sports bar was replaced by pizza. I'm always up for a little wood fired thin crust pizza after a late night of gaming.    The restaurant closes at midnight but the slice bar is open till 2am.    Wanted to customize, watch out it adds up fast: -sausage  -meatball -spinach  -basil  -eggplant   Final tally was close to $40, slices are huge, really great crust and an abundance of ingredients in each bite.  Wait time: 20 minutes.    If you're just wanting a light snack between two people, I would suggest ordering by the slice, a whole pie is WAY too much pizza, our tummies were not happy today.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucatini and meatballs
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Agnolotti with fava
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wslDBMc1bd30m3BAjr0zSQ.text: + easy to find location in the Aria + good for to-go counter or sit-down restaurant service + good variety (had a seasonal pie with cauliflower!) +/- pretty good quality and size - $5.50 per slice or $28+ per pie (plus tax and tip)  If I was in the area and hungry, I'd pick up a slice but won't be rushing back here.

BAJzBgTdtvElBmYXHQpkVQ.text: The most amazing texture on a pizza crust ever - it's like a savory macaron with crisp outer and melt in your mouth soft inner. Toppings were good throughout the first slice but rapidly got dull - lower quality ingredients? Over done? Perhaps just masked by too much mediocre cheese? But perhaps that's too critical. Overall, Five 50 was a great pizza experience with a winking waiter with shmarmy Vegas charm.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlike most of Vegas, 5 Fifty&#39;s decor isn&#39;t such an eyesore.

Z06kncOnc8L3khqcsUee5w.text: This restaurant close at 12 midnight. Nice place to grab a late night snack. You can do dine-in or just buy a slice from the counter.   Nice bar area watching sports.   The Service: The server is friendly. Pizza do take a while to be served. That is okay but it is freshly made to order.   The Food: Pizza has thin crust but not those crispy crust type. Can taste a little bit wood burning at the end crust.   Gotham - a little bit way too salty for me. Lots of meat.  Margarita - not too saucy, fresh basil leaves on the top of the pizza.  Their cocktail drinks almost $15.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

me5GX5JPSRcCppcZVd7NhA.text: When you find yourself in the more upscale casinos in Vegas, you'll often find yourself pressed to find affordable food. Secret Pizza in The Cosmpolitan is always a fan favorite, but sometimes you just want to try something out. Enter Five50.  I find the line in Secret Pizza always really intimidating when I'm just really hungry for a quick slice, and Five50, located in Aria, is a great alternative. Lines are never really long, and pizzas are just as great. What Secret Pizza lacks in variety, Five50 offers more unique flavors.  Still, I would say the price has something left to be desired. $5.50 is a bit hefty for a slice of pizza, and although it is a large slice, I can't say I was all too happy parting with my cash. Nonetheless, still a very solid pizza place, and it definitely is worth checking out, if you're ever sick of Secret Pizza and looking for a change of pace.  I would just raise one caveat though: beware of the soda prices. I was looking to grab a quick can of soda, and the price ended up being $10 for the combo of a slice and soda. Lo and behold, they charged $4.50 for a can of soda. Whereas I don't mind getting ripped off if offered in tap, it's nearly criminal to try to take that much from a can I can get from a grocery store. $2-$3? Sure. $4.50, please no.  TIP: Get your sodas elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Picante, Half Truffle
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blanca

7y7rXC17y4Sj-K0Rx2DCyg.text: Went straight here after going to the night club Jewel. I'm not sure what time they close. Yelp says 12:30am but we ordered food at almost 3am.   I got the spinach and mushroom pizza. It's a white sauce and has ricotta cheese. 2 slices of pizza was about $15. The slice was huge tho! It was so good!! I really liked that it was super cheesy. I also liked that it was a thin slice. So delicious. I would recommend going here especially after Jewel bc it's close and still inside Aria Resort.   It's a restaurant but you can also order and take it on the go.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foragemer - spinach mushroom ricotta

bQAg8zxwwTxmbWGk_aCKZA.text: Really good pie.  This place always has shorter lines than Secret Pizza.  Order slices at the counter and eat in the sports book. Coming here is  my favorite way to start a Vegas trip!

0ILVT99KtYoDgcr2xGKj9A.text: The hostess was incredibly rude to my husband and autistic child. Long story short....they never made it into the restaurant & received a lecture about how children don't belong in Vegas and the Aria.  We will NEVER return....which is exactly what she wanted.

sOKzbjDToZ2J6ZpI8TX5bg.text: Service is always great here. Friendly and fast staff. My children love this restaurant. You can even just pick up a slice if you don't want an entire pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ulsStX9FpKX45a2qrxrWTg.text: Let me tell you ! This is the best restaurant I've been to in ARIA this weekend. The pizza was amazing and the sauce was on point ! The dough was really good too because it was just the right balance of soft and hard. The pies were pricey but hey it's Vegas ... $60 for two margaritas. It was worth it though. I even went back the next day and got the choose three cheese platter. I got the buffalo mozzarella, sopressata, and prosciutto. It came with green olives, bread, some mustard dip, and honey. We also had the meatball sandwich. The bartender was very friendly and we enjoyed her conversation. I'm sorry I forgot her name ! She was so sweet and attentive. She was working yesterday around 3PM. I will definitely come back here next time I'm in town.

Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat pizza

w33UPS92OOr05Q5oY9hJzQ.text: Kathaleeya and Isaac were the coolest! Isaac was hilarious. We loved having him as our server. The pizza and wine here were really good. The garlic knots were delicious. This place was so convenient after we gambled at the aria. Was the perfect place to eat and say good bye to Vegas.

XBRSJiMaKm9eg2BPZej1MQ.text: Solid pizza joint located inside the Aria Hotel and Casino, that offers way more than just pizza! They have slices and salads for take away but if you get a table you can enjoy more of what they have to offer. Some of the unique items include charcuterie, pork rinds, duck confit crostini, garlic knots, carpaccio and many more. The arancini is the bomb as well as the hummus and housemade meatballs.  For beverages look no further than the wide variety beer menu or some of their signature cocktails. Plenty of ciders, bourbons, wines and more to choose from.   They have a variety of pizza but I always seem to go for the Gotham: pepperoni, sausage, salami and mozzarella 5/5 delicious to the last bite. Other pizzas they have include the Forager, North Beach, Margarita, Farmstead, Truffle, Catina and the Picante, or you can simply build your own.  Tip: daily lunch specials available as well.  Tip 2: remember to show your M life card to get tier discounts!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5aVo-u9YOWFFX9RqtOYmkA.text: I've eaten here many times but mostly it was a drunk late night snack. Today I'm just hungry after the gym:) This is good pizza and they don't over charge for the slice!! I mostly pick one of the slices without meat of what's available and it's always good!

f9rliysB-THpxssl-0idag.text: Gorgeous place ! I love the dim lights . It's a spacious place .! The bench tables are pretty cozy and private . Love the menu . Pizza was delicious, the crust was tasty as well . Garlic knots ..... BOMB !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza . Soooooo good !

pL_AYYtZrXscmtDAaKht6w.text: Bomb bomb bomb! Saw a video on YouTube about this place being in top 10 pizza in Vegas. We were staying at Park MGM and made a quick walk over to Aria. We were not disappointed. Great pizza great service and left very full. It's nice when you receive a recommendation and it pans out. Thanks!

VkzKjqhhvPPzHooZIvn6yQ.text: Great place to grab cheap eats in Aria Casino! I got a slice of pizza ($7+) but it was worth it because everything else around here is way pricier and if I want a cheap snack, this place has got it!  Service is friendly and the pizza is really good!  I highly recommend you stop by for a bite!

7fmicKvBbiVo92eEfzLZ_A.text: Wow! What a neat idea and delicious.  Pictures enclosed  Great ambiance! Fantastic pizza! Yummy shakes!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amaretto sour
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham and Margherita
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings, sauce on the side for the kids

qGcb2emX-Pz108qJmdfzmA.text: If you want the best pizza of your life then this is the place for you.   It's tucked into the Aria hotel, so there is the hassle of driving and parking in their no longer free garage. Yes, you now have to pay for the pleasure of parking at a casino to go and spend money. But, that's another story.   The interior is a funky, modern decor with a large bar in the middle. Servers are very friendly (ask for John!).   The menu is not huge; they have several pizza combinations or you can build your own. We recommend the Gotham which is a delightful combination of delicious meats and mozzarella on a zesty sauce and a crust that is the perfect blend of crunchy and chewy. Amazing!   Oh, and try the arancini as a starter. Crispy risotto balls that don't look like much but as wonderfully tasty.   A tiny drawback: it is not cheap. A soda will run you $5 though it is refillable. The Gotham is $35 for about 6 or 7 decently-sized slices. We were pretty hungry and shared it and finished the whole thing.   It may not be cheap and is a bit of a pain to get to, but Five Fifty is well worth it. Definitely the best pizza we have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool interior

QNzwk3zHw8WvmxikrgxQSw.text: We came here because lemongrass was jam packed with  an hour or more wait, and we were thinking about giving blossom a second shot, but they were only doing reservations all day. So we ended up at 50five. The pizza was decent, thin crispy crust but a tiny bit on the burnt side. And all the sauces were definitely on the saltier side. Truffle pizza was supposed to be the best thing on the menu and it was good, but I honestly can't even remember how it tasted and I just ate it 30 minutes ago.   Marisela was our server and she had a habit of walking away on a hurry before we had finished ordering, first with the drink order, then again with the food order. We had to ask twice for more olives for our bloody Mary. She came back saying they had no more, but when we tried to ask the busser, he managed scrounge up a few for us. We had to ask her multiple times for hot sauce as well, she kept forgetting so we asked the busser again.   They have a surprisingly good selection of whiskey here but the kicker that they don't tell you about is that they charge 4 dollars for an ice cube...   The pizza was decent, but the service kinda made this place average at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 dollar additional charge for an ice cube when asked for whiskey on the rocks
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham pizza

7pE_9GFwAeYD2-h3gWuNng.text: Pizza is good. The cheese is potent. They make visiting an ease since you are able to walk up and choose a single slice of pizza and walk off or if you choose to sit down there is that option too. Good variety of pizza.

V4fsn0X6EZzH4nZS1TLsGQ.text: Ordered the prix fix lunch menu which comes with a salad and a pan sized pizza of your choice.  The arugula salad overall was very sweet.  It came with sweet dressing and the walnuts were candied so made me look forward to my savory pizza.  Funnily enough the pizza was too salty.  I ordered the margarita pizza with prosciutto.  The tomato sauce was very salty and the prosciutto only added to the saltiness.  The chef can definitely work on balancing the taste in their dishes.  Service was slow for a pizza place.  Music was incredibly loud to the point I couldn't even hear myself think.  Was hoping for a quick sit down for lunch given there aren't  many nice food options for lunch at the Aria but instead took a while for the food to come out.  Wouldn't recommend coming here either for the food, service or ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita pizza with prosciutto
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula salad with candied walnuts and pomegranate

5EVT-6OmqUJTMVSExYGOsw.text: Food is absolutely delicious. Brick oven pizza with awesome toppings. You can choose from their own creations or make your own. Definitely shareable. We had the Caesar salad and the Gotham pizza. Fresh and delicious! Very low key vibe. And the happiest person in the world brings out your food and you can't help but be happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham Pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

I54Y4hs_Lxx7Mlq-YBUL5Q.text: Awesome pizza! Located in the Aria hotel right by the casino. Have been here a few times and it just keeps getting better and better. I recommend the wings. They're not buffalo but they are sweet and somewhat spicy but so good! You can customize your pizza which is awesome. We got a pizza with garlic paste under the cheese, truffles on top and pepperchinis. The truffle on the pizza was amazing! The service is great, the waiter was very friendly and accommodating. We were also seated right away. Btw, you can't get a table if your only ordering a slice. You can only sit if your getting a full pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperchinis, fresh truffles, and garlic paste. Amazing
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperchinis, fresh truffles, and garlic paste
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wing. Ate the rest before I took the pic lol too good

Snw7kBC4T4jyj0SG8Ew4tQ.text: Enjoyed lunch at Five50 Pizza Bar located inside the Aria Resort and Casino on Friday afternoon.  Upon entering the restaurant, the hostess promptly greeted us and brought us to our table.  The restaurant wasn't crazy busy, but had a decent amount of patrons, and was very lively.  I think it was around 12:30 or so.  We ordered  beers and the Forager pizza.  Since my husband loves pepperoni, we were able to add it at a small additional charge.  It was so good, and was served to us piping hot.  Just a side note, Five50 makes thin crust pizzas that are definitely enough for 2 to share.   The service is great, and the restaurant is impeccably clean.  It's a little on the pricey side for pizza, but I knew that walking in, and it's Vegas.  Plus, it's located in one of the nicest hotels on the strip. If you're looking for a delish pizza, and a great atmosphere, Five50 Pizza Bar is it!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QXH883Nj-EAihmElC-8EKw.text: We had 4 adults and my 6 year old nephew, so we asked for a table for 5, the hostess told us the only way to be seated was to be split into a party of 2 and 3, which would have been ok. But she sat us at a tiny table meant for 4 people. When we walked in they had a big empty table set up for 6 people that would have been perfect for us and a bunch of empty tables by the back wall. The hostess told us they were reserved. Well... we were here eating and hanging out for about 2 hours and those "reserved" tables never filled up. So that was a rocky start to our experience here.  The bus boy was very attentive and efficient. I wish I could say the same for our server, MARISELA. She was more than a bit rude, walking away from us while we were still ordering. We ordered one Bloody Mary, when she brought it, we asked for a few extra olives, to which she replied they were out of olives. So we ordered a second Bloody Mary and apparently the bartender there was able to locate more olives when they are out. We then asked her again for a few extra olives and she again told us they were completely out of olives. By this time we were convinced that they were actually not out of olives, but MARISELA  just didn't know where they were and didn't want to ask again , so we asked our bus boy who promptly brought us a skewer of extra olives.   We ordered an arugula salad and a Caesar salad. Both were good and refreshing. The pizzas were average to above average, however at a luxury property on the strip I kinda expect to be blown away. Nothing was really memorable except the bad service !

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula salad
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle pizza

QRn2BmLT74ZbCytDFiGsrw.text: I'm sitting in my room @ Aria as I write this, here's the lowdown:  Anyone who gives it more than 1 star is:  1. From flyover country 2. So Cal 3. the South  Listen, this pizza is gross, greasy as shit. I feel bad for anyone who thinks this is acceptable, you've never tasted good pizza. It's not an insult,  please visit the following cities and order pizza:  New York, Chicago, Philly, or Boston.  Zero stars.

TF5Q1JRNSCi9rZS_88nLnw.text: Tasty, but BEYOND greasy.  Being from Chicago, we are pizza snobs, but this was by far the greasiest pizza we've ever had.  We both had a to-go slice of the forager (white pizza) to bring back to the room.  The box and three to four napkins were soaked with grease before I could take a bite...I was glad I had a sink to wash my hands and face when done, but it was quite tasty, just not what I'm used to.  Because it's so limp, they should give you a fork and knife with purchase, as it's very difficult to eat with your hands  But I'm a pizza diva.

Icfv__WCM4HRbBVZ8UMi5A.text: Great pizza and place to sit and relax. My new place when I'm craving pizza in Vegas. Highly recommended!!!

A2h5UZ2kzLjEMI7HoFjHsw.text: I had a root beer float with a double shot of Jamison, chicken wings, calamari, and the North Beach pizza. Everything was good and our server was cool. She chatted about edc with my group which was really dope for us.

T0zBLE5xcigUzCaSs70NDA.text: Pizza was not bad. I got a Gotham slice. I don't think it's the best but I surely won't be coming back. I've been there a couple times (take out)and the service is always cold and borderline rude. Not sure what the issue is....three star pizza. Two star service.

4r5taWBzkaor8AwLVV1FSA.text: Ate here Saturday night around 1130pm service was just fine. Garlic knots were unique in execution. Crispy outside soft in the center (5pc) served with marinara. For pizza my friend and I ordered the "Gotham" sausage pepperoni garlic meaty delicious goodness. Very good pizza and would gladly eat here again. The Gotham and order of knots and a coke came to $41 before tip. It is located just down the way from the poker room and near some escalators. Not too far of a walk from the parking garage if you're trying to avoid the crowd in the casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LomrUGfqMw2OWsvWpxeYxQ.text: We ate here with my family for lunch. We started out with the wings which were really good and had a great sweet and spicy flavor. I liked the fact that the pizzas were thin and cooked brick oven style. For the main entree we had the Gotham pizza. It was loaded with lots of meat. We also got the margarita pizza. we got 3 pizzas total and it was more than enough to share. We asked nicely and they changed the nearby tv to the game we wanted to watch. Score! This place looks like it would be a tasty late night option.

3mpQym9OCQcfFbvragoKDA.text: Solid pizza place, I had the truffle pizza and my buddy had the north beach pizza. The truffle pizza was way better, order it. The service was great, we found a seriously dirty clam on our last piece, and the manager gave us the pizza half off. Nice guy, thanks guy. They had some local brews on tap (what a hipster sentence) and they were good, try them. Thanks place

FboaTusGvPyTNLX72jW_Wg.text: My husband said this was the best pizza he's ever had in his life. That means something considering he's eaten pizza in almost every country of the world. Service was beyond amazing and fast. Great menu selections and tons of good spiked shakes for desserts. Must go.

cEdjTvyNQ6ZQPEROGWB5bQ.text: Since we stayed at Aria we wanted to try restaurants the hotel had to offer. Being from Chicago we know about good pizza. The first time there we ordered a meat ball sandwich and wings. I was a little disappointed they didn't have bbq wings and there beer selection was pretty weak. The wings were ok the meatball sandwich was good. The second time there we ordered pizza. The pizza was really good and server Sheryl was great! We left that place with a smile. For good pizza check this place out.

NaENlXQHc64L6Z_tzBBAjA.text: I was at Five50 last week and there was a friendly little green worm crawling across my friend's salad plate....when the attractive Latina manager finally arrived at our table she mumbled something about organic and deal with it....but not in that order....for an incredibly humble white boy like myself that answer would be more than acceptable...my friend is an attractive African American woman- who is not only a well paid executive in LA- but has not yet gotten to the point where the green worm thing is part of her cultural cuisine ...I don't think their exchange did anything to improve interracial relations....if only the environ of thirty dollar pizza's could be a little more post racial think how great the world would be....( in truth the whole incident might not have happened if it hadn't taken 45 minutes to get us two pizza's in a half full restaurant....the little green fellow might have just crawled away....)...  Hey Shawn your servers at Sage are a tad smarmy as well...I know you are from Chicago but you and your team need to tone it down a notch or two...

gngcilbg6XHBvCU7piYUUw.text: Saw this place after eating pizza at the cosmo and the pizza looked so much better here at Five50 that the next day for lunch we tried it out and it was way better than the cosmos pizza place that was featured on Travel Channel Show. I had the Gotham and it was delicious and about the same price. Five50's pizza is a little thicker crust but it had a lot better overall flavor profile than the other pizza joint. Piping hot right outta the oven, added some parm and red pepper flakes. Def coming back next time in Vegas.

2cHEJB2Zjq3OElpNu7Oeqw.text: Pizza was delicious. We got Getham, Truffle and Veggie. All were on point! Great bar as well.

mKMshA8Gi5Yl41DoSnICHg.text: I absolutely loved this place! We got an Elvis shake which was to die for! A perfect blend of chocolate, peanut butter, banana, and just a dash of candied bacon. We got the Forager for pizza - it was really good - ricotta, mushrooms, spinach. I would go here again without hesitation. As far as price, it's a good deal for Vegas. We share the large pizza, which was $28, and also shared the shake which was $9.

tv-y2A4FuoqVfGt47VWvpw.text: Got take outs awesome pepperoni pizza better than 800 degrees at Monte Carlo also got the pasta meatballs it's ok ... Octopus on toast very soft and tender nice flavor and de best pasta with ox tail shredded . Would recommend to try !

JD09YN8gfMjar5-z0Ixciw.text: My wife and I stopped here for a quick dinner. We ordered The Gotham, which was a very good pizza!  The service was very good too. We'll stop here again!

SJe9w_w5EeGSxDaKPh1NMQ.text: Soooooooo good!!!! Soon delicious... do I need to say more? wait yes, friendly staff! It was the last night of a trade show and I was starving and exhausted but very happy to know that this place was still open by the time I got back to the SLS because it was so good just thinking about it waters my mouth!

HZUndGUBhPumwrVHhjJyHQ.text: Real wood burning, brick oven pizza. The right amount of sauce and cheese! We had a basic pepperoni pizza for $26 bucks all 4 of us had a quick bite before watching Zarkana! Service was A+. Pizza was so good we picked up another pizza to go after the show!!!

lmi0NlGak6e-8Ff3MuN5cw.text: I had pizza from here my first night in Vegas around 2am.  The pizza was excellent but after that many drinks anything tastes good at 2am.  I decided to try it another time when I wasn't intoxicated and it was even better.  It was so good that I am ready to call it the best pizza I ever had.  I've been to Gramaldi's in Brooklyn, Lombardi's in Manhattan, Motorino in Brooklyn, Di Fara's in Brooklyn, John's on Bleeker Street, and Frank Pepe's....but Five50 is #1.  By the way, Frank Pepe is 2nd.

j7BlCf8aDzR3tqoLz9IWAQ.text: The pizza is delicious. They have great beer choices, and their garlic knots are fantastic

_W1zRHMGk6knWF1THhX-CA.text: We chose to eat at this new restaurant a couple of days after it had been open. Before I get ahead of myself, I wish I could rate service, food, and value separately, alas, I can not.  Service 3 stars- our server was friendly and attentive, yet had very little food knowledge, and was slightly over bearing. Seriously dude, I know what kind of beer I like, although I appreciate your input, I chose it because I like it, not because "you suggested it". You want a gold star?  I get that it's a new restaurant too, but you should know what's in the food, especially since people could have allergies.  Food-3 stars. Overall the food was alright, but everything was severely under seasoned, with no salt and pepper shakers on the table. Call me meek, but this is a chef run restaurant and I was not about to ask for them. Warm ricotta was just that, warmed up cheese. No herbs, no salt, just some EVOO. Yawn. The calamari looked delicious, until you picked it up with your fork and bam! All the "fritti" falls off, leaving you with oily, naked squid. The truffle pizza was probably the best part, although those potatoes, like everything else, really needed to be seasoned.  Value 1 measly star-$22 for a cheese pizza, are you kidding me?  Even with strip pricing this is a little ridiculous. Our bill came out to be $90 for a snack, an app, a pizza, and a couple of beers. For that cost per person I could eat someplace a little less casual and a lot better tasting. Not to mention, you can get higher quality pizza right next door at Crystals for half the price with better flavor, more variety, and awesome service.  Was it worth trying out the new spot? Sure. But there are way better options within walking distance.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Monterey squid aka calamari. Tasty, yet under seasoned, with breading that fell right off.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm ricotta snack. Really needed seasoning.
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amuse bouche? Spicy (!) paste, with evoo and herbed salt, which our server didn&#39;t know what it was herbed with.

7HDjXcR4Unj2A_lld5a12A.text: The restaurant sits on the first floor off the casino. It is a cool place that you could eat in with your family and friends. They also offer take out. They decor is red, white and black with hand-written chalkboards around the room.   The menu has a good variety of apps, small plates, salads, pizzas, desserts and drinks. They are known for their creative milkshakes and floats. Both with and without alcohol. The pizza was hot and fresh and full of flavor. It is a 16" pie and two to three people can share it.   Our server was very professional and attentive.

AqPyCC-bNgFNWrgiaPMbGw.text: The best thing about this place is that you can get a single slice of pizza for $5.5.  Those slices fly off the shelves, and you have a good chance of getting a freshly baked one.  Crust has good balance of crispness and softness. Flavor is a bit too strong to my taste.

5mgEAOAJDBFLW4m2Er2Xbw.text: I've never written a review on Yelp before, but after eating at Five50 I just needed to comment.  The pizza is excellent and if you're familiar with Chef McClain's offerings you can be sure the ingredients are top notch. VERY important to me!  I'd recommend trying an appetizer or two which is what really separates this place from other pizza places. The garlic bread is heavenly and the meatballs allowed me the freedom to try the meatless Blanco pizza. And with a Shiner Black Lager in hand (on tap) I was thoroughly enjoying myself!  If you're in Vegas I wouldn't miss stopping by Five50. Just my 2 cents...

B3-KTEFN1NIUWRM_ZCC_Hw.text: So much life in the city, you won't believe Been awake for some days now, no time to sleep If your heart is a pillow, this love's the bed Tell me what is the music, inside my head at...Five50 Pizza! - Chris Brown (don't wake me up)  I've stayed at the Aria for the past 3 or 4 trips since this place opened earlier in the summer and hadn't gotten a chance to try this place yet until now. After eating here, I kind of wish I was either drunk at the time or craving a quick bite or maybe buzzed or about to pass out from too much fun because the pizza was just not that good.  First off, the appetizer options on their lunch menu is almost non-existent. I saw maybe some garlic bread and salads and meat and cheeses but not even calamari or something interesting? Kind of a big deal, especially since these pizzas take a while to make. We ordered two pizzas, one with red sauce and one with white sauce. The cool thing is that they let you mix two different kinds of pizzas into one if they have the same sauce so we did just that. Half of one pizza had clams and the other was more of a meat pizza. The other one we tried was a white truffle pizza that had truffle salami and truffle shavings sprinkled throughout. Oh my....everything was so salty!! Not to mention that we couldn't eat half the crusts because they were burnt from the wood fire ovens. The portions were bigger than expected but since we don't like wasting food, it just made us eat more of these salt monsters.   When this place opened months ago in its infancy, the reviews were not very good at all. I was bummed until I saw that the reviews recently have been much more well received so I thought it was a soft opening type thing. NOPE!!! It's ok - I very rarely eat pizza in Vegas anyways but if someone were to ask me, I would say go to the Cosmo secret pizza place instead.  glass half full --- grab a slice that's already prepared with a beer and head over to the sportsbook right next door

TNDUfZWLwplmnLeFXs8f8g.text: Buddy and I ate here on Sat/13 Jul about 1:30 pm. - The complementary bread/cheesy bread twists were ok, and they did come with olive oil and a spicy dip. - We split a $28(?) Gotham pizza which was large enough to feed us both.  It was basically a pepperoni and sausage pizza.   - I'll give it 4-stars because it's inside the Aria, the food was good and service excellent, pricing fairly standard for a Strip eatery.  I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

4v8uaORoUrgTdHcgnVdXJg.text: Came here for a late night snack....and thank goodness we came right before midnight on a Saturday night because the restaurant closes at midnight.  Really? This is Vegas! Nothing should ever close!  We perused the menu and didn't think it was worth sitting down in the restaurant when it was just the two of us so stood in the line for pizza by the slice.  We got one slice of all the pizzas available...so there was barely any pizza left after we finished.  We came during the rush so you would think they would be preparing more pizzas.    We noticed that the person who ordered before us had their pizza warmed up.  This was never offered to us.  The pizza slices aren't too expensive but for how greasy and bland the pizza is, I wouldn't have even paid the $6/slice and would have just starved until the morning and eaten at a buffet.  The white pizza was gross (cold, hard/flavorless cheese).  The slice with sausage and pizza was greasy.  The margherita pizza was completely forgettable.  Eating here just made me angry thinking about the other pizza option across the way...Accept no imitations.  There's only one True great pizza in Vegas.  And this place isn't it.

PAPDFPVlkztmU7KxB96nAw.text: Located inside the Aria casino. I love that the place is open late. We were debating whether to sit down and order a whole pizza or to just grab a quick slice from the counter. We opted for just a slice each from the counter (options there are more limited than if you were to sit down and order a whole pie). The pizza smelled delicious and I was hungrily waiting for it to come out of the reheating oven.  I ordered the Gotham which consist of mozzarella cheese, grana padano and meats (sausage, salami and of course, pepperoni). The slice is pretty decent sized and thin in height but there was more than enough toppings for it. Unfortunately, it was sooo oily, too oily. I folded my slice to take a bite and quickly, drops of meat oil dripped down. I get it, it's the toppings fault for all that oiliness but that didn't make me want to get another one of those slices. I would maybe go back but for a different kind of slice.. like the truffle potato one or the forager. Fast, easy and affordable late night pizza is always a o k in my book.

hfpNy-jbfKbBm3ao6xZGMA.text: Great place to watch a football game and enjoy REALLY good pizza and beer.   Only reason it's not 5stars is that service got slow when the place got busy. Took us 10-15mins just to get the check after we asked for it.   But food is incredible! Get the Gotham and the Truffle.   Also, the meatball app is killer. Chopped salad also tasty!

31u0AgDJqXwhWu2xKKqmfA.text: Sports bar atmosphere and the pizza was delicious.  Some of our party wanted to order by the slice but you cannot order by the slice when you are seated for service.  No matter we finished off the 2 full pizzas we ordered.  They had a better draft beer selection than many of the restaurants we had visited so far.

c_YfiJoJlb34d195HdBFOA.text: Great new addition to the Aria property.   Ate here twice during my last stay at Aria.   Crusty crust pizza ( I believe I had the Gotham, 80% completed) Great selection of beers on tap Pasta dishes were actually really well done. Appropriate sauce to noodle ratio and correctly cooked pasta.

5Tg8ganRgkrVli8vDqZZiQ.text: I thought the pizza was pretty good but for the price they charge per slice I would expect more. I tried their gothem and their "special" pizza and the special was unimpressive. The Gothem was better but still nothing I would say needs to be tried. If you are staying at aria it is good for convenience but otherwise I will go elsewhere for pizza next time.

hTK8wDspzBblCpR0FvtOLg.text: Great pizza. I had a slice of cheese pizza that was just OK (NY style isn't my favorite) and a slice of the Blanca that was just wonderful. As far as pizza goes, it's not cheap at $5.50 a slice, but it's one of the cheapest meals you can eat on the Strip.

dpJlFebQ6EoAZW4pzQ2GcA.text: The husband and I got a late night slice here after mucho beverages and it was pretty delish, I must say. I got the forager and it was just super savory and amazing....the ricotta and the mushrooms just made for something special. The husband go plain cheese (surprise surprise) and it was good too. The price was also right at about 13$ for both of us. I would definitely go back.

Q-umLsZLyciFaeaYslIzvA.text: First off: this review does not reflect the deliciousness of the pizza here. I'm writing this review because I had high expectations and perhaps should have lowered them. Our waitress literally behaved like she had everything in the world better to do than to help us out. When she took our order she was rude and impatient. I'm sincerely hoping she was having a bad day, (still gave her 20% of course). She did not check on us once, (mind you this was around 2 pm, not a lot of people). I really wanted pizza from seeing other yelp reviews so I asked her about the Forager pizza and she said "oh don't get that, you can't have it to yourself it's way too big." Okay, fine, no slices. So I ordered a small salad and stood in the "slice to go" line and brought it back to my table. By the way, the lady working the slice counter could not have been sweeter! I'm left with a sour taste from the lack of menu variety as well as the icy treatment from our waitress. We will definitely find another pizza spot next time.

qzYcUA2SBkrQ2quKSlBkzg.text: gosh it was so tasty! they stay up till 3 am on the weekend so when you in aria and you hungry before 3 am just go there they will take care of you! great pizza tasted so good! i had to break my diet to eat this delicious pizza

gQpM1u6ex7NuWSqepOY5qQ.text: Have you seen all my photos yet of Five50 food? Delicious!!!! try not to lick the photos! 550 Degrees for the oven temperature for the best pizzas! Come get some!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Preserved Lemons for the Ricotta Cavatelli!
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pigs and Truffles!
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pigs and Truffles! Pork Shoulder cannelloni with a truffle bechamel and fresh shaved Burgundy truffles!

wQKFuMHJjfE8z9qqt12ggQ.text: Stayed at the Aria for the weekend and after many meals in some of the higher end restaurants we decided to check out Five 50 for something a little cheaper and easier.  We went there on Sunday around noon to grab some lunch.  To start off, the girl at the register was extremely rude and seemed as though she just didn't want to be bothered.  We both got a couple of slices of the Mushroom Cheese pizza.  The girl pulled it out and didn't even bother to put it in the oven to warm it up so we assumed it must have been still hot already.  We also asked could we get it to go so that we could go back to our room and eat it and she just handed it to use on a couple of paper plates.  When I asked her could we get it in one of the boxes she looked annoyed and gave us one of the smaller boxes to stuff 4 giant pizza slices into.  Overall probably the worst customer experience I had at any of the restaurants in the Aria.  Now as for the food.  I was again disappointed.  I know it's pizza so I don't expect some high-end gourmet meal but this stuff was just bad.  It was cold, soaked in grease/oil, and almost rubbery tasting.  It's extremely heavy so I do not at all recommend this place if you care about your health.  This might rank among the worst pizza I've ever had and I've had a lot.    Overall I would highly recommend you stay away from this place. At least when it comes to the pizza they serve upfront.  Even the low end looking pizza restaurant across the street next to the Walgreens tasted better and that was surprising considering that Five 50 is inside the Aria with all those other quality restaurants.  A combination of bad service and bad food is never a good thing.  Not recommended.

txBob8seaRTYBF3gzWFI2A.text: Giving this one a 4.5 but rounding up to 5 because my biggest nit is with the desserts.   First, stay basic here. Work from the Margarita base and add pepperoni. Or build your own with cheese, pepperoni, and basil. I'd go with half the amount of cheese, by the way.  The crust is outstanding but I do not like that the cheese oil soaks through it so quickly. That's why I recommend that you go with half the cheese. It still tastes great but it preserves the crust. The crust, by the way, is very good.   The five50 chopped salad was OK. Nothing to write home about.   The desserts were disappointing. The ice cream sandwiches had potential but the ice cream simply has too much air stirred into it. It's not premium ice cream. A few other desserts were simply not noteworthy. I'd really avoid the desserts. Make your way over to the Aria and grab dessert from Jean Philippe Patisserie. Cannot lose there.   Still, the name of the game here is pizza. And Five50 does pizza well. Keep it simple and you'll be pleased with a five-star pizza.

RiKj43F84sEmBYtWantZWA.text: Beer mac'cheese was 5! Lick the spoon and bowl good! Holy sh!t. Margherita pizza was awesome. Left in cheese coma. Ahhhhhh

MBEou07_3UybFX4J-G1FHw.text: Greattttt pizza!  You can get slices, but do know you have to get more than 2 if you'd like to get a box to go.  Otherwise, you can step across the way and eat standing up.    I heard that the restaurant itself was a bit slow and as I didn't have much time, the slices were perfect.  Unfortunately they sell the tiny coke bottles that hold a sip's worth of soda--you're going to need more than a sip as the pizza is a bit salty.  Bon Appetit!

ALvACJq9aNSINVtJfxbdKg.text: My favorite pizza spot in Vegas yet!  The pizza was hot and delicious, they had an awesome beer selection and a great ambiance.  Great for a sit down meal and even better for a between gambling snack or post-dancing grub.  Good pricing too (especially in Vegas).    My suggestion to the owner is to stay open later on the weekdays, even if it's just the carry out!    Overall, solid slice!

dfkycFGrbdfGUxFpyo1C0g.text: Living in Los Angeles, but being an east coast guy, it can be trying sometimes dealing with the certifiably awful, tasteless pies Angeleno's call pizza. I wasn't expecting any different of Vegas, but upon a casino shop worker's recommendation we tried Five50 for a slice and a beer one night. We sidled on up to the bar for a late night snack. I had the forager, a white sauce, mushroom, spinach and ricotta concoction, while the wife had the simple five cheese.  Wow, good pizza. Really good pizza. No, seriously, really good pizza. So good, we came back the next night and ordered a whole cheese with whipped ricotta and wood oven fired tomatoes. Even better. Really an eclectic take on a classic east coast pizza, done wood oven style with crispy crust. They also had a good selection of pricey but tasty tap beers.   Put aside for a minute that its rather expensive for pizza , a single pie is $25 to $30, and beers run $8-$9 cocktails $14, then again everything in Vegas seems to be pricey these days, this was easily the best pie I have had in LV to date. Cost knocks it down from 5 stars, and service was spotty at times, but certainly not terrible.   Recommended if you need either a quick slice or a whole pie, a single pizza would serve 3, and is plenty for 2. Recommended!

h9CsKEz2ddTIXcOp6iP-cw.text: For Vegas, they have a good lunch special.  An appetizer (3 options to choose from) and personal pizza (with up to 3 toppings) for $18 but I can't say the pizza was great.  OK.  The pictures gave me the impression that these would be the thin, crispy crust from the wood fire oven but not crispy at all.  Maybe because it was a personal sized, rather than the regular?  A bit disappointed but reasonably priced.

4xeXHxoDEx913JoOX2q88w.text: Hmm...not quite what what I was expecting.  We had a voucher for a free slice of pizza and a beer but the line for the pizza "bar" was long so we sat at a table. When we asked about the voucher, our waiter (in a rather irritable tone) said we could only redeem it at the bar. After walking off and coming back, he said he could deduct the price of the slice and beer from our bill at the end.  The garlic knots sounded good but instead of pretzel-like things or breadsticks like we thought, they were these little (and I empasize little) balls that were nothing but oil and grease.   The pizza was just average. Typical New York variety where you have to fold it like a taco or eat it with a fork.  Even with the voucher, the bill was almost $60.

6HnVYOMOZeLYQ0uj2wdw5g.text: Great everything!  Tip: Get the Gotham Pizza.  This a good place to watch the games sitting down when it's hard to find a seat in the sport book area.

zPozkPmuyyHBjwQNWyaymA.text: I came here (gasp!) not for the pizza, and I was soooo impressed.  This place does nothing cheap or low-end.  Every ingredient is carefully picked and often of the organic/sustainable variety.  The dishes are carefully thought-out, and pay close attention to flavor profiles and presentation.  The meat and cheese plate was fantastic, the polenta is an absolute must here, and the clams were just great.  Way better than expected beer and wine list too.  The servers know their stuff.  Foodies will love it here.  The price is right for what you get, which is a nice surprise too, considering I expected more of a Strip mark-up.  Thank you 550 for not catering to the drunk slob crowd, but still finding a way to please them too.

9XEsO3BFIoJZM6PWRV69nA.text: Well, don't misunderstand me here. The food is great, the pizzas are awesome, and the shakes are very good. BUT on the other hand, how can they make you wait for 45 minutes for a pizza, especially when the restaurant is far from being packed?? Generally speaking the service is not that friendly, from the non-smiling host to the very low-paced server... Come on guys, this is not what you expect here. You probably don't care as most of the clients are tourists you'll never see again, but this is very disappointing for locals. BTW, I love the wooden wall!

8WyfrDaPh5ChE-vCCa5nrg.text: PIZZA! Good  variety  of beers -great  wings  - whole  pies to eat in or  slices to go. Servers are fun. Go down the hall for  gelato  afterwards..

_2j44gRWT4urWUBOXmGhVw.text: As far as pizza is concerned, the three pizzas had varied from good to lousy. The one major complaint was the crust was soggy. Not limp, but soggy wet as a dish towel, why is this so limp.   The "Gotham" tasted good, the crust was soggy.  The "Forager" tasted good, The cust was not as soggy as the following nightmarish Pizza but far from crisp.  The "North Beach" just was horrid. Clams were in the shell and just baked on top of the pizza? What did we miss here? Why include clams if the pizza could not absorb the flavor of the seafood? The Crust was a MESS! The Clam liquid obviously bubbled onto the pizza and just soaked the pizza. This was a complete FAIL!  The wings were meh, ok in a chain restaurant type of place.  The server, Aaron (I think was the name) was excellent. He was professional, helpful and the True bright spot of the experience.

NzhABkmO_3vWs-wI_YOJWg.text: This is one of my favorite spots I've eaten at in Vegas thus far. It is a casual pizza bar done right. Excellent decor throughout from their tables, seating up to the lighting overhead.   Their selection of beer is outstanding, peruse for a while before making your selection or ask for a sample. We were here for an early dinner and ended up splitting the Caesar salad and their Truffle pizza. I can taste the truffle now...mmmmm. Handmade dough and crispy crust, fresh ingredients and don't skimp on the truffle. The servers were very friendly and casual. They have a few TVs throughout the place so you can catch a game if needed, but there is also a Sportsbook right next door.  They have about eight pre-made pizza selections but you can also create your own as needed. Lunch menu also included a couple sandwiches and pastas.  I definitely recommend for a casual but quality meal. They also have a to-go counter.

yodY6WON4qkzBIFGFK2xlg.text: Food was excellent. Service at the table was excellent. Pizza is so flavorful, we had the Margherita pizza and chopped salad. Loved them both. I heard about this place and we decided to walk over and try it.  I am very happy I did - this pizza makes others seem just average. Highly recommend!  Also the bar area had a nice atmosphere, very comfortable place.

XzVSkTtF8tHCaPxpkAItMg.text: Five50 is one of my favorite pizza places in the country.  You can't go wrong with the Gotham!

YCuunaeH1BRMPbyfFA7rGg.text: Came here for dinner when it wasn't too busy, pretty decent food, but I feel it's pretty pricey for pizza.    We got appetizers of the fried calamari and the pigs and truffles, i didn't really like the calamari, it was just too much batter and hardly any actual squid.  I did like the pigs and truffles- the spinach was delicious underneath and the sauce they use just brought everything together really well.  Don't be fooled though because it's actually quite small, at least for $24  We ordered the Gotham and the Forager.  I was definitely a huge fan of the forager, the cheese was cooked to perfection, deliciousness in every bite, i did wish that they had a bit more of the mushroom though.   Gotham is definitely for the meatlovers, it's pretty good too but a bit greasy compared to the Forager, but both definitely worth trying.   I wouldn't suggest coming to this place EVERYTIME, but if you haven't been, i would say it's worth checking out. :)  Apparently they have a pretty good happy hour but I don't know the details for it since we went during dinner time.

pBULFPWTWj8YLR27TuRBrQ.text: Went for dinner while staying at Aria. It was good pizza. I wouldn't crave it but it was tasty. We had the Blanca and Some calamari.  The space was comfy and easy to go in and sit.

03LURPLYYSUBbZeyQcUftQ.text: My new favorite pizza place!! Best pizza in the world! Better than NYC. Great drinks. Casual but fun! SO BOMB.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting at the bar instead of waiting 2 hours! Winning

FsEMUXlWRkfuRAiVYuAY7w.text: Aria's response to secret pizza.  We patronized the slice bar. The slices are smaller than secret pizza, and the crust was a little thicker. However, I enjoyed the wood fired aspect to it, and being someone who usually stays at Aria, I appreciated the convenience and lack of a long line.  I would return to try the truffle pizza. The white pizza was a little overcooked and didn't seem worth it in my book.

ckQuruap7LQICG0jJCKlZw.text: We visit Aria pretty regularly as my husband plays in their poker room often so we've been looking forward to this place opening up for a while.  Every casino needs a good casual place or two to eat that isn't the coffee shop.  (No, Bellagio, Olives doesn't count...)  Anyway, all I can say is that this place is GREAT.  Now, we like a good straightforward cheese pizza, not all the bells and whistles, and theirs was honestly the best pizza either of us have had pretty much anywhere.  No lie.  This comes mostly from the crust which, on our pizza, was perfect.  Crisp on the bottom, yet still chewy, plenty of those great dough bubbles (you know what I'm talking about!), and really flavorful.  The sauce was delicious, not too spicy, not too sweet.  And the cheese was also perfectly flavorful, not super stringy like you get on a gimmicky cheap pizza, and not totally greasy like...well, like on Secret Pizza, a total grease bomb if you ask me.  We had salads, too, and my beet salad was great.  Something special, if you want to splurge (which we did).    The atmosphere was pleasant, no blasting music like you get in some Vegas restaurants now, and there were games going over the bar so it felt comfortable and casual.  The service, in our case, was prompt and pleasant.  So, yeah, all around, an emphatic five stars for a pizza place.  And I can't wait to go back.

iC4Cl7fAxFEVl4CbpwRcKQ.text: This was the perfect place to stumble upon for a late afternoon Bloody Mary and bite to eat in preparation for another night of endless fun.   We sat at the bar and enjoyed the banter with the bartenders as much as the extra spicy habanero drink.  Jessica, Jennifer and Dominique were friendly and very service minded.  What caught our immediate attention was the bar was sans slot machine screens built into the bar so we could enjoy an actual dining/bar experience not gambling & dining/bar experience!   When we arrived we were the only ones at the bar but quickly realized this is not such a hidden undiscovered hole in the wall bar/restaurant....by 5:00p when Happy hour was in full swing and beer on tap was 50 cents a glass the bar was 2-3 deep.    What made it a very memorable experience was how well our drinks were made, the Blanca pizza was to die for and the friendly service.  In fact, we went back for a second visit the next day and enjoyed the same experience.

SSoms-IxX0pCT2cHNzjszA.text: Soooo, we decided to eat here last minute because we were staying at Aria last weekend and we didn't have time to sit down and have dinner before our show so we did a to go order. We ordered the forager and took off the bacon and replaced it with pepperoni. Overall flavor of the pizza was really good. We ordered a side of wings which complemented our pizza. The reason i'm giving it 3 stars is because the price was horrendous!!!!!! $48 & some change for a freakin pizza & wings!!! Yes the portion of the pizza was huge and they give you about 10 wings but seriously almost $50 bucks for 2 items!!! NEVER again will i ever pay this much for a pizza that didn't wow me what so ever!!!!!

DCNU07HtxVYSX2wyceJGzQ.text: I visit Vegas around 6 times a year from LA. This has become a must stop for the wife and I when we go. It's great power food for drinking and gambling. Not only is their pizza really good, but they have some pretty awesome drink combos (like a beer and whisky shot).

rHw1j8I2sVEbtBtTp2f6BA.text: I waited in line for this pizza??? Really?? Great toppings Gotham and the one with mushrooms....but geez so greasy and the crust was so thin that when I picked up the slice the toppings fell off and it was difficult to eat. Very soggy. Not worth the price. I went here at 2am, next time I will just order room service.

Dy567aeHILLBY00gZMmplA.text: There is a grab and go line at Five 50 where you can buy pizza by the slice. The slices are large. We had the Forager and it was delicious! Highly recommend if you are looking for a fast, cheap, delicious slice of pizza!

_mfmbgS3SkSj0roCcW922Q.text: Damn good pizza! Italia has got some competition here because the slices are hearty and the flavor is good. Forager is the BOMB.COM.

QtAhe1yw_4aFlqQMOepBCg.text: The water is triple filtered yuuuuuuck and the sand was great, the dressing was perfect.  The pizza was good (not the best I ever had, but yummy) they use black and green olives)

DTLXCBhkknTAjOEO_JkUEQ.text: This place is amazing! I ended up going here twice during a 3 day trip. It was definitely best white pizza I've ever had. Also tried the margherita pizza, which was really good as well.

gRf_T5G4wDbfflSTTy5Xug.text: My wife and I stopped at Five 50 for our last meal before leaving Las Vegas because we really enjoyed our previous visit there.  We panicked about the time and cancelled our table order to get slices.  The very kind manager refused to let us pay for the order and treated us splendidly - THANK YOU! We had a slice of the Gotham and the Forager and both were wonderful.  That's on top of the excellent Five Cheese we had there on the previous visit.  Guarantee the Aria and Five 50 Pizza will be on our agenda for our next Las Vegas visit!!

WFTZORZIqJ-Kmc2na9Dt_g.text: Would have been a 4 star review but our server was terrible. She didn't greet us, smile once, or check in with us ever. The meatballs were good except one being undercooked, and the pizza was tasty. Beware of zorica.

00mcMIoxlTc3PEn6SexyNg.text: Terrible service on Christmas Eve! Waitress doesn't want to be here and she made that very clear. Asked her how her night was..... "It's Christmas Eve I would rather be with my kids." Wow not really sure where to go from there way to make it awkward. Food great. Atmosphere usually great. But really if you are trying to pull at heart string for a bigger tip by telling me how much you hate being at work no go kitten sorry.

pofBl-pc7rDpD7AaViSunw.text: True story: me and the crew came to Five50 three separate times on one trip. Just let that sink in real quick. Mind you, that was three separate nights. It didn't help that we stayed at the Vdara and Five50 is located within Aria; but regardless, it was three damn times.  If you have been to Five50, you might can understand why. If you have not, let me explain. For one, there's a pizza entree called Gotham (comes with pepperoni, sausage, salami, mozzarella, and grana padano) which is a must. Second, there's a pizza entree called Margherita (tomato, buffalo mozzarella, and basil) which is also a must. Out of the two pizzas that I just mentioned, Gotham is a must-must. It was so bad that when we came to Five50 for the third time, the waiter who we had previously looked at us and said, "You're getting Gotham today, right?"   "You damn right."  Other than that, the atmosphere is laid back.

dSIqtvruuvS-vAlT5TEMIw.text: This is probably the best pizza place in Las Vegas. I am a local and I love pizza as you can see with my other reviews. Perfect crust, fresh cheese and sauces. Love this place hope they open one for locals.

bedFke31u6cgmA3uqupCgw.text: Great quality, fast service! Just the right amount of everything. I had the picante pizza. Not as spicy as advertised (I'm from So Cal so even fiery hot is bland).  Nice decor and stylish music. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picante Pizza

8NQYXywCgrg0t1lJ0dHMxQ.text: We got a full pizza from here which was priced at 35 dollars which is something you can expect from a pizza joint on the strip. The pizza was decent at best. It barely had any sauce on it. The best part of the pizza was the crust because it was thin and crispy. I dont think ill visit this place again.

c4fxbe-u9dzzo7VRVJ5mVg.text: Consistently excellent pizza. Crispy thin crust. Sauce that doesn't try too hard but has great flavor. Can't get enough of this place. Great to sit down in the restaurant or to just grab a slice at the Togo counter. Highly recommend!

959Y55hZ8ZrPI-9WQZkEtQ.text: I'm a little too obsessed with this place. Probably my favorite pizza place... ever. Thats quite the statement but trust me, I'm a huge pizza person. After I pair a build your own cheese, pepperoni, mushroom and black olive pizza, with a yummy caesar salad, I'm full and ready to take on whatever the night has in store for me ;)

rJrkh8FvsdrMIwDduJdLlA.text: One of the best bargains in the Aria hotel, maybe Vegas. Pizza by the slice, with a few other dishes. The large slices are about $6-9. The menu is small but well executed. The pizza is excellent by any city's standards. Crisp crust with interesting mixes of cheese and toppings. The Forager with mushrooms (not button mushrooms) is my favorite. Good selection of craft beers and whiskeys at the bar. There is even a counter for Pizza to go.

5E3ta1l3mjMT9yflppUVoA.text: If it were for the food, I would give a three or four star review, depending on what particular item.  If it was the service, i would give one star.  Two of us went for lunch, and sat down, ordered some drinks, and looked at the menu.  The hostess was nice and friendly, and offered some thoughts on food.  Then our server came.  I believe she smiled 1.5 times in our hour sitting.  A .5 when we sat down (it looked more like a grimace) and a HUGE smile when she brought our check and said I hope you enjoyed your meal (in other words, when tipping time came).  The rest of the time she was angry, or perhaps heartbroken, or suicidal, or I do not know what.  I understand bad days happen.  Everyone has them.  They are rough.  But don't look at your customers like you are annoyed you have them, or angry that they came in.  Especially when one is the nicest lady ever and friendly and cheerful and you just keep scowling at her.  It looks bad.    The pizza was enjoyable (a bit greasy, but hey, it is pizza).  The salad we split (which, regardless of what they say, is not that small a salad) was fresh tasting, and I enjoyed it very much.  The environment is nice, and it is an easy to find location.  Hopefully the service picks up.

1GjFwkEpcWw2ypKvzlL8Jg.text: I loved this place! Parking garage @ Aria, easy access. servers were awesome dudes. My coworker and I got seated quickly. we started with garlic knots and wings. Im picky about wings and I lovvved them! Split the truffle pizza and gotham. So different but so good. This place is casual but doesnt taste cheap and i would definitely go back again and again! Great beer selection. I want to get dessert next time!

Il0CeZc5_j2v1bOOlCVMgQ.text: So we ordered some drinks at the bar and bought some slices of pizza to enjoy as a snack only to be told that you can't eat slices at the bar. Why didn't you say that before we ordered. Can't stand job worths!! .

L03xMzf3OfPOjq6lLkh3SQ.text: Lunch for 10. Service was as great as the craft pizzas. Gotham, Truffle and Picante were the three best. Beer flight was very good, as is the wide variety of bourbons and other spirits. Didn't have room for the milkshake menu. Gotta remember to come back before they close at 3am for that.

2AnaLST0kY0_fPX2H5x7RA.text: This was a bad experience all around. I wanted pizza and my wife needed a gluten free option. The hostess told us they had gluten free pasta, so we thought this would meet both of our needs. Sadly, it did not.   Things started to go bad when the server informed us they would not serve me pizza by the slice. What?  We came here because we saw the pizza slices our front. Nope. "The chef has decided he won't serve you pizza by the slice."  Why not?  Well, it could be so that I would pay $40 for a whole pizza even though I only wanted one slice.  Also, "the chef?"  It's a pizza place. Pretentious much?  But the pasta was good, wasn't it?  Sadly, no. It was "ok."    An arrogant chef, high prices and mediocre food do not make for a good experience. If you want great pizza, there are several outstanding choices in Las Vegas. This is not one of them

U2JHrJqNTvtKy18BQ6RJkQ.text: Buddy told me it's the best pizza he's had. My guess is he was drunk or the fact he's from Allentown PA home of Shitty food. The dough wasn't cooked enough for my liking and the sauce had a bitter taste possibly from over heating it. The hummus was decent and came with some olives and veggies. I'll skip this place next time in town. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus among us
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita with sausage and pepperoni one side.

fv5Ylsc49lKOI81GKz4yJQ.text: It ain't cheap but it is good as hell. Big sizes so definitely share. Good bourbon list that was reasonably priced (for Vegas) and the service was really good. I'll definitely be back.

qX5ERmTBao-PLXYK7g4-Vg.text: It's my first time in LV so after checking out my hotel the Vdara, I decided to grab some food before hitting the slots at the Aria. So I stopped by here for a late bite to eat  with my sister. She had a salad with chicken which she said was great. I had the spaghetti with an added slice of The forger pizza. I've had better pasta for sure, but it was decent for the night. I think the sauce didn't do it for me. The meatballs were the savior of the dish, I could definitely order more of those. Add 2 glasses of wine and the bill was $100 total. A little pricey for the food, but the atmosphere was nice.

7cy-s0eCrZFP8-rkuEU1SA.text: Ambiance and service were fine. Pricing was acceptable considering the location. I'm a little baffled by all the positive reviews of the pizza quality. Ordered the Gotham and frankly didn't enjoy a single bite of it, nor did anyone else in our party. Extremely dry as it lacked any kind of pizza sauce at all really. Lacked flavor as well. Just wasn't very good frankly. For a "Pizza Bar" that touts a James Beard award winning chef, how is your pizza not above average at a minimum?

dpVrCnVpCIS59FIMqDUd4Q.text: A good meal overall. We came earlier on a weeknight and were seated right away.  The seating area is pretty big.  Our server was working multiple tables and he was hustling. He did a great job.    The big disappointment was the garlic knots. This place has some nice ovens...and they deep friend the knots.  They were ok, but greasy. I'm sure they would have been a lot better in the oven.    The pizza was good!  It was a little underdone for my liking. Being from the New Haven area, I like a bit of crisp.  I was kind of surprised they cook the pizza at 550F.  That seems a bit low for a restaurant oven.  My wife's salad was very good.  Good selection of beer and wine. It's a bit spendy for what it is....but you're eating on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza Margherita
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zu7w7_yxqiutKAMfLE7XBA.text: This review is for their take-out pizza only. You have the option to order a slice to go, a whole pizza/meal to go, or sit down and eat at their restaurant. We came around 11am on a Sunday, and were able to order a slice of pizza right away. It takes less than 5 minutes for them to reheat it in the oven for you, and we tried: -Gotham (Pepperoni, Sausage, Salami, Mozzarella, Granda Padano, $5.50/slice, yelp.com/biz_photos/five...): Really salty. I wish they did a plain sausage and cheese by the slice since it was the pepperoni and salami that were salty. I wouldn't get this combination again. -Forager (White Sauce, Mushrooms, Bacon, Whipped Ricotta, Spinach): Sadly, this was bland, and I wouldn't get this again. -Special of the Day: BBQ Pulled Pork: This was the best out of the three pizzas. The bbq sauce was good, and the pulled pork tender. I would recommend this if they had it as a special again. -Vegas Root Beer Float (Vanilla Ice Cream, Caramel, Butterfinger Crumbles, Boylan's Root Beer, $9): Good, but you only get a small cup for the price. I don't think I would order it again for $9. Overall, you can get decent pizza here for a quick meal, but it won't be that cheap. The crust is pretty thin at least, but I didn't like most of their pre-made combinations, so most likely won't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham (Pepperoni, Sausage, Salami, Mozzarella, Granda Padano, $5.50/slice)

jKxDA5iIMF882x5AypNPfQ.text: BEWARE- FOOD POISONING   I ate here last night and within a few hours after eating, I became violently ill from food poisoning, to the point where I am considering urgent care. It ruined the last night and day of my trip to Las Vegas. Save yourself and avoid this place.

s2aT3p5Iuhoqcnsmvxn_tQ.text: This review is simply for the take-out pizza experience -- and while, yes, that may seem ridiculous to give 5 stars --- it's ridiculous pizza! It's the kind of pizza that surprises you. You're not looking for much, maybe, as you pass by or running back to your sports betting table, or between dice rolls on the way back from the restroom. But that's the beauty of it...  My friends and I crave this pizza -- it's the first thing we all mention when talking about returning to Vegas (well, that and the craps tables at Bellagio). Whether at 2am after a long night of dancing, 11am while watching some sports betting next door, or 4pm after a long day at a pool party, the food is perfect.  Crust: Thin -- but not brittle. The crunchy/chewy balance is near perfect every time. They've got their science down. You won't have a soggy slice that drips all over you. It'll hold up without being too tough to bite into.  Toppings: All top quality. The italian cured pig varieties on the Gotham and spicy do not disappoint. The mushrooms on Forage are prime. The cheeses are rich.   Taste: Phenomenal. They don't over do it or try to make things too complicated. Even if you get the clam pizza, it's like PePe's -- basics but good. Like any good cooking. Quality ingredients well-done are the best.  Service: Always tends to be polite, efficient, and to the point. Heated-up slides taste great and only take 1-2 minutes to get right again.  Price: .... Five dollars and fifty cents. Very inexpensive. They're selling crap pizza all over Vegas with a Rolling Rock for $7.

bZuh53iOFltF_OqT0zVnnw.text: Fun and chill pizza bar in the Aria. I wasn't in the mood for a fancy dinner so we took a fellow guest's recommendation and went for a pizza here. Liked the nice, casual, sporty vibe. The service was fast and the pizza was delicious. The pizzas are HUGE though...waaaay too big for two people.

ej6UtaML0CV1PPooeW2UsA.text: Great place for pizza and a beer.  Good selection of local beers.  Megan is an awesome bartender who recommended a killer IPA that was light and refreshing.   She also recommended the Charcuterie and the wings.  Charcuterie was delish and the wings were full of flavor and just the right amount of heat.  Great balance.  Overall a great experience,  manager and chef came out and greater guests.  Good times, we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool collage across dining room

-MlwodI34g6V7OZNGvERGg.text: I was hungry aftr watchin zarkana show n this was nearby..saw this place was open...wanted to try a slice of pizza..was told if i sit at bar they have limited menu for slices..if u dine in restaurant area gotta order whole pizza...i got a seat at bar..friendly bartendress gave me a menu n got my order..i tried the forager which consists of white sauce, spinach, whipped ricotta n mushrooms..it was delicious! Washed it down with a pepsi..i was satisfied...i will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu if u r only ordering by the slice..limited flavors
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

7OsL78Lwh1J4-cDK6KIoDg.text: Got pizza by the slice at the to go counter two different times and both times were yummy! Great place to hit up at midnight in the casino if you've been drinking and need something to soak it up.  The forager is delicious, great combination of spinach, mushrooms and whipped ricotta, hit the spot.
