Also has a slice of the Gotham which is your more traditional pepperoni and sausage, really tasty,  both had great crust! Definitely will have to try for a sit down meal next time, their mozzarella bar sounds super interesting.

MhOqfJ5S_xWRRHMlxh9PHw.text: My absolute favorite pizza spot in Vegas and really, anywhere!    Always get a pizza, and each time am completely satisfied.   Coming here each time I'm in town!

sF-PcRa0jXPglsUff2e1Xw.text: This rating is for the pizza only. The most expensive pizza we've ever had and, not worth it at a third of the price ($32 for Margherita half meatball!) The sauces taste reaches the level of Ragu in a jar. The meatballs were dry, and tasted like liver. The dough, and cheese were unremarkable.  Service was good. Place looks ok

aCCgWDZm9AfRd-gpyO4WYw.text: For someone who dislike cheese! I LOVE LOVE the pizza here!!!! It is layered with magic gold sprinkled with diamond cheese !!! Okay so maybe it's not all those ingredients but wherever that cheese came from it is magic to me.  Still dreaming of it right now! Trying to get back to it ASAP!

m3RCqK-zhCyFdST4L2aEow.text: I've had lunch here a number of times and dinner twice. All times were above adequate.   Sadly the parking on a Tuesday afternoon was rather challenging. It took me twenty minutes at the machine. Three cars ahead of me. I should've known, piling on took ten minutes. Luckily the attendant was on hand and she was helpful. Bonus, she remembered assisting me when I came in. The bar wouldn't go up and she even had issues with it releasing up so I could proceed into the garage. Yes, my plate was correctly on the parking meter ticket. Leaving it told me invalid ticket. That was after waiting twenty minutes on the line so I could leave.  Now, onto lunch (once I finally left the parking garage situation). Met some friends yesterday afternoon who were staying at Aria. It was about 12:30 on a Tuesday- not at all busy. Our waitress was far from that. My friend's husband inquired about the soup, and she spoke AT him and then as if he had no idea about soup or food. If personalities were sold, I would purchase one for her. She never returned inquiring if we needed anything additional. When she brought our drinks she basically threw them down. We thought about dessert, espresso what have you. Then we thought about our waitress. Thought it was better in just leaving sooner than later. The pizza wasn't fully cooked, underneath was more on the raw dough end and no brown on the bottom.  It had a nice taste, mushrooms and sausage. Who can honestly not have made a pizza correctly. They did- not cooking it fully.

GsRjBx0Ai5euZjhh2CzQMA.text: Had a bad experience when we where here back in December with bad food and service. Thought we would give them another chance since we are big Aria fans. Once again super bad decision on our part. Super slow service, 20 minutes before we saw a server, put in a drink order, 30 minutes went by after we ordered our drinks never saw our server again, they didn't even offer water. I could understand if they were busy, but 1/10th of the tables were occupied.  We got up and left. The table next to us with a family of 6 also got up and left. Learned our lesson. They also have some strange rule that you can buy pizza by the slice at the register but can't order by the slice if you sit at a table. Considering the place was pretty much empty you would think they would like the business. After all even if you order by the slice you usually also order beverages.

Gqyo0rf1twAIdO944RoKfQ.text: The food was good but very expensive. My friend and I needed somewhere casual to eat inside Aria and because this restaurant was listed as such, we thought that the prices would reflect that. I ordered a whole pizza at $28, but you can walk up and order by the slice for about $5 and change. The Forager Pizza consists of a white sauce and plenty of mozzarella topped with mushrooms, spinach, large pieces of ham and whipped ricotta. It had a balance of salty and sweet but the ham became overwhelming and it could have used a better ratio of veggies. My friend ordered the Spaghetti and added Housemade Meatballs. We both agreed that the spaghetti was tasty but the meatballs were off. The beer selection is fantastic, as is the decor. I just didn't feel that the food that we received exactly hit the mark or was worth the high price.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forager Pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with Meatballs

2PEPE84jD428jRJn3N6_DA.text: 3 stars for not having slice pieces ready. They were busy filling whole pizza orders. The girl in the front didn't have her game on-busy looking at her self in the mirror. When you get down to the second slice for individual pieces-you limit what your customers are going to buy. I waited 15 minutes for a slice of veggie pizza-wtf?  Overall the pizza was good-but I've never had a bad pizza

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oven cooked pizza

KP70erlqaf0EbXLfD61JrQ.text: Solid pizza considering this is Las Vegas. For a Chicago chef I expected more, but definitely a better alternative to Grimaldis.

MC1U0xSrh068KIGfYOpM7g.text: Awesome!!!!!! Great truffle salami pizza, pig truffle and homemade meatball. Also oxtail macaroni and garlic bread.

NSIeursj4TX6v0n2h2oq_Q.text: After spending a day at the pool at the Aria hotel and having bland chicken quesadillas poolside,I needed something a few hours later before I went back up to my room. I like the look of this place and ordered a slice of their 3 cheese pizza. I ordered from the to go counter and the young lady was very nice. Being from Chicago, I think I know good pizza. The cheeses were quality, the sauce was delish and the crust was so perfect with a great crisp to it after they warmed it in the wood burning oven. I definitely recommend and would like to return and dine in.

NSuGrhXsHBzT4zKIKxMVIQ.text: Went here for lunch yesterday to meet a friend that was here from out of town.  The pizza was just ok...nothing spectacular.  However, my son did enjoy the extra layers of pepperoni on his pie.  The warm root salad was ok but again nothing spectacular and was fairly small considering the price.  I'll stick to our local Pizza hangouts next time around.

RC0zZri5WLXzGXoHOl2h1w.text: AAAmazing Pizza!! You can truly taste the quality ingredients.  Everything so yummy and fresh.  THE BEST Pizza in Las Vegas PERIOD.

-QXStLhfiyOhRePod5_0xQ.text: Check out the 50 cent beer happy hour, poorly advertised, but great value! The pizzas are great, only downside was the dessert menu, overpriced and small portions. If the restaurant could work on making sure their customers can end their meal on a sweet (fairly priced) note, this place would get more stars!

LzvOmYczrsA7ATRKJtp46g.text: Best value for money in the Aria for lunch or a quick snack. The pizza is pretty greasy but tastes delicious!

wiwbc9SmTvktGGzIGIoGfA.text: While on a 5 day stay at nearby Vdara, my husband was looking forward to getting a slice of pizza.  Instead of just getting a slice, we decided to sit and eat.  Well, while it was ok, it wasn't the best compared to other places we ate.  First things came slowly and service was only ok.  We split a basic pizza, mushroom and peperoni; the flavor was great but the large slices and semi dried (over cooked maybe) peperoni cut the roof and other areas of my mouth.  I should have cut my slices but the dough was too tough and cutting was not an option unless I asked for a steak knife as I had already tried to cut the ends and gave up.  I love pizza but this just wasn't the best.

Ud0hcptLejzSkTDw3bEGhw.text: Here's what to know about Five50:  - the daily happy "hour" of 50 cent beers for 50 minutes was a lot of fun. The whole bar bonded over pushing coins to the bartenders. When I went it was 312 Wheat Ale so it seems like they're not just pouring you ten ounces of coors light in a plastic cup.   - the pizza is actually pretty good. It is a thin, crunchy crust, so if you're not into NY/east coast style than no dice for you.   - beside the .50 beer, you will pay a lot for your beer and pizza.

qp3TseS58U0mCIJpEo_Aqw.text: We wanted to grab a quick lunch before heading out to Valley of Fire, and happened upon this restaurant at Aria. I'm not a fan of pizza, so a gourmet pizza place wouldn't seem to be the best option for me. Fortunately the offered things other than pizza. I ordered the meatball Parmesan sandwich and my wife ordered a salad with grilled chicken.   The meatballs had a nice taste to them, the bread was perfectly toasted and the cheese nicely melted. The sauce was a little on the sweet side, almost like a pizza sauce, but that didn't detract from the overall taste too much. The chicken on my wife's salad was perfectly cooked and the salad greens were fresh and crisp.  The waiter was very friendly and helped with menu selections. If the pizza is anywhere near as good as what we had, it is worth the trip for pizza as well.

0z_nsKc4lwQvOVPO-gEDGw.text: Really liked the atmosphere! Great tables, chairs and ambiance! Wait staff was somewhat aloof but pretty nice at the same time. The salad with the figs and pomegranate seeds was quite good yet a bit small for the price. The pizza was decent but nothing to write home about at all. The crust was ok but quite tough to chew. I think the dough was a bit too dense/over-kneaded. The sauce was fine and the cheese was decent without being great. I enjoyed my time here and would give it a 3.5 if I could. I would say this is not a bad place to check out but there are so many other options and $26 for a margherita pizza is a bit on the silly side in terms of price (silly being a code word for ridiculous)- even in comparison to other Vega$ places.

-priWrcQX8nQKnMbNStXIw.text: My dog eats better food than this crap. Glad I spent a ton on this awful lunch. Do yourself a favor and go anywhere else.

963NfC2CttTBfvSZKFygiw.text: One of my first jobs in life was making and then running a pizza place. I travel all over eating pizza , BBQ, Steaks, etc.. . I even took my family to Naples's, Italy  this June to eat the best pizza in the world which by the way turned out to be the worst pizza we've ever had and the worst part of our trip. Anyway I've been staying at the Aria for several years now. So when they added a pizza place I was over joyed and hoping it would be good. The restaurant it self is very lively and well decorated. The wood fired ovens make a great back drop as you walk in. We were seated right away since it wasn't that busy yet. We ordered a Pepperoni pizza and Coke's. Yes Coke in Vegas again at a place that is dominated by Pepsi. That was one of our favorite things about this place. But the  pizza was seriously one of the best pizzas i had ever eaten. I only wish I hadn't eaten pizza the 3 days before so I could've went back again before we had to leave Vegas. Our waitress was also very good at her job. I can't wait to eat here again the next time I'm at the Aria. Like most of the places at the Aria it's not cheap but worth every cent. One large pizza easily fed my family of four. Believe me my kids can eat some food. Must visit if at the Aria.

FvdMz30TDKiDK6ko0N5d2w.text: Maybe not the best pizza I've had, but it's definitely yummy, especially if you're very hungry.  If you're getting a single slice beware that it's not that large--definitely order two. I was hungry again within hours of finishing mine. Both times I used the MYVEGAS reward to get a free slice and beer.  This second time around I passed on the beer since they no longer had cider as an option and the only choice was miller lite and some other regular beer (ew).  But for only 7000 points I cant complain.  I ordered the forager and it was delicious.

FpOyX8yUvS6i0JQVCdjbeQ.text: finally, quality pizza! way better than that crappy, greasy, cafeteria pizza at "Secret Pizza." that should stay a secret...

4qlKDStzC6R5rCOZqb7shA.text: This review is based solely on the horrendous service my husband & I received, as we did not nor will ever dine here.  We arrived on a Sunday evening, did not see any patrons waiting to be seated, and asked the hostess for a table for two.  She quickly told us "Sure, just wait a moment and I'll be right back to seat you." After waiting several minutes, we asked another hostess about our table.  She told us there was a 45 minute wait! Oh, really now? We then see the original girl who was supposed to seat us walk by, and asked her why we were being told there was a 45 minute wait when she already told us she would be seating us. To our complete shock, her response was "I spoke to you guys before???" Yes, she had spoken to us less than 10 minutes ago, and claimed to have no recollection of it. Her lame excuse was the restaurant being new and busy. It was not THAT busy; only one other table had arrived in the entire time we were waiting around. Regardless, you as a hostess would know that there is a 45 minute wait and have a responsibility to inform the customer of that. Not only had she wasted our time as we did not have 45 minutes to wait around to eat, she embarrassed us by making it seem as though we were not important enough for her to remember having met a few minutes prior. After explaining this to her, loudly enough for the entire staff to hear, all we got was a babbled apology from her and an offer to point us in the direction of another restaurant.  Sorry Aria, but we'll be dining elsewhere on the Strip until your staff learns how to properly treat their customers.

JcahlP2eMb0MOoCMYzNt4Q.text: Amazing food!!! But unfortunately we had a bad server, Amanda, that took our order and would disappear. I'm in the restaurant business myself and I would be embarrassed if I ever gave that kind of service. Had to ask other employees for help with boxes and our check because we could never find her. Everything else was on point and would definitely come back for the food.

DNuhbkPgKmVnJjGzHuZMDQ.text: Here's the thing about five50, its in a casino so you already know you're paying twice the price of what you would pay everywhere else so you can't really yelp about it being expensive.  But what you can yelp about is that fact that you know, Shawn McClain runs this and he's a top tier chef, he runs Sage, James Beard winner, etc. but that doesn't excuse the fact that this pizza considers grease as a topping.  I mean, GREASE.  It's like in "Along Came Polly" where Phillip Seymour Hoffman takes a slice of pizza and folds it in half to squeeze out this juice except at five50, you need like a pitcher.  It's delicious, but dang if its not greasy.  That being said, I've probably still eaten here like 10 times.  You just gotta know what you're getting when you order their pies.

i-zhxDD8FGWkL679fj2zxQ.text: Terrible service experience. After waiting 20 minutes with no wait staff acknowledging our presence, we began to wonder if this was a self-service restaurant.  The place was less than half full and still not one person stopped by our table to help us. Pizza is ok but is absolutely not worth the hassle.

ICH8zntMj137kRf9lUiuOw.text: Our first time at the restaurant, we usually just pick up from the pizza bar. Made reservations and had to wait even though there was some empty tables. Service was okay, pitchers were slow coming to the table. Pizza is delicious but we will probably just stick with grabbing it from the pizza bar in the future.

udHvuurHbgGH6y5TZ4KZhw.text: Coming from the poker room, this pizza is great. High quality ingredients, good crust. It helps a lot if you get if hot out of the oven. We sat and ate once, and the service was good.

60fHqDSMR1l3kBv5a9YE_w.text: I've been here twice now -- the first time we sat down to eat, and this past visit we just grabbed a slice to-go.   If you're in Aria and like pizza, this is a great joint to hit up with a group and share a 16" pizza. You can get it half-and-half to appease picky eaters :)  The North Beach is yummy (I love seafood haha)! Clams, smoked mozzarella, sweet onions, oregano. I don't think I've had a seafood pizza before this. The other half was the Picante -- ghost chili salami, shishito, calabrian chili, roasted sweet peppers. It was a bit too spicy for me, but it was really good too; I had to unwillingly hand over the other half of my slice to my friend. $28 + tip and tax for the full pizza isn't bad since the pizza feeds 4 people. Don't forget to grab a spiked shake! I ordered the Las Vegas Root Beer Float (vanilla ice cream, caramel Butterfinger crumbles, Boylan's root beer) -- it's kinda pricey at $9 + $6 for the Jagermeister, but hey, it's Vegas. I enjoyed my boozy lunch :)   This past trip, my friends and I just wanted a snack, so we took a look at the to-go display case. There are fewer options to choose from when you're getting a slice to-go, but oh well. Since it was the week of Thanksgiving, they had a turkey confit pizza! It was quite an interesting pizza -- turkey and cranberries with a white sauce.   Props to the executive chef, Shawn Mcclain. Oh yeah, the bonus? He was nominated for the James Beard Foundation's Best New Restaurant award for his new restaurant Spring, at the time.

WGLL4_Bl3HvKgXFZMCZfpQ.text: Best pizza I have had in a long time. The server was great. One pizza is big enough for two.

ol-OHg_OVWI2BJT0nIXrbg.text: My second favorite here. Good crust, a little chewey. Just got the cheese, and it hit the spot.

LID9KaQHPxR4Izf4scLiNQ.text: Gotham pizza.. Wings... Caesar salad  Believe it or not I HATE PIZZA BUT SHAWN MC CLAIN... wow. Blew my mind with how good E V E R Y T H I N G is here. Literally everything.  Had to update cause I forgot the most AMAZING part.. the service. One of the managers was very attentive and helpful. Believe his name was Johnathan .. keep it up!

jolJSCPGuNY8wQ1pdq5Y9A.text: Yeah, we love this place! You have to try the wings! Best wings out there, they are not buffalo. The pizza is also amazing, but it better be for 25$+. Zoe was excellent!

HE1EGH5EWDCda_-2vx86AQ.text: To go slices for about $4 (a steal for Vegas). Full size 16 inch pizza is around $30.  Pizza is delicious- chewy dough. Quick, relatively affordable option in Vegas. They have a casual sit down.  I recommend the Gotham signature pizza.   For lunch, there is a 2-course special for only $18. Soup or salad + pizza or pasta.   You can sit inside the restaurant with your to go slices but you can eat just around the corner in the open lounge.   This place is located on casino floor of Aria, just past the Sports Bar.

RMHyYEUIsUtAZLpwp-0Kpg.text: Seems so simple, yet it is often tough to find in certain casinos.  Good pizza sold by the slice!  There is dining room seating until a certain time, but slices are available on weekends until 3am and everything looked as good as it tasted.  I went with the Gotham (pepperoni, salami, sausage) for my first slice with every intent to go back for a second.  However, the slice was big enough to fill me up and more than justify the $5.50 price.  It was hot, quick and served with a smile by a manager who said I came at the perfect time because lines form the closer it gets to 3am on nights like this.  There was a sports bar right next to it where I could sit down and order a drink while I enjoyed my slice.  Solid places like Five50 and Todd English PUB (especially with Courtney working the bar) and very easy access from the self parking garage make me very likely to return for more fun at Aria next month.

GnpuzxPnW5aEI0Uswmbg3A.text: PASS THIS PLACE- The food and service here were awful.   We came into this place with a reservation when we arrived in Vegas in September and right off the bat were not greeted at all. We should have known from there the experience would be bad.   We sat down and were immediately rushed into ordering our food and drinks- after our drinks came, which were blah, our food  finally came. We ordered a traditional pepperoni pizza and a side of their so-called-famous meatballs.  The pizza was SO GREASY that the oil was literally dripping off the side of the pizza while it was sitting on the stand. When we picked up a slice it would fall apart bc it was so greasy.  The meatball was just ok. Nothing to write home about.   When our server came back to check on us we mentioned to her that the pizza was on the greasy side. She then said in a very rude tone that "That is how it is and that is normal for ALL pizza". I was offended with that remark. She has no idea what kind of pizza is normal if she thinks THAT was normal.   Any who, the manger came over and had a very similar attitude.   We paid our expensive tab and left- never to return, as I urge you to do the same.

loASiBUnfL_MX9XMOmtpeA.text: Went here last night for the first time with a group of 14 people to celebrate my husband's retirement. We had the best time! Great service and food. My husband, friend and I spit the Gotham signature pizza which was excellent! The crust was delicious and crispy. We also order garlic knots, chicken wings and jalapeno corn bread cheese poppers for the table which everyone loved. I had a mojito to drink and it was by far the best mojito I ever had! Also tried some of my other friend's chopped salad and it was so fresh, yummy and full of goodies that I couldn't stop eating it and it was big enough for 3 people to share. They let us hang out and socialize and took great care of us. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food and fun time for my hubby&#39;s retirement!

Od-xirLYM_qn7aeO_wz0-w.text: Grouchy waitress here, slow service at the bar. Tough times in Vegas. I think the bartender heard me complaining and tried to make it up afterwards. End of the day... Food is good. So if you don't care about customer service, come and grab a pizza.

hclzp9XolEoWPmRV-itRxQ.text: I'm not really sure how good was that pizza. I am sure that I came there after 4 hours at the bar and god knows how many drinks. I ate 4 full slices, including the crust and the grease and it was delicious. For what I remember, this place worth at least 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bv-cPKv5d6U3R2eXfxnwkA.text: My hiking friends and I were watching one of the farewell shows of Zarkania at Aria and decided this spot to be our meeting point. It was a bit early for dinner (5:30pm) so we decided to have a quick snack before the show. Yelped the place beforehand which had mixed reviews but pretty much consistent good gourmet pizza though a bit pricey. (understandably being on the strip)  There were six of us but two didn't want to eat as they were at the buffet earlier. So we decided to share one 16 inch pizza - the Forager- between the four of us and a beer each for two people. Our waiter, who will remain nameless as we were so pissed off we forgot to get it, decided for us that one pizza was not enough. Motioning with his fingers how tiny slices we were gonna get. We looked at each other and I was like, I know how big a 16 inch pizza looks like! But my friend decided to order another pizza, I guess just to make the awkwardness less subtle. NOT!  Anyway, while waiting for our pizza, the next table's order arrived and I pointed to my friend how having 2 pizzas between the 4 of us would be waaayy too much considering we weren't that hungry and we'll be watching a show for a couple of hours with those pizzas sitting like rocks in our bellies... She got up and cancelled the other pizza. Our food arrived, had a slice each and two slices were left which we just picked on. The server gave us our check and we split the bill of $43. (For 1 pizza and 2 beers!!!) and left a 15% tip despite the lack luster service. We were already out of the restaurant when our waiter tapped us and showed the bill and said, " Ladies, you forgot your bill." I was like, Seriously??? We left our cash payment on our table! Did you even check at all???!! I was mortified. The nerve!! And all he did was turn his back to us and walked back to the restaurant without a single word of apology.  NEVER again!!! No matter how good their pizza was,  not worth being treated the way we were treated. Management take heed!

P5PNEw1XuYlNOSmI9WMd_A.text: The best pizza I have ever had! Excellent Selection in Scotch. Excellent service, the bartender David  was very accommodating. I highly recommend this bar.

2yG0sJjMssm0z42T8WP1Nw.text: Excellent thin crust pizzas with great toppings and an ok selection of local craft beers. Take away a giant slice for $5!  Absolutely the most affordable dining option at aria. And the monopoly machines are right outside too!

P2PeZDRGDajZD2BWFO0ZIA.text: Okay pizza, rude service. The cashier gave me the impression that she could care less whether I ate there or not. Did not greet me when I approached the register, and rather than thanking me for coming, after I paid, she immediately turned her back. I was the only customer. Would have been almost understandable had there actually been a line. No one else was there. If they change the staff up, I'd probably give a 4 star rating.

M5Tmmx-z-Ef44Xvs9g5l-g.text: Wife and myself shared a forger pizza with alcohol milkshakes.  Both were very good.  Lots of tv to watch football.   When you walk out you are right in the casino.  Service had been really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZNssrxF2pOhm170y01ryew.text: Took out a FARMSTEAD whole pizza and a Chop salad.  Pretty reasonable price for a pizza place right in the casino, but the pizza had a soft middle crust which was a but gross, amateur under cooked crust!  There was also a topping that just don't smell good? Not sure what it was!   The chop salad was so overdressed with the strong dressing that it masked all salad taste!  I hate antipasti salad and this taste and looks like it? Should have said that on the menu? The good, the cooked crust was very good

o7t4ObtsdxT5DWKjHN_ApA.text: Almost perfect pizza! Almost.  Went to Five50 for lunch. Had a slice of the Gotham pizza. It was pepperoni, sausage and some other meats. The meats, cheese and sauce were all great. Especially the sauce. They should bottle and sell the sauce.  You might notice I didn't include the crust.  The crust was, well, crusty. And too much so. Maybe as an Italian I am just too picky about my pizza, but I like crust that you can fold in half, New York style. This crust was just hard and really distracted from what was otherwise an amazing slice of pizza.  Fix the crust and you have guaranteed 5-star pizza.  Service was also good and the pricing was good for being in a 5-star Vegas resort. I think it was $5.50 for a slice and it was a good sized slice.  Definitely going back next time I'm in the Aria.

6IpkCUYYA09ODgD9Ft-tDg.text: I would like to give it no stars.  The pizza was burnt.  We ordered a cheese plate, and the only thing they got right was the olives (which is standard).  I had to ask for the flatbread that came with it.  We ordered one cheese and two meats... I got two cheeses and one meat and it wasn't even the meat that we ordered.  My cloth napkin had holes in it.  But the bartender is flirting with my boyfriend to make it right... This place sucks.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poop....

wtdl9vHTA-EgB0SAEtJMJg.text: Updating my review because the quality has really declined over the last year. Service is frequently inattentive, they forget your drink order, leave you waiting so long it's awkward, etc. Quality of the food varies too. We recently got a salad that was mostly arugula stems with a pizza where they forgot the sauce and then added blobs of it after the pizza was cooked. The fact that anyone allowed that food to leave the kitchen is sad. We've been coming here for years and we're unlikely to return again.

FlZaND39Vm6_1H-3fIkdhQ.text: We were seated at the table closest to the casino, so the stench of cigarette smoke kept wafting in.  At least one guy was doing what I assume was "vaping" at their bar, as I don't think they're allowed to smoke in the restaurant proper, though I could be wrong.  The very decently sized (I'd call it a "large") Pepperoni Pizza was extremely oily and slightly too wet underneath, but was decent tasting.  The Meatballs were small and ridiculously overpriced for only getting three tiny ones and a few tiny plain crostini pieces that desperately needed a drizzle of olive oil.  Tiny portions at high prices were also seen with the admittedly yummy garlic cheese bread that was basically four half slices of an Italian loaf.  It did have a lot of cheese on it, and was great when dipped in marinara.  Refills were provided when needed.  My mint chip shake was garnished with mint chocolate cookies (looked like thin mints) and was very tasty.  Service was pretty shaky.  The server forgot my shake, and then my shake did not arrive in its to-go container.  I also had to ask for our box of leftovers, which was apparently sitting in their kitchen.  The manager did bring them out and apologized.  I probably won't be back.

MCuijpfhcnMWX-q3IkAnkg.text: Great pizza! Youll have to go at night if you want a good service, speaking by experience, but that's about it :)!

y14hC-jmmUCUOJxp4ebzIw.text: Came here a couple months ago with a group of 4 on a Saturday night. We arrived at 10:15pm and got seated immediately. The restaurant look about 60% occupied.  As we were seated our server introduced himself, a soft spoken guy, and was very knowledgeable of the menu and gave his honest opinion when making recommendations. He seemed like a nice guy but came off sounding very condescending at times. I really don't appreciate servers who stereotype their tables based on their age and attire. All we ordered were a round of water and didn't get any refills after our initial glasses!   To be honest, most of the staff was pretty soft spoken as well. I'm not sure if it was because of the intimate/luxury feel they were trying to give but all of the team members in the restaurant were very quiet and quite honestly not very helpful either.  Anyways, we ended up ordering the Gotham and Truffle pizza which were large 16" pies. Both of which our server had recommended as being popular choices among guests.   The Gotham was basically a meat lovers wet dream, it was topped with pepperoni, salami, sausage, and a handful of other ingredients. Overall it wasn't bad, but tbh I can't say I fell in love with it either.  The Truffle pizza was a major disappointment. Beware when you order it, it was very oily and certainly takes a refined pallet to enjoy.  Overall, we were not very impressed by what this place had to offer. Five 50 seemed like a knockoff more expensive dining version of Secret Pizza at The Cosmopolitan and the service was not worth what we paid. It was certainly a 1 time experience.  The breakdown: (for the price)  Service: 2/5 Food Quality: 3/5 Atmosphere: 4/5  All 4 of us shared 2 large pizzas and it cost us $66.   Tip* You'll get more bang for your buck by going to secret pizza at The Cosmopolitan.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What our server brought us...
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffles!?

6Tf8nEAOdHSpQq2qDKWISg.text: My group has been here three years in a row during CES, and it continues to be our favorite spot.   We typically do a nice dinner on the first night like Nobu, Bouchon, etc., but we only remember and look forward to 50.  The clam, margarita, and Gotham pies are the crowd pleasers.  There's a good beer selection and service has always been solid.  I can't say it's the best pizza I've ever had, but it's the best in Vegas.

2agpkFTfQQfa3j4lTaKEOw.text: Overpriced $30 pizza. Wasn't very good. Was too greasy, had too much cheese, the topping flavors didn't come together very well (got the picante), and the sauce/grease made the dough soggy, which was thin and wet like a limp noodle, requiring a fork and knife to eat. Service was mediocre. Had to wait a while for refills and the check. The only good thing was the wide selection of beers. I would never return here for the food, especially at the current prices.

PsgYkP6F16Vn8kxwEqbt4A.text: We ordered the "Forager" signature pizza. It was ok but not great. We found it to be very heavy. It was cut into 6 slices. We each ate two and even that was too much. Nice atmosphere and very friendly staff. I would give it another try but order something more traditional.

yBorW2OKmXosxjQufXpANg.text: The signature Truffle Pizza with truffle salami and shaved truffles was absolutely delicious. The thin slices allowed me to focus more on the taste. The service was mediocre, but the small number of patrons in the main dining room made the experience more enjoyable. The pizza is pricey, but worth it - a must try. I do have to complain that the pie only comes in one size (16"). For individual slices, you have to order at the general counter or at the bar.

1Dc05IT8Vgd4r9_F91H9OQ.text: We wanted to get something light but fresh so we stopped here, not surprisingly, it was very good. Their hummus appetizer is amazing in entirety. Pizza was also very goods. Quick, easy, fresh and tasty.

nzX2Z9wUoxyaFixjBGYrbg.text: Ho-Hum, nothing special going on here.  We went here for pizza and it was ok.  I wouldn't make a special trip to go here like we did.  But if you are craving a slice, then this will do the job.    The Baked Penne was actually better than the pizza.  There was sausages, tomatoes, and cheese that complimented the penne nicely.  It had a good flavor.  We ordered a pizza and got 1/2 Gotham - Pepperoni, Sausage, Salami, Mozzarella, Grana Padano & 1/2 Forager - White Sauce, Mushrooms, Bacon, Whipped Ricotta, Spinach(meat pizza).  The gotham was pretty good.  The toppings had a nice flavor.  The crust could have been better.  The forager was ok.  The ricotta was nice but the rest of the pizza was on the bland side for me.  The shakes and ice cream floats here was wonderful!  We had the Black Cheery Float.  The soda was outstanding.  It also had small pieces of cherries that worked well with the Vanilla Ice Cream.

WnKo6NYNboqyKPouuS-yCw.text: Amazing food with great portions. Greasy...yes but good pizza will have a bit of that. Wings are a shareable size and delicious. I'm glad to come across this place. Fresh food and great customer service. Domestic beer was $8 and soda was $4.50, besides that the prices are decent compared to the rest of Vegas.

Nm0LYS4XSjSUkPEMPvjEtw.text: Their S'more shake is a must have.The kind of stuff dreams are made of!!! Enjoy!

mImLA-PNAXBlYIQMRs-TqQ.text: So I got the chance to check out Five50 yesterday with my cousins. Theres been a lot of advertising and hype around this "pizza bar" so I was surprised to see how slow it was on a Saturday night. They converted the sports book into this restaurant and like everything at Aria it looks great. Stylish modern interior, comfortable seating, and friendly staff all made it an enjoyable experience. As Chef Shawn McClain's new spot, I had high expectations. I mean he did beat a Iron Chef right?  We ordered the gotham and truffle pizza off their signature menu; like most pizzerias you can build your own as well. The 16 inch pizzas were thin and crispy and easily fed the four of us. Overall the pizza was good but not really worth the $30 they charge. I guess its not too bad considering that one pie can feed two people but I expected more for the price. You can probably get the same pizza at Grimadlis. In the end you are really just paying for the name and surroundings.  They have a pretty good draft and bottled beer selection. The 50 cent beer happy hour they have from 5-5:50pm is a damn good deal if you are lucky to enough to find a seat. As the 3-star rating suggests, Five50 is a fine pizza joint but there are just so many more worthy places on the strip

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle - for the shroom luvers
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham - the meatiest of them all...

byTMngA0lkyWcfxNampcEQ.text: The middle of the road ratings for this place appear spot on. I bought the a la carte slices at 2:00 pm, so maybe they weren't as fresh, but the slices were only good, not great.   Random thought: So I guess part of the shtick of this place is slices are $5.50. (See the name.) I wonder what happens as stuff gets more expensive. Do they change the name of the place or just compromise on the quality/size of the slices...

33gtsmuJNliOCU16P9A-3w.text: This place seemed to have potential but it being the first Pizza I have had since returning from NY it sort of fell flat.  Crust was really soggy and the fold over was liking eating a soggy burrito.  Taste was good.  Service friendly.  Might try it again, if at Cosmo, but not worth a detour.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

amtgqVG-hCEPRaX2kjxOEw.text: I really liked the pizza here. I had the cheese and meant to go back to grab another slice, but I was too lazy to make the trek to the elevators. Slices are huge.

0LSI-O6vjrBf8_XnY7sS0w.text: This is a nice addition to the food choices at Aria.  We were sat quickly and our server was friendly and helpful.  We started off with some meat and cheese.  We chose the chorizo rioja and the rogue river blue.  Both the cheese and meat had great flavor.  For my pizza I chose The Gotham.  It comes with pepperoni, sausage, salami, mozzarella, and grana padana.  It is a good pizza.  It has a relatively thin crust and the sauce has good flavor.  The toppings and cheese provide a good assortment of flavors.  Two people could likely split a pizza especially if you get a salad or appetizers.

_P7aOQFoBHjAZty1SMpUfA.text: The good: food was amazing, and they accommodated a large group same day (I called in advance). My friends also enjoyed their shakes. This is the ONLY reason for two stars.  The bad: the service. Our server Richard Q. was rude. We asked in the beginning about separate checks and the response was MUCH ruder than necessary (the answer is no, btw, no separate checks; which is fine, but just say that, not a snarky remark). There was also lag time in getting certain orders. Our group asked multiple times about ONE order of garlic knots (which showed up after the pizza), someone got their shake 20 minutes after everyone else, and it took someone else 30 minutes to get their glass of wine. For what we paid, that's unacceptable.   They also asked if we were celebrating anything when I made the reservation (this was for a 30th birthday). This was not recognized at all.

M3q810OJjC0SFbJV9a03Fw.text: I recently stayed at Aria for a conferece and dined here twice - both of my experiences were good!  I will say, as I have in other reviews for Vegas establishments, it's VEGAS....things on the Strip are NOT cheap, so if you go expecting to spend very little money, you're going to be in for a rude awakening.  I'm only saying this because I frquently see reviews comment on how things are pricey in comparison to what you get/quality.    Second, this restaurant is located next to the sports bar so yes, you will should expect the atmosphere to be dominated by sports (not to mention that a lot of people do go to Vegas because of sports).  Now, the food.  The first night I ate here my friend and I shared the wings and a pizza and we each got a shake.  The wings were just okay, the pizza was good and the strawberry shake was Delish!   The second night I ate here I got the chooped salad, garlic knots and yes, you guessed it...a strawberry shake!   The next time I eat here I am going to try the Chef's Selection Charcuterie/Mozzarella....and of course, a strawberry shake!!  Nothing really stood out to me regarding service, which means that it was probably fine.  In general, the location is good, the ambiance is cool and I like that there's the option of grabbing a slice to go.  Will be back the next time I stay at Aria.

uOCqXDgp8stjrKnKoKDMbQ.text: If you are staying at or nearby the hotel, this is a great place to grab a slice of pizza or late night snack, lol.  It is made fresh and the service was friendly!  I had the classic margherita and it was quite good.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8GsJYrH1LxYMuvBk6HORdg.text: We had a truffle pizza and chopped salad to share. While the pizza was impressive with great flavor and good crust and to top it off, was cooked in a great oven and the flavor of the charring proves it, the salad was average with an unimpressive dressing that I can say I have had better. All in all it was a good experience and fast service that we needed to keep our concert time.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SojdXNkKtGkz3AbxEV-y_w.text: We arrived at Aria around 12am on a Wednesday, there are not very many options at this time for dinner. We decided to come to this place because I was craving pizza. We were seated right away, but our server did not come for about 10 minutes. We ordered the forager and margarita pizza, along with some drinks, a pineapple cider and pear cider. They had a very good beer/cider/wine list. The pizzas came out shortly after, the forager was the better of the 2 in fact one person in our party said "it might be the best she has ever tasted". I would prefer no spinach on mine, and my boyfriend would prefer no bacon, but that is just personal preference. It was a good meal to have after the long day of traveling.

_ColuhNUPXYWXvduH1Q-KA.text: I've been to pizza places in NYC and Chicago, this place tops them all! Incredible! And the Aria sportsbook is right there! Slices are generous...anyone who complains about a slice of this caliber in VEGAS costing six bucks apparently doesn't know they're in Vegas because that's a good price for Vegas. This isn't the gas station pizza they're used to paying a buck for

l6lADMidHNs2LaKddA8rBA.text: The food was Good. Greasy but good. Open late. Fast service , and the employees were very friendly  Quick and easy to get.

X2qs2BV-SB-bscwjIoCQmw.text: My lovely wife and I are always questing for great pizza. We were at the Aria recently and stepped in to investigate. Their Pepperoni pizza slice was the best we have had so far. Secret pizza still has the best while slice though. The "secret" to secret pizza"s white slice is that the ricotta is seasoned. This makes all the difference. No other white slice we have encountered has done this and it makes.all.the difference.   The other offerings were just ok. The white after heated was.just a mess and did and was.very bland. The meat lowest was just ok. The issue was that all.the meats did.not have individual rates and just tasted a bit bland.   Reheating the slices usually makes a big difference to the taste an texture. For the pepperoni I felt it.did not improve the slice so I always got is not warmed.up up. I simple.love their pepperoni.  Ceasar salad was good. Each leaf is dressed with the dressing. Very fresh. Nice flavor. Real Ceasar dressing with anchovies which we could taste in the background.   The dough is excellent. Fermented for 2 days in the fridge. The sauce I was told was slightly sweet whixh is not exactly nyc traditional but boy it is tasty against the their dough..and cheese. They also Marinate their tomatoes in wine I.was told.   Service was 5/5 for take away. Food was 4/5.

3eEservsPmrNL-Z1YGup5g.text: The chairs were comfy , the rest was downhill all the way . The pizza was loaded with cheese , more cheese than both the dough and the tomato sauce, each slice weighed like 200g .  I ordered Fiji water and the bottle was open when I got it , it had aftertaste, just like purified water , when I ordered Sprite , it also had aftertaste , and I drink Sprite alot , it only has aftertaste when it's a concentrate mixed with , yes you got it right , purified water . Oh and for the top they also ran out of burrata .  If I had to choose between this place and Domino's pizza I'd order Domino's pizza each and every day

vTEcSNKic9Q1tgKkixI7LA.text: Pizza sauce is the best. Thin pizza perfectly prepared in wood fire oven. Best in Vegas

n4_LdvLE7Co7xyHpYua7-Q.text: Good pizza . Crust is tasty with natural flavoring from the oven . Sauce is rich with spice . 12.50 lunch special on the run . Slice and a beer of choice . One of the best pizzas in Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Zgid4eJ2F9I90yH5w80Gw.text: I understand that your restaurant is 30 minutes from closing but that's no excuse to have a poor attitude when approached by a potential customer. We had arrived early to meet with a group of our friends after the WSOP to celebrate him winning. I wish we could have stoped them form coming because the poor attitude wasn't where this stoped.   For a restaurant in the Aria you would expect the hostess to be a little more professional instead she stood at the desk picking her teeth and playing with her hair leaning against the podium while we stood there waiting (literally, yes). I decided to ask if they had any gluten free options because I have an allergy. She stated they have Spaghetti that's gluten feee but it's a massive plate. Knowing I wasn't super hungry but didn't want to sit there not eating while everyone ate I opted to walk next door to grab food. By the time it was ready, our party had arrived, been seated and ordered. When I tried to walk in (food in bag, not eating it) she said she can't let me in. When I tried to explain I wouldn't eat it, she wouldn't let me in and rolled her eyes at me when I said I have an allergy and didn't want the pasta but I didn't need to eat it now, we just wanted to celebrate with our friends.   Threw away $25 worth of food to sit in their restaurant to have a pizza place not smell like a burger. Are you really that insecure about your venue that you can't let someone walk in with a bag and not eat?  Ourania, please at least learn some compassion and properly represent the restaurant you work for. I'm a local and I can tell you I will never be back.

hoXrLbj8zT7tjHYhAWQcQw.text: Sadly, after a long day of flying we cancelled our anticipated dinner at Carbone and 'settled' for pizza at this Aria favorite. I've been a fan since it opened four or five years ago.   We opted this time for the meaty and cheesy Gotham pie. For about 28 bucks, this 16 inch six slice beauty was served piping hot, fed us till we were stuffed and gave us an early cold pizza breakfast treat this morningTheir crust is nicely charred and flavorful. I think the crust often makes the pizza and this one is primo.  It seems that wherever we go in Vegas, we order a Caesar Salad. And other than not offering anchovies (a preference of mine, but not Joleen): this one was fresh, had a nice tang and had some of the best croutons (their own). Excellent!  Five50 offers four or five pizzas by the slice but I think the value here is in the whole pie. 28 dollar pie about a 15 dollar salad and 10 buck blonde ale. Dinner, done!  Next meal...late lunch at Hell's Kitchen.

Ucsp64WjNswPt6elxACdSA.text: Great pizza, no matter the hour. Don't blame the servers or cashiers for crappy service. They're there to keep the pizza warm and feed us.

SZk0kN46gfiFNED69G_eIA.text: As a New Yorker pizza is something I take very seriously so when I was told the Aria had a good pizza spot, I just had to try it out for myself. I went in for dinner on Saturday night with a group of 7 people around 7PM, we were seated right away. The service wasn't the greatest we were forgotten most of the time and our waitress seemed to be in a rush although the place wasn't packed. We ordered a margarita, pepperoni, and a meat lovers pizza. To my surprise the  pizza was good, it was flavorful, light, priced well, and fed 7 people. The pies in my opinion could have been cooked a smidge longer, and the sauce was a tad on the sweeter side; my favorite pie out of the 3 was the margarita.   Overall, I was satisfied and would pop in again when I'm back in town.

9_Q8EcMDJI-zae92ooAdvg.text: This pizzeria is inside the Aria, and you can get a slice plus a beer for about 12 bucks - not bad for being in the hotel. On Golden Knight game days, you get it for about 10 bucks. The pizza has tons of sauce, toppings and cheese, so definitely one of the better slices around.

l0rbmY0wYsu62SA8puzSZQ.text: Great pizza place inside Aria. The white sauce pizza is exceptional. Their slice size is huge and it's enough to make you full.

pm5MLBOC8gkj9lGHPDdtCQ.text: Bad service. after waiting 15 minutes for someone to take our order, the waitress forgot to put in our drink order and it took me calling the manager over for them to even notice. They then brought my husbands drink wrong. We got our food ( 30 minutes later) before we got our drinks. Last trip to Vegas rhey burned our pizza.  We used to love this restaurant. Though we always stay at Aria, we will not be going back to 5/fifty.

eSO3mVvZ0rBFW7Ig6eMYDQ.text: Wrote a review on my IG page, check me out on IG @allinsincity.  Dined 3/3/18.  Clam chowder was a double down. Nice charcuterie plate. Chicken sandwich was very tasty as well.

ua7sD1Zl_aFpfog-QTQ-ug.text: The service: definitely deserved a 5. Our server was Pricilla! Very nice, quick and helpful girl! The girl at the front wasn't as nice but ehh.   The food: pizza was delicious! Pepperoni pizza, HUGE and yummy! BUT the chicken wings were t worth the price at all. They were 15$ but the taste just wasn't for me. I'm not sure if I'll come again.

o7hhelFdP3pl1suII00BSA.text: Walked in here instead because the Aria Race and Sports Book next door was full. Seahawks-Panthers game was playing. It's a non-smoking area still so it was all good.   We enjoyed our Bloody Mary and Mimosas plus the TRUFFLE MAC N CHEESE while waiting for our airport pick up. This place was packed after 12 noon. Wow.   If we weren't full or ran more miles that early morning,we could have tried their pizza because it's a pizza place!   Helpful and friendly staff. Clean with decent chalk writings on the walls. Busy place for sure.

gE2lI_2A9IN9OmIpJ5HtAQ.text: Food is really good but the service is horribly slow.  Took 5 minutes for hostess to seat us and then had to wait at least 20 minutes to get our check and pay. The place was not even busy

A8wnuTuXPqn0M-4HnGhenQ.text: Decent pizza......cool casual place to grab a quick bite before the Vegas shit show begins. Pepperoni three cheese is good. Shakes are more dessert ice cream then a True milk shake

sI_MOoLylFGG-ahGpdjn8Q.text: A very good pizza place when visiting Vegas. Pizzas ranges about $25 - $30 for a 16 inch pizza that is excellent.  Five50 is located in the Aria and is in easy walking distance from the Vdara or Bellaggio. They are opened to 130 AM I believe which is great for late night when you're tired of walking around all day.   There where to groups of locals sitting next to us that let us try some of there different pizzas, very cool.  Service was quick for being a busy place. They have some great crafted beers and I think the food and drinks were reasonably priced.  We tried Evil Pie on Fremont also and they're good, but I personally like Five50 a little more.  Good place to visit if you're in the area.

mroV5sMm8EXhUlGmmXF-Tg.text: I came here with some friends and since there were a lot of us out generous host had a set menu ready for us to indulge in only what could be described as an insane amount of food.   Right off the bat if you are throwing a party or have a large group, you might consider this venue an option. They have room, and seem to be pretty used to such things. So if you call ahead they can be sure to take care of you.  There were some highs and lows to the meal...   Highs:   - Meatballs (so I was told since I don't eat them) However I noticed out of all the plates people were gobbling them up the most.   - Hummus and Veggie plate: Pretty darn good. I wish that they had maybe picked the veggies or did something with them, but I am embarrassed by the amount of flatbread and hummus I ate. I swear if someone even LOOKED like they were going to get it away from me I would growl!   - Olives: Don't order these on a first date or with someone you are trying to impress, or even, act as if you are not a total animal. I always say, let them find that out later with a little time! heh  Lows:  - Cesar Salad: Just god awful. Right when we put it in our mouth we all knew something wasn't right. We didn't want to offend out host or anyone else at the table who may have enjoyed it. However, there were a few of us that sort of gave that wide eyed "Ewww this is nassssssstyyyyyyyy" look. Honestly, I am not sure what was off, like there was just this foreign sort of something that was not good.   Meh:  - Marg Pizza: I felt it wasn't truly a margarita pizza. I mean it was good, but had too much sauce and too much cheese with not enough basil flavor to really pass itself off as a margarita pizza. I mean, I love sauce and such and so the pizza was awesome. I just think that if you order a marg, then you probably want a traditional marg if that makes sense.  I didn't drink as this was my last day in Vegas before I drove back to SD. The water helped me stay alive though!   Over all I have TOTALLY had worse pizza in Vegas but I wouldn't make a huge special trip here unless I was hosting a little party and needed a place with a great set menu option with a TON of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus and Veggie Plate

BpRiqA53vDktaK7nVQnDNw.text: Pizza was amazing. Very tasty and flavorful. The garlic knots are also amazing. Would recommend. Forgot the name of the pizza I order.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

upj6Z2vh-4HhN4spRreCZA.text: The menu isn't very impressive, but if you like pizza starting at thirty dollars that tastes like ten dollar pizza, this IS the place for you! The service is slow and overall bad, but they have TVs, so you can watch sports while you're ignored.

iaGIpv1JkHYziPZ6n_eYXQ.text: Wow! Amazing fire oven crust! Great deals for pizza! $9.50 for beer and a slice gooey yummy pizza! White pizza, truffle pizza, mushroom pizza and sweet servers to assist! They had an amazing salami chopped salad! I'll be back before I leave Vegas!

VtN2eeI-jBni4iO7djcMWA.text: Finding something decent and not too expensive is hard on the Strip. 5fifty isn't great. It's not too pricey. But at least you know you're settling for just a bit better than mediocrity. Still, beware pizzas near $30. I got the eggplant parmesan for$14.50 and a good beer for another $9. But at least you know what you're expecting.

ft8LJvaAtA1ZYuLjIB6Xnw.text: Five50 Pizza was perfect for a casual weeknight dinner with a family member that was staying at The Aria. Five50 has a grab and go counter where pizza is sold by the slice and then a dining room for a sit down meal. We chose to go with sit down service.   The Mozzarella Bar immediately appealed to me so we started with that as an appetizer. The three of us shared Buffalo Mozzarella, Burrata, and Chorizo Rioja. Along with our selections were bread, a nice stone ground mustard, candied nuts, and pickled vegetables. Everything on the plate was delicious. The chorizo was tasty and obviously a nice quality meat. The Mozzarella was my favorite of the cheeses, but the Burrata was nice and creamy. My only suggestion might be more bread to go with all of the cheese and accompaniments.   The Gotham Pizza was delicious. The crust had a nice crisp and the crust was just thick enough to hold the meaty toppings. The cheese on the pizza had a nice flavor. We found the one pizza in addition to the starter was plenty of food for three to share. My uncle and my husband also ordered shakes that they seemed to enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella Bar Selections
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotham Pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamsicle Float

BE5k6xt5_GRetQ84swtDWg.text: Amazing pizza. Large enough for three people. I had truffle pizza $29.50 and I would say it was the best wood fired pizza I have ever had!!!   Quick, great service too. Highly recommend.

mvUOkO3CzGvwsGF2OnMYnQ.text: Basically the best, cheapest and quickest option for a solo lunch or dinner at the Aria.  If you sit at the bar, you are able to order pizza by the slice.  The bartender was friendly and efficient, and the prices are great by Vegas standards. I had a shake for dessert and it's definitely enough for two people to share. Yum!

2A8BsJTbYV8Y23OKpd6gSg.text: The pizza at Five50 is awesome! Nestled in Aria casino section, this place is a sports bar with a casual environment. They have awesome shakes too!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QGNEtGZLBXjcaszIcqUrHA.text: Overrated and overpriced pizza. Not very impress with their pizza it's  greasy and soggy. Unless you like your pizza that way then ''tis place is for you. I don't think I'll come back here and eat again..

li2pnLOUDZv7f3q1BjbJkw.text: looks like this is the second cheapest eating option besides the grass fed burger stand in the hotel. That doesnt mean its cheap. Still could not avoid paying almost a c-note for 3 people, even for pizza lunch. Fuck me sideways like the Luxor elevators man. I must say, pizza is terrific. Perfect sauce, crispy rustic crust not paper thin but not over thick either. Toppings lively and fresh; had pepperoni and shrooms, great shrooms. Cheese amount good to a little too much, its fine. 2 appetizers that grabbed my gastric attention were the calamari with shishito peppers (good but small portion not worth 20 bucks) and the house wings (very good and different sauce on them, like a bbq/classic buffalo hot sauce fusion). 1 pizza sets you back 25 to 30 bucks; 6 big slices will feed 2 good without need for appetizers, if your a normal couple. Really enjoyed this place. Has a cool looking bar as well, and by the slice available too ( if your into the sitting out/reheat thing).  Great pizza no doubt. Without question the most popular to go food as I saw countless freaks trek up to their rooms with box in hand.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fantastic pizza
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious chicken wings
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small portion of calamari

rlKguQ1MBfEu2vyB2zozZA.text: I was jonesing for a shake and stumbled across this place. My S'mores shake was great. Best toasted marshmallows i've ever had were covering the top of this shake. Everything is pricey here so deal with it and enjoy the sugary goodness.

BHw2BvmvF3IW2ed3JyIRSw.text: Amazing pizza! I love how thin the crust is, and it wasn't burnt at all. I went with the Gotham pizza & the truffle pizza, both were equally as good. Never had potatoes on a pizza before, so that was a first. The truffle pizza was extra delicious with the murshrooms they put on there. I would say this pizza is a splurge both for the stomach and the wallet.  the family spent $70 on two boxes of the large one.

YdugDJtO9JhUMWCptoRMig.text: I really like pizza here and also drinks. And this restaurant is near by sport bar inside Aria Hotel. I think it's very good if you like to eat something and watching some game.

hYDblviHEnqnV0uKt_Q82w.text: Super fun spot to bring the family. Stopped in for a quick bite after check in and was not expecting much from a pizza place but we were all pleasantly surprised. Maybe it was vacation euphoria but I thought this was a great spot. Our server was funny and great plus only appeared when we needed him.  I loved the Strawberry Lime Cider over ice, kids both had huge shakes that could feed 2, calamari, risotto balls, and the Gotham pizza.   They also have happy hour specials and pizza by the slice up front. Plus if your staying at Aria you can call to get take out... Perfect for the older kids in the room with a movie while the parents sin in Vegas

AsVgd4sws65J4fx7kU4QRA.text: Chef was handling his smart phone to play with and then back to throwing dough. Not cool! Personal phones could be dirtier then public toilets.
