2bBHrgHUY2Pu6zKtQKeT3Q.text: Great after a night of partying in Vegas LOL.  I think you'd be happy to down the pizza in one go and wouldn't worry too much about where you're eating

VkFGEx5iomXYb3fRvSsYZw.text: Amazing pizzas selection, we tried a couple and both were delicious, but how disappointing to have a waiter bring a tiny Fiji bottle when we just requested regular water, and it had a $20 price!!! That is just absurd, the pizzas are overpriced but at least they taste incredible, there no need to rip clients off on Fiji waters!

DFpr7KX0LAe6XM3zUrwoyg.text: Not much to say about this place... didn't blow my mind. The pizza was good... not great .. the sauce was really good tho, the service was basic as well as the rest of the restaurant. Good place to go after a long night.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good sauce

HurU1do9SbnH9ZgciGSHKw.text: Pizza 5 stars, Customer Service zero. The cashier Danielle blatantly ignored me when I was the only one  in line for a long time. Another customer walked up behind me in line and was waiting also. When Danielle finally became available, she took forever for there only being two of us in line, and she starts serving the other guy! Hello I was standing here! I told her that I was here first before the other guy and she said,"well how was I supposed to know"and When i asked her ,"why didn't you ask if I needed any help" her response was," why would I". Really!?

tB8oZ6QsggqICdgbN6uI-A.text: Five50.  Love the name.  I failed to ask the origin of it.  My guess would be the oven temp? Who knows...and nevertheless the pizzas are very good.   They char them just enough in the ovens to give it a little flavor and character.  Toppings aren't skimpy and the salads and soups are good complimentary parts of the meal.  Solid craft beer line-ups on draft including local craft breweries and some out of state.  Their bottle craft beers are solid as well.  Nice ambiance, well lit, and upbeat.  Service during the day was a little slow but I can look the other way one since the meal was good.

ou0pKuIJ3Fob8A-JzC0GYA.text: Came here because it was fast, close and we were starved. Had low expectations... Turns out the food was fantastic - maybe the best pizza I've ever had.

qiWEf6qqXvhF1KysSQu8jg.text: One of the best Pizzas in town. As someone that is from Europe and learned in Italy how to make pizza, this is the place to go to. You guys are doing a great job. I could eat there every day.

zt3Z2B-YADLd8_EIwyLjjg.text: cutting to the chase: this place would get a higher score if they did not have an insect problem (ie; aphids, fruit flies, whatever else is buzzing about).  stopped in for our first meal on this trip to vegas, as we were staying at the aria. came across this place while looking for a simple lunch spot. pizza should do it. two cokes and a pizza. easy enough. sports bar atmosphere with above average volume level (however the chosen 90's music mix was a decent one). our table was freakishly and annoyingly wobbly, but whatever, not a deal-breaker. the mushroom pizza was tasty, and seemed to do the trick...  oh look, something floating in my drink! oh wait, it's not floating, it appears to be swimming. oh dear...  our waitress was young and super sweet, i honestly feel she meant well, however clearly still learning the way of her industry,  as she was not the smoothest in handling this situation.. situation being: a tiny green insect swimming around in a customer's beverage. rather than apologize for this disturbing and perhaps anomaly of a circumstance, it became somewhat of a confessional, in which we were informed that she hears insect complaints on the daily and the restaurant is constantly having to spray.. and it's a huge problem. apparently the bugs are coming in via the fruits and other produce.   had the waitress just apologized, replaced my drink, and perhaps docked 30% off the bill, this review would not be written. instead i was given TMI, left somewhat mortified, hoped the insect problem was local to that restaurant only.. (!).. and feel if this establishment truly has an insect problem, other unsuspecting lunch-seekers should be given a heads up.  i know that "things happen," but what a way to kick off our holiday.

d4fp_u_vSJudVXmJMapaIA.text: Excellent service! The spaghetti and garlic cheese bread is highly recommended.  The food comes out quick and always super hot!  Clean and smoke free! You won't be disappointed.

HuXEIkveBbEdbxfhy7UvTg.text: I'm absolutely shocked that this place has as good of ratings as it does. My boyfriend and I had seen the advertisements all over the Strip for this pizza place (they showcase their Margherita pizza on the ads- which is my very favorite) and he'd heard good things about it as well, so we thought we'd stop in for lunch. Boy, did we make an incredibly poor mistake.   First of all: the prices are absolutely insane for the quality of food. I know that it's Vegas, and that Aria is mediocre disguised as upscale, but come on. The Margherita pizza is a $28, and it definitely is big enough for two (I'll give it that), but when that pizza arrived at our table I was confused that our server had mixed our order up with another table. The Margherita is 100% just a cheese pizza with a few pathetic basil leaves on top, and you could tell just by one look at it. False advertisement, much? Granted, I'm somewhat of a pizza snob and I've had Margherita all over the world - I know a good, authentic one from a downright bad one. This disgusting cheese concoction definitely fell into the latter. I've truly had better pizza from Papa John's or Dominos - this was that bad. The cheese, which our server condescendingly proclaimed was "PURE BUFFALO MOZZARELLA" was absolutely NOT of high quality and was rubbery and gross.  Speaking of our server: a 20-something brunette, whose name I regret not remembering, was downright condescending and rude - I was literally appalled by her flippant and accusatory tone when we asked if we had the right pizza (because we were genuinely confused when it arrived). A simple request for a Coke ($5) and a side of Ranch ($2) genuinely seemed to put her out, the poor thing.   We spent $40 (without tip) on a terrible pizza, a coke and a side of ranch. There's a million and one overpriced places to eat on the Strip - save your time and energy and most DEFINITELY skip this one.

2x6xz5mEeankvxi3gfBt_w.text: REAL RATING: 2.5 stars  I love Vegas. I also believe everyone else does too. You'll often meet people who say they're over it or hate it, however, I believe they're obsessed with it deep down inside. Vegas brings back a lot of great memories - birthdays, bachelor parties, weekend getaways with past girlfriends, taking a roadtrip out there with some of my closest friends, etc. It's one of the few standing places in the world where you can go and do, literally, whatever you want, whenever you want. I've grown to appreciate Vegas more and more with age.   However, one thing I don't like about Vegas is how much the restaurants located on The Strip rip you off - average food at a below average quality. Everybody, I introduce you to Five50 Pizza Bar.   This was my last meal in Vegas during my most recent trip. I was out there for CES (Consumer Electronics Show). A few of my buddies and I decided to have dinner here before my 8pm flight because we were all extremely hungover. Something carby, cheesy and greasy sounded good - PIZZA! Located on the casino floor of the beautiful Aria Hotel and Casino, I thought this place would really impress. However, like many of my Strip dining experiences, I was incredibly underwhelmed.   SHAVED PORK BELLY "PORCHETTA" ~ 4 stars ~ $15: Shaved apples, apple butter and celery sitting on top of a thin bed of shaved pork belly. To be honest, the first bite didn't impress me. In fact, I thought it was very bad. However, my friend convinced me to try another bite, which I did. It actually turned out to get better as I was eating it. The reason is because my first bite was dominated by apple flavors with hints of saltiness from the pork. But after another bite, my taste buds settled down the apple taste and the pork belly took over. I recommend this dish as a starter.   FARMSTEAD PIZZA ~ 2 stars ~ $25: Proscuitto, creme fraiche, farm eggs and country olives. Look, if you're going to charge 25 bucks for, essentially, a medium sized pizza with only six slices, it better be awesome. Where Five50 falls flat on their face is their crust. They claim they're a spin on East Coast style pizza, but it's so far from that. The crust was flimsy and doughy. Another thing that sucked? It was WAY to salty. Proscuitto, olives and cheese? Yeah, it was a sodium bomb! The eggs were runny but damn was it salty! I must have downed three glasses of water with each slice. I had to eat it though. My body was in dire need of food.   The worst part about Five50 was the service. This is a little surprising considering they market themselves as an upscale pizza joint in the middle of a high-end casino and resort. Our server would literally drop our plates and flatware on the table, not gently place them in front of us. He was spilling everywhere when pouring our water. What pissed me off the most is that he didn't even apologize for anything. He wasn't cool. In fact, he was a total douche. I hope he chokes on something (it's Monday, I'm kind of in a foul mood. You gotta excuse me.).

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmstead Pizza - Prosciutto, olives, eggs
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shaved Pork Belly

nzCE4OEVs4o5df6SBzHVCw.text: Came here after the LV Rock n Roll Half when I was literally ready to eat anything in my path. Originally, I had thought about Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan, but with the prospect of a potential long wait and no designated seating area, it didn't seem like a good idea.   My friend D suggested Five50 as she'd been here before.   Unfortunately, this became another case of bad service. When we arrived, we were told it would be a 15-20 minute wait--no problem. But when we were called, our table wasn't actually ready, the bus boys were nowhere to be found, and our hostess was frantically trying to clean the table.   We sat down, and a few minutes later, a large party was seated next to us. We still hadn't been greeted. The large party had their order taken first. I was ready to cry... I was famished and I wondered what it would take to get some pizza.   Finally our order was taken,  but everything took forever... Getting drinks, etc.  we needed a second pizza (I was starving!!!!) and it took a whole again to flag someone down to order more food.   The pizza was quite good. We had the Margharita pizza and it hada nice light crispy crust , the right amount of lovely tomato sauce, and great mozzarella and fresh basil.   Who knows? Off night? The pizza is good, but the service was not on point when we were there.

5SfoEXM3nv3GlOu3iN24qw.text: All pizzas are 16 inches (6 slices) They say the portion is for two people but it was perfect for us three. We ordered half truffle and half pepperoni 4/5 and arugula & fennel salad 0/5. The pizza was very good but a little greasy. The salad was horrible! Absolutely no flavor, no dressing and no visual appeal. All three of us unanimously agreed it was the worst salad we've ever eaten and. Overall the pizzas are well designed and great, service and atmosphere also very good. Stay away from the arugula & fennel salad unless you're a rabbit.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula &amp; Fennel salad......barf!
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half truffle, half pepperoni
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xnLMm8L15c07_5upi2fiEA.text: Really good and quick personal pizza! There is space to sit or you can order to go. I got a white sauce with spinach pizza it was really delicious.

14tmKszY24n5xGw4SBDxCA.text: It's a shame. A crying shame. How do you mess up pizza? Clever name, Five50 (the temp of the oven) and the name Shawn McClain attached to this, how can this be so bad? I thought Sage was terribly overrated, but I had high hopes for Five50.   We started out with a couple apps, sampled four different pies (which we we able to do halves on) and finished with a few desserts.  Small Plates:  Pepperoni Arancini- Rice Balls, Red Sauce and Roasted Garlic Aioli. $12. Three small arancinis, they were pretty good.  Pigs and Truffles- Pork Shoulder Cannelloni, Bordeaux Spinach, Bechamel and Summer Truffles. $18.  I'm a sucker for bechamel. That intrigued me more than the truffles. This was pretty outstanding.  Signature Pizzas are 16".   North Beach- Clams, Smoked Mozzarella, Sweet Onions, Oregano. By far one of the weirdest tasting pizzas I've ever had. I think what threw me off the most was the sauce. I'm used to a clam pizza with a white sauce. The red sauce did not pair well, even worse was the smoked mozzarella. I felt like I was eating BBQ. It was terrible.  Blanca- Mozzarella, Ricotta, Bel Paese, White Chedder, Olive Oil, Garlic, Basil. This was decent, the ricotta was the best part.   Truffle- Truffle Salami, Bechamel, Parmesan, Thyme, Shaved Truffles. Would you like a side of oil to go with that? Wow, only thing I saw on this pizza was oil. Someone call  the nearest Cath Lab and book a room for me? I couldn't finish my slice, it was terribly overwhelming.   Margherita- Tomato, Buffalo Mozzarella and Basil. This was pretty standard. Nothing to write home about.   At $28 a pizza, you walk away thinking, "did that really just happen?"   Desserts:  Warm Apple Pie & French Toast Cubes. Both made up for the horendous pizza.  Skip this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast Cubes
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Apple Pie
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half North Beach &amp; Half Margherita

xSKHqTb8NAr3pJDX4rDWxA.text: Pizza was good, edges were very crispy but very greasy. We had the Gotham pizza and they are generous with their toppings. Also ordered the calamari and it was just meh. I wouldn't recommend the calamari to anyone.

E0oMA1M3yEnzlxIm_-dGiw.text: Very good pizza takes me back to my my days.  Also a decent price for the Vegas scene.  I got the spinach slice at the counter.  The pizza was fresh and hot.  This is going on my short list of must have spots to eat at in Vegas.

KDQs6kuW_s56_vX9_fF27Q.text: Fabulous find in Las Vegas!!! Do not pass up the garlic knots!!!! The cheese board was delicious too (I know there's a fancy name for it but I can't remember!)

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dldnh4xBX4qBQeMVdRrI5g.text: Average pizza.  Perhaps because I purchased a single slice for take out, the pizza was greasy and no way too hold it. It just flopped and lay there in its own pool of oil.  Sad.   But the worse was the nerve they had to charge 4.50 for a can of Coke!  For that price it was the best Coke I have ever had!!!

diBIW29r0NHiHuA_QByOoA.text: Last time the pizza was bomb... this time it was suuuuper fucking greasy and the bread was so thin you couldn't even lift the slice without it breaking off/sliding ... lame... walked from Ceasars specifically for this slice... what a bummer

dw5Ggvjp5h3IFABJplIhcQ.text: Great selections of pizza and a great salad.  We had the Gotham pizza and a chopped salad. Pizza has three meats and thin crust really good. Salad has a very tangy dressing good quality. Not cheap but in our hotel.

t7RhyOXrr893LE7gYhH_WQ.text: Another high dollar pizza joint in Vegas...  We started off with the Pepperoni Arancini ($8). These were pretty tasty, but most of the flavor was in the Garlic Aioli...yum!  Good portion size / price ratio.  Pigs & Truffles ($18): Pork Shoulder Cannelloni, Bordeaux Spinach, Bechamel & Summer Truffles. This was delicious but felt a bit spendy. It had a wonderful truffle essence from the fragrant smell to the taste!  I probably wouldn't order this again though.  We got two pizzas...both SPLIT into halves.  So we were able to try a total of FOUR different pizzas :  Truffle Pizza ($29): Truffle Salami, Bechamel, Parmesan, Thyme & Shaved Truffles. Blanca ($27): Mozzarella, Ricotta, Bel Paese, White Cheddar, Olice Oil, Garlic & Basil. Both were excellent, but the Truffle Salami with shaved Truffles was outstanding! Loved the flavor explosions here!! Highly recommended!  Margherita ($24): Tomato, Buffalo Mozzarella & Basil. North Beach ($28): Clams, Smoked Mozzarella, Sweet Onions & Oregano. The Margherita was good, bit sweet with a nice mozzarella flavor. The North Beach was surprisingly smokey in a red sauce, which was an odd combination in my eyes...I would have much preferred a white sauce for the clams.  I can't really recommend either of these.  And to finish, we tried the Warm Apple Pie ($9?): White Cheddar, Oatmeal Streusel & Smoke Salted Mascarpone Ice Cream. Good variation of the classic.   Crispy Sourdough Fritters ($9?): Winter Spiced Cranberry Sauce & Orange Glaze. These were great, but the cranberry sauce was perfect! Just the right amount of tanginess to compliment the fried sourdough.  Recommended :)  Will I be back?  Yes, but not anytime soon I don't believe...

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Pizza ($29): Truffle Salami, Bechamel, Parmesan, Thyme &amp; Shaved Truffles. Blanca ($27): Mozzarella, Ricotta, Bel Paese..
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Closeup on the Truffle Salami and Shaved Truffles on the Truffle Pizza! Excellent!
Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Sourdough Fritters ($9?): Winter Spiced Cranberry Sauce &amp; Orange Glaze. These were great...cranberry sauce was perfect!

s7Xr8vaGf63FEDcR69d1eA.text: I came in here from the sign on Las Vegas blvd.  I love pizza. How can I not being from nj/ny.  I looked at the slices. Kind of greasy and small but I thought I'd try it anyway. I asked for a slice that has salami pepperoni sausage and bacon. This slice had no sausage don't asked the young lady to put some on it. She told me that's the way t comes. I pointed out that there was none of the ingredient that the pizza boasts. She apologized and re iterated her previous statement. I left. I'll stay with Secret pizza at the Cosmopolitan. Ty fr saving me 6 $

EMN0gvUEyRGVhM_yXpdkGg.text: Why has no one opened a decent pizza place around here before? This place is brilliant--they've got to be making money hand over fist. The pizza is GOOD. And it's exactly what one wants after a night in Vegas. Over a four-day stay, we came here five times (ordered at the counter and munched our pizza on the way to where ever we were off to). I kid you not. And we will be back.

AqNDvx2dIkDehFj-N7LUIw.text: Grab a slice to go of this decent wood fired pizza and a coffee and you have a great hangover cure. cant go wrong with simple quality ingredients!  The lines get long in the evening especially when the Cirque show finishes as many people are famished and want a quick bite to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. slice &amp; starbucks .. hangover cure!

J9cNzVec9UKr770x_OX89g.text: First time eating here. We arrived around 2pm, and were seated immediately. Our server, who was pleasant enough but whose name escapes me, took our orders quickly and brought our drinks right away.  We ordered the Gotham pizza to share, which was, as we Italians say, "mezza-mezza". It tasted great, fresh meat toppings and perfectly cheesed, but the crust was not consistent in thickness. Some slices were evenly thin-crusted from the center to the edges, and some were thick at the edges (the way I'm used to being from NY) but so paper thin at the middle that the toppings and oil soaked through and it all fell apart.  I'm by no means cheap, and I certainly understand "strip pricing" in Vegas, especially since I work in the same hotel that this place resides, but the pizza carried a $28 price tag for 6 slices, plus $4.50 each for a 6" tall x 2" diameter glass of iced tea that was almost  1/2 full of crushed ice, and I can't help but feel that I could have put that $40 to better use elsewhere for lunch. Also a disappointment (which won't apply to most people but I'll mention it anyway) was the fact that they don't honor any sort of employee discount, making this the first place I've personally been to in the MGM lineup that has stiffed me on my employee ID. Boo for that. All things considered I'd give the experience a 6/10, and I think this will likely be my last time there.

YhqU0Xz3hDHaO9lrN8JjIw.text: If you're in the area and have a hankering for pizza, head on over to the five50. Let's call this place a 3.5. Midwesterners beware, this is a thin crust pizza joint!  We were pressed for time and had a 30 to 40 minute window for eating. The service was accommodating, and they got us in and out just in time. We ordered one pizza, half North Beach half Margherita. The slices were large and thin, so one pizza was enough to make two people full at three slices per person. The pizza was thin crust, but still had a slight chew to go with the crunch which I enjoyed. The North Beach had smoked mozzarella and clams on it, and was described as bbq chicken pizza with the chicken swapped for clams. It was unique with tender clam pieces, but I think they planted a dangerous seed since I found myself wishing it had a dash of bbq sauce! The Margherita pizza was nothing special, just a big basil leaf on each slice.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half clam half marg pizza

Hu5SE8koZDhxlDQKsDjZMg.text: This is the worst pizza I have ever had . Cold pizza  that we were charged 10.00 extra for after paying  $95 for two pizza and a horrible salad. We tried to call to complain and they don't answer their phone. Don't  do it!!

zVn_vI8z14sBD1XrJOH2DA.text: For those of you who have been to aria, you know it's a rather upscale ritzy place. Not really the type of place you'd imagine a pizza by the slice bar, right? Enter Five50....a sit down Italian restaurant serving artisan specialty pizza as well as the typical overpriced dishes and a huge selection of craft beer. Sit down with a group and expect your tab to be in the high hundreds.   Then, aria decided to try to be like the cosmo (in my opinion) and added the "to go" line that sells slices of pizza. (no, you cannot get a single slice when you sit down inside) there are 3 or 4 types to choose from... Cheese, a meat slice, a veggie slice, and a rotating seasonal slice. I've had all of them. I find the pizza here to be very artisinal, If that makes sense. The crust is more of the wood fire baked pizza or stone fired pizza etc. It's chewy and yeasty and quite good, especially if you're into that type of thing.  All slices are just under $6 with tax and all of them are good. The tomato sauce is A1...i was thinking in my head that the pizza was a 3/5 but then the sauce really just pushes it to a 4..its probably the best pizza sauce ive had. Not overly sweet, with a nice zest to it and it complements the crust perfectly.   The overall atmosphere here is kind of weird.. Like I can't walk up and get a slice and feel normal walking through the casino with this pizza. It's right next to the sports bar and right across from the high limit slots...strange. However, I think aria did a nice job of trying to combine their atmosphere with a place for guests to get drunk quick food without leaving their property. It's not my #1 choice, but it's 2nd and it's still solid.

bZf6u2xJgcR6YjUqGWw32A.text: Got a Farmstead pizza with en egg. Omg what a great idea to put an egg on the pizza. Genius. Our order took longer than expected cuz of some kitchen malfunction, but the stuff and the manager explained the situation and hooked us up with free appetisers. Another great restaurant at the Aria.

_y2xUFZr6KvKky9_dnq6qg.text: Looks like American pizza but tastes like Italian style pizza and they sold in slices as well.  I've had many single size pizzas at many Italian restaurants throughout the the years.  Five50 is no doubt the best. The crust tastes really Fresh and the ingredients couldn't be any better.  They cost $6.50 US a slice.  Often long line ups.  Must try if your looking to have a quick meal in Vegas.

Gd55rs8_n0RzxMC7aoVJPw.text: Came here after soaking up the sun in the Aria where we were staying in las vegas.  We were going for a later meal, wanted something casual that wasn't a buffet and one of the casino employees mentioned this place had good pizza so the other non-New Yorkers were lured in (as someone who has had fantastic pizza here in NYC and Chicago I was skeptical).  We were promptly seated (for a party of 8 we had our own private dining area), and our waitress was very prompt and attentive to our table.  They have a small menu, but it catered to our different dietary restrictions (some were doing a Paeleo diet, some were doing low carb, some were vegetarian... it's hard to please 8 women sometimes!).  I ended up getting the sausage and peppers sandwich, the well suited, and a few of us tried the margharetia pizza .   The drink was nice and strong, and was the best part of my meal.  The sausage and peppers sandwich was flavorful, though the amount of bread was overwhelming to the amount of sausage and pepers within the sandwich so it was mostly bread.  The pizza, though we requested it be cut in 8 (usually their pies are cut in 6), was cut oddly so it wasn't an equitable division of pizza amongst our party (so we ended up cutting some slices in half), however the taste was bland and the crust though well done on the edges, could have been cooked a bit more and tasted a bit raw.  So for a quick casual bite I would say ok, however this wouldn't rank very highly in my list of places to eat while in Vegas.

FaGB1jNGiW229R4kxweNGQ.text: We were so excited to taste Five50 pizza. We heard some good things from friends. I'm not sure if it was an off day...which would be unlikely because the place was hardly busy. Well anyway, things started off good. We ordered the garlic knots and meatballs. Garlic knots were good and the meatballs were overwhelming (too many spices). We decided to go with 2 different pizzas (1 per couple Margherita and Gotham)  1. Margherita had too much sauce and just oily. I mean it's pretty hard to mess up a Margherita pizza.  2. The Gotham was tastier but sooooo oily.  3. Elvis Milkshake was amazing according to my husband.  3. Our waiter was just rude. Very cocky and not very attentive. Maybe his tight ass jeans and hipster glasses only made him seem  older than he already was or they were cutting off the circulation...Either way his attitude needed work.   All in all not worth spending $28 for a pizza that was greasy and bleh. Secret Pizza Place in Cosmo next time. Although it doesn't seem like much of a secret anymore.

9LfV25ybtrMf8y_VB8DKZg.text: A year later and we had a nice pizza lunch at Five50. Service was quick and attentive. Water glasses were promptly filled and everything was great... except,  the same issue with the pizza centers being thinner than the rest of the pizza where it even caused one piece that was being pulled from the pizza pan to leave the 'tip' of the slice behind. Pizza flavors were great and being the creatures of habit that we are, we still got the margherita and the Gotham pizza. We got the chef's choice charcuterie board. The Humboldt Fog goat cheese spread so smoothly like a soft cream cheese over the crostini to make a perfect little spot for the cured meats. I better stop, I want more. Found out, by the way, the cheese is at Whole Foods. First stop when I get home.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chef&#39;s choice meat and cheese board. Yummy

ViEPkQ8LYTMl_vVrjYeIuQ.text: Food was good.  Service was terrible. Server did not come around for about 10 minutes. When we ordered our food, we then waited for 30 minutes before asking to see our server.  He had said the ticket was "lost" with no explanation or apology. Food came out shortly thereafter. Also, beer that was ordered was not correct. We had to ask for our server again to get the bill, and then ask for him again so we could pay it. Very poor experience overall and was disappointed that this type of service was part of The Aria.

lqGjMCa3cbBdovwsKBFzww.text: The pizza was great but the meatballs is another story.  I suggest you get the pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CLH7Ud-VWI7PkZ55vceb7g.text: Can never go wrong with pizza flatbread pepperoni pastrami gotta love it when you're drunk

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SsIyORrspTyqzvskWehprg.text: After a long day at work and just wanting a quick meal so I could hurry off to my room and go to bed, (yes I was in Vegas, no I wasn't gambling) my friend and I decided on Five50 and SO happy we did!  What a pleasant surprise for my taste buds!  My friend ordered the meatball sandwich and I ordered the eggplant sandwich and we both shared a salad since the sandwiches didn't come with sides and we thought we would need more food.  WRONG!  Our meals would have been plenty!  Both sandwiches were stupendous.  Full of flavor and textures and cooked to perfection...and OH those meatballs!!  The salad was a nice addition but overall it was far too much food for us to finish.  We were so stuffed that we weren't able to partake in what looked like some fabulous classic milk shakes!  Overall I was VERY pleased and next time I stay at Aria will come back for the wood-fired pizza!!  GOOD STUFF!  OH....and our server was excellent!  Very attentive and a great personality to boot!

3rcejyH8i094GQFoMw5PUA.text: Went to the take out counter and ordered 2 white slice pizzas at $5.50 each.  I'd have to say that they were really good.  I wanted to pick up the 5 cheese, but knew it would bring up my cost.  So I just go one for me and my man.  For sure I'd go back here to grab another slice sometime.  Yum.

kTH04jBxwy1KThOmqaMmhg.text: Came here when I was staying at the Aria.   I did not know what to expect. I was in for a surprise. I ordered a salad and a pizza and it was delicious! They also have a great beer selection!   Better than a lot of pizza joints on the strip!   I even came here one night and it was really late. I remembered they served slices. Oh man! It hit the spot! They were hot out the oven and tasted like heaven.   I will definitely be back.

R99Ua7qJ-_eBvISoHUXIQA.text: Girl was kind enough to tell me that I always don't tip when I purchase my Pizza to go.  I've been a server/host for 5 years so I guess I don't know a thing about tipping? I guess it takes real skill to put my Pizza on a plate and ring me out at the register? I mean if she was my waitress of course I would tip her. I don't think I'm going to feel comfortable purchasing a Pizza here again...

1ZWWdXMp93fyRsPS5EiUvQ.text: Pizza was ok.  Service was not.  Took over 20 minutes of us asking twice to get a beer on a not busy night.  Also charged 50 cents for balsamic on a already over priced pizza.  Our server was awful all together.  Never came by never got water like we asked multiple times.  Don't come here unless you like wasting money on ok good and horrible service !!!!

_kZlUXIG8hcbpoIkHXHIeA.text: Had a late lunch, early dinner here. Casual dining with some nice beers on tap and LOTS of whiskeys. The other reviews that said you can order slices... for clarification, thats's for 'to go' only not dine in. There are a few stand up tables nearby where folks were enjoying their slice. For two of us dining in, we shared a chopped salad (about $14) and a pizza (1/2 & 1/2 for us each to pick our favorite toppings). The salad was good, fresh, and satisfying. Not huge, and not a lot of the salami and other things, mostly lettuce. The pizza, mmmm... as others were being delivered around us, we could hardly wait for ours to arrive. It didn't take too long and bam, great pizza arrived looking and smelling great. It had a nice crisp crust, and just the right amount of sauce, cheese, and toppings. The mushroom pizza was great - creaming and cheesy. The meat lovers (name I can't recall) was the perfect version of itself. For a casual meal in a hotel, the ambiance was great, felt like a nice local brewpub with pizza. The price for 2 beers, a pizza and salad came to about $70, so not cheap, however very good.

i2G7nK4SYKV0uEVPG5gujQ.text: The blanca pizza that my husband and I shared for an early dinner before catching the Cirque du Soleil MJ One show, was amazing! This place even carried my favorite beer in the whole wide world, Fruli! I gave this place four stars instead of five because our waitress seemed moody. But either way, I would definitely go back. :)

bn6aCykKYWL4SywYcb9pew.text: What a fun and hip spot outside the sportsbook at Aria.  We just had two slices-cheese with a white sauce and basil and meat.  Both were yummy.  I love the space and location and will be back!

Xdrkio26PepzsCZT-CAQCw.text: Very nice and relaxing atmosphere.  Pizza and garlic bread were very good.  312 on tap was nice.

Tg0Vv4eYODF_3016aI7KSQ.text: The pizzas by the slice at the counter are good and a great easy option at the Aria. the sit down pizza is really good! We went for lunch and got the forager pizza and it was excellent. Good quality toppings and a great crust. Pricey at $27 but a much cheaper option for 2 people than practically anything else at the hotel. We will go back

J9tqlH3yQxgUeomuk1UtTQ.text: I'm so happy I happened to see a guy carrying a slice because it was SOOO good!!  I grabbed a slice from the line (didn't sit down or get serviced) after zero wait.  There were four options available: margherita, blanca, forager (had mushrooms), and pepperoni.  I got the margherita and it was AMAZING!!  It was a generous slice that was definitely big enough to be a meal.  My friend came back later in the day and got the blanca slice.  Each slice was appropriately $5.50, $5.95 with tax.  I'd highly recommend it!  Yummm!

MX3ouNZG3Su1EK0odzqJSg.text: Great pizza, must ask for extra sauce though to make it extra delicious. The basil and wood fried tomato was an excellent pick. I know it was great pizza because I wanted to eat one more slice even while I was already full, I couldn't just leave anything behind.

eqCk07I6Fxw_K9eW1uDr7g.text: Had the bucatini it was great.  My girlfriend had the pizza it took long to come out but it was great as well.  Fun place to go.  Very loud and crowded on football game days.

cToWcXg6HtwVXc8l5RmU1g.text: Awesome beer selection both in bottle and draft. Seem to have a nice rotation of beers through their establishment. Service is great. Food is amazing. Do yourself a favor and get the truffle pizza without the potatoes, and have them add on some of their jalapenos. They get the jalapenos fresh and pickle them. They complement the richness of the pizza quite well. Don't forget to start with their chicken wings accompanied by their homemade bleu cheese dressing. Also, the Five50 chopped salad is a must. Its like antipasti meets salad in a bowl and throws a party. It has so many textures and flavors, and the vinaigrette on the salad keeps you salivating for more. Do yourself another favor and wash it down with a pint or two of their seasonal Citradelic Tangerine IPA made by New Belgium that they have on draft.It is quite evident with even just a small sampling of their food that this is a chef driven restaurant with solid grub and a beer selection to top it off.

78ssPyS1JoQX_kMe44vhZw.text: Had the bucatini & meatballs. The bucatini & sauce were delicious but did not like the meatballs. They had raisins mixed in. I had the large portion & for the price it was way overpriced.

A1duMgWqwvDdR-tRgse0Mw.text: Awesome place!  Great food, great staff.  Aaron was very knowledgable about the entire menu and was very helpful.  If you have the opportunity, check out this spot while in Vegas, do it!  I highly recommend the Gotham and/or Farmstead.

LdqwaI-omu_0fpe8RXwrnA.text: I have dined here several times and always enjoy the experience! The cheese bread and margherita pizza are delicious. I had to deduct a star because, in the middle of our last meal, we were asked by the hostess to move to accommodate a large party . . . really? Regardless, I'll be back on my next visit!

SWxDJywioNqKENAll4UK_g.text: This pizza is so ridiculously greasy and gross. We were the only people in line and it took forever to get 2 slices to go! probably because the Cashier was desperately trying to hit on my husband. Where do I even begin about the tacky and unhelpful staff?! We stopped by here to grab a quick bite before heading to our room after check in. The cashier was unbelievably rude and gross! We had a resort credit of $100 to use on charges in the casino, which was given to us by Aria. When we went to pay for our order and informed her of wanting to charge the order to our room, she said we were blocked and unable to make room charges. Directing me to take it up with the front desk while eye screwing my husband, instead of checking into the issue by calling the front desk, which the front desk at aria informed me was all she had to do.  My husband was disgusted that this girl with piercings and a 90's skater girl/punk look was hitting on him. Just a tip for their cashier staff, hitting on customers while you are a cashier at a pizza place is probably not going to work in your favor honey. Gross and embarrassing!  1 star is given for her efforts in trying to flirt with a married man in front of his wife. Pathetic!

XC0051LhbL7zvJmZYHfdYg.text: Really great pizza and wonderful service! We were in Vegas from Sacramento. One of our party had eaten there before and claimed it was her "favorite" pizza so I was edited to try it! It was really great!! It will be on the list for every Vegas trip from now on!

k_Aaarcb3DpzUPONtq19cw.text: 12/15/2014   This pizza place is superb and by Vegas casino standards, inexpensive. Massive slices of delicious pizza at $5.50 a slice or you can order  lunch or dinner pizza/pasta/salads etc. Located in the Aria hotel on the casino level between the poker room and sports book it gets really busy so try and go at off times. The service is also fantastic as they go out of their way to accommodate any and all special requests. Although  the pasta and meatball entree is  incredibly enticing, in the end I personally love the five cheese pizza (it's a little greasy, but every great pizza has to have some grease). Clearly the high quality of all the ingredients coupled with the proper care in preparing their menu makes the difference. Turns out Five50 is operated by well know chef Shawn McClain (Sage restaurant among others), who I had the pleasure of meeting when he was actually working behind the bar in the restaurant one night. Nice guy, but more importantly- great pizza! Here is a tip: their desserts are also incredible, in fact on my bday they treated me to this delicious milk shake type creation  -fantastic! Kudos to the GM and all the staff at Five50 - thanks for making it my go to restaurant in Vegas

tDHDgiffqshhKAWJom7v4Q.text: I was hesitant to try pizza in Vegas as there are so many other options to try.  We were looking for a light lunch and a slice of margherita pizza hit the spot  It was a cute place to watch a football game, have a beer and slice of pizza to get away from the smokiness of the casinos.  What can I say, I'm a sucker for thin crust, brick oven pizza.  I recommend this to anyone who stops by the Aria.

xsfbY3Monz5dX_mcnV9-vg.text: Good and convenient for a quick slice of fast food at aria.  There's nothing else to grab fast food in this casino.  Servers were nice and friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Five50 Pizza Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6aB4ku3eLKxzotkCIU3ryw.text: This place has a great atmosphere & friendly service with delicious pizza. The only drawback is that they are VERY slow even when the restaurant is only a 1/3 full. Otherwise, we would have given it 5 stars. Don't come here unless you have time to relax & wait. We waited almost an hour for 1 pizza.

9lxJrUSwW361k7KEdCC0LA.text: I love inside walls very kool looking..clams & linguica suasage with bread very good..and the gotham and blanca pizzas were my favs

mRAFCSG-Na5YSfTPWnVULQ.text: Awesome pizzas, but definitely order off the regular menu!!! The pastas are homemade, the giardinara is the bet I've had, and the desserts are created by the pastry chef from Sage! Homemade gelatos and ice cream sandwiches should not be missed!

qTG25LM2Pd52rJW_zFjZng.text: This place is rather new, the food is great tried the pasta and a few salads. Good flavor combinations and well executed. The service is however a little slow. Tried the pizza both the mushroom  and white we're great.
